ogBZlC2xouiKuepVmV9FOg.text: I've eaten indian food in several different locations in town there selection to be appetizing and the dishes to be delicious.  The staff was very courteous and friendly and the food was very tasty I love the vegetarian biriyani was delicious and I love the time tandoori lamb combined with the nan bread garlic and regular was a perfect meal for my daughter and I. definitely will go back again.

btPAHbkM5pE0wLr_UMMtuA.text: This is one of my favorites places, I dine in or out at least 2-3 times a week!  The lunch buffet is a great deal, look for the coupons that float around in local mags, we've gotten ours from the 89012 mag.  * Lunch Buffet - 11.00 a.m. - 3.00 p.m. * Dinner - 5.00 p.m. - 10.30 p.m.  * Special Buffet Prices - Monday to Sunday: $10.95 / person  The staff is, as they say from their website, "Guest is as good as God" ...well, I wouldn't go thaaaaaaaat far, but they've ALWAYS been incredibly friendly, attentive and happy to see me (I'm their golden goose). It's not cheap, so don't roll in expecting $10/person.  Being a vegetarian, (which Indian culuture is as well) they have an excellent selection of lentils and meat-less dishes, my favorite, the Yellow Dal, a sh*t ton of Naan and a side of tamrin sauce.  Delish!  My carnivore husband loves the lamb & the Peas Pillau (a yummy rice with peas, raisins & nuts)  I would give Taj 5 stars if it wasn't for the consistency.  On a few occasions, I've ordered the usual, gotten it home and it tasted crappy!  I've phoned in everytime after and they've apologized and offered to pay for my next order.  Different chef working that night :/   Overall, LOVE!! :)

s22R_DonQy9gBFWraXmtog.text: Finally, a place that rivals anything we've had in Surrey, which is a large Indo-Canadian neighbourhood outside Vancouver. The mixed tandoori grill is terrific and very low in fat. The lamb biryani was so tender we barely had to chew. I'm almost sorry we found this place, as all my diet plans are now totally out the window.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetables in korma sauce. Unreal.

H_NrL-EMER8TDf4OQt_jtQ.text: We go to Taj for lunch every time we crave some Indian food. Love the many options in buffet. Wish they had a few more dessert options though, but rice pudding hits the spot every time. The staff is efficient and we can get back to office wishing the lunch hour time.

41L2IQzOU8V2qb8Q4xj25w.text: Honest to goodness worst service I have ever experience. Number 1 we should not have to track down a server just to get service.  They took everyone's order but mines and my husband, and to top the cake they forgot to serve us our food. Their utensils had left over crusty food from the last person whom used it.  One girl in our party found a piece of very thick hair in her chicken curry.  The manager is so rude on the phone. I asked him a question on the phone while making reservations and what did he tell me..."ma'am I'm very busy right now, can you call back later or just come down to ask your question wth!" Never again. Not worth the $257 we paid to eat here.

kMe0KfIeVARvzzhjVoptWg.text: We have gone to the Taj Palace restaurant several times, and have found the food to be very delicious and service excellent.  The inside decor is very nice, giving it a good ambiance for pleasurable eating.  If you like chicken as I do try the different spices.  I liked them all except the mint.  Overall rating: 5 stars!

wBH1NEpCOeMp0gD1yqbjLA.text: The Good:  Of all the Indian restaurants in town, Taj Palace is one of the best.  Their dinner menu is so distinctive and it stands out of all the menus in town.  Their food is rich in flavor, content, and taste. This might be sneaky, but I got a good look at their kitchen when I was walking to use washroom- their kitchen is huge and from all that I've seen, it is spotless clean.  That showed in the quality of their food and its taste.   Service was good.   The Bad:  Nothing. Nada!  If you insist, I still don't have anything.   Bottom line:  If you live in Las Vegas and you are craving Indian, this is the place I recommend you go.  I will go back there soon to try out their lunch buffet.

T4PKZONDi3USeAurnqpR4A.text: Sitting in Taj waiting for my pick up order and they are nice enough to give a homeless man food and even a few dollars for him to go get some ice for his sore back.  Haven't tried the food yet but they get 5 stars in my book for their kindness.  They could just run him off or threaten to call the police like most establishments would, instead they do their small part to give to those less fortunate.

SNR3ocDCSj_2xFauqEUbLA.text: Ate here last night and food and menu was amazing , service was top notch , it's my third time eating Indian food but this was my best experience , the waiter was extremely knowledgable and friendly and even suggested a dish that was chicken cooked in coconut milk and spices that was not only healthy but amazingly good , it's close to my house and I'll definitely be back !

uT1hr-ptf1TIUSDHbt_Vqg.text: We love coming here.... we uaually come at least 1 time per month.   The staff is always friendly, the place is very clean, and the food is spicey.   We love the Garlic Naan and the Tikka  Masala.   We have tried all the Indian restaurants in the Vegas area, and none come close!!  Price is about 10.99 and worth every penny.

YFFM_p44gaUvDt_X07ukUA.text: I visited last night with some friends and had some nice cold Indian Beer and really awesome Chili Chicken.  Please try it when you are there.... you will not be disappointed.  We also ordered other food and that was great too.  Nice Place, Reasonable Price, Good Quality Food,  Great Service & Very Clean Bathrooms.  Binoo, Elvis & the rest of the crew....you guys ROCK !!!

CeglPsjAoHIhlWXyQ5IQgw.text: I took a chance when my co-worker opted to order from this place. I stayed safe and ordered a couple of appetizers and lentil soup. What a pleasant surprise, the food was DELICIOUS!!! the spice level and flavor were spot on and I didn't have to grab any salt nor pepper. So this will be the next "date night" for hubby and myself.  Be adventurous people!!

dguvi6-EMA0ZmKaH4fCkXw.text: This was my first time ever having Indian food, so I can not compare to any other places. What I can share is that our food was Delicious!!! The flavor and aroma was like nothing I've ever experienced. My husband and I ordered the veggie samosa, chicken tikka, and garlic naan bread. This was plenty of food for us to share. I ordered the chicken tikka with medium spice and it was perfect! (We both enjoy spicy food). We both agreed that we would order all three of those items again but I can't wait to go back to taj palace and try some more from the large menu!

xRwrFay3aP5ox3s-D0QNgw.text: This place is beyond amazing. Been there over 5 times and every time I go in, it only seems to get better. They have a variety of options that are truly tasteful. The service is great as well.   Definitely go for the lunch buffet. It's awesome.

c3K2dLicWgPIexPcPFrFwQ.text: Best Indian food in Vegas. The servers make great recommendations too if you're feeling adventurous.

_qF7IFrJDafLP3izUfiNDg.text: FOOD POISON. Came here for their lunch buffet, went home and had a severe case of food poison. My symptoms were excruciating and painful. Had to nurse myself back to homeostatic state. Being a healthcare provider, I know for sure, the food poison was from this restaurant.   I will not return. This was the place I would get my Indian food fix, but after my food poison incident yday, I will not step my foot in this restaurant. It's a shame!

iTBxnDZwQu8iBvFuShY02Q.text: I've been coming here since this place was called Taza, then Jai Ho, and now Taj Palace.  I'm not sure why the name changes but either way the food is always good.  I by no means am an Indian Food expert but my experiences here are always good.  The curries are as spicy as you want them.  The nan is delicious (I love the garlic nan), and the Tandoori chicken is always piping hot and tasty.    If you're not familiar with Indian food or really hungry, be sure to hit up their lunch buffet.  There are a lot of choices at a very reasonable price.  The servers are also very helpful as I try to order something new on each visit.  Also, be sure to keep an eye out in local publications for coupons and specials!

8GriGfU7MRHOTMWHDBPJTg.text: I ate at this place about two years ago with a friend who was a curry fiend. I remembered the meal I had was pretty good, so when we got some coupons in the mail the wife and I decided to go again.  I'm in no way or form an expert on Indian food as I've always enjoyed the east Asian curries more, so the wife and I played it safe and went with a full order of Tandoori Murgh Shahnaz (marinated baked chicken on the bone) and Jhinga Tikka Masala (prawns with onion and peppers in a tomato cream sauce). On the side was garlic naan and white rice.  The chicken, being thighs and legs, was as good as I remembered. Served a sizzling cast iron plate on a bed of onions and peppers. They managed to render out most of the fat while cooking (thanks to the clay oven), but managed to keep all of the flavor.  The prawn dish was delicious, but for $16 I would expect more prawns or at least bigger ones. The highlight of the dish was the tomato cream sauce that found it's way on top of my chicken rapped in naan.  The service was quick, attentive, and funny. When I ordered both dished with the rice & naan combo add on for $5 the waiter suggested just a double order of naan and a single order of rice. That kind of customer service is very highly appreciated.  When it came time to go we had some left overs that definitely earned a trip home with us. I appreciate it when a restaurant gives you decent to-go containers and these guys didn't attempt to have us shove everything in one big Styrofoam container but gave us smaller ones for each component of the meal. Perhaps a silly thing to comment on, but I like it when my left-overs look just as good as the day I ordered them.  Is this an "authentic Indian" restaurant? Damned if I know, but since the staff is Indian and very friendly I imagine if you flexed your knowledge they'll be accommodating.

zFlbnfSMPICAMCe9eZPzig.text: I went to Taj Palace tonight for a celebration dinner and I was so impressed.  Everything was delicious!  I am not an expert on Indian cuisine but I loved everything we had.  Service was great and atmosphere was very nice.

i9yT8DLTDqylZIN7RQ--jQ.text: Not the worst Indian restaurant in Las Vegas, but absolutely not deserving of a 4.5 Yelp rating.   When we visited the buffet was uninspired, featured no paneer option, and was severely lacking in spice and overall layers of flavour. It felt geared toward middle America's palate rather than those of expats from the sub-continent and those of us with a bit of experience in the True heavenly flavours of the region.   Give me a good curry and some tasty naan to mop up the sauce and I am happy. Sadly, Taj Palace presented my usual go to dish, the chicken tikka masala, as a disappointinging bland, rather sweet, and lacking any real zest and the naan was almost tasteless.  The food looked OK, but this is the sort of Indian a grandparent would eat. I'll stick to Mint or Mt Everest.

uwxhvA2ELJeU4iX7XBFfvw.text: This is my favorite place for Indian! The food is delicious and the service is excellent. Our waiter Mr. Vishal B, is one of the best waiters I had in so many years. Even my baby gave him a high five!

dkhoN7P54pcDEs9W1maNMQ.text: Staff ignored me and went so far as to walk around me instead of assisting me. I felt like they had something against me it was very unpleasant.

d_13cm8n4k0qyyBbWN-pYw.text: This place is amazing! The food was full of flavor and the service was excellent. Everyone was very friendly. The garlic nan was delicious!  We are definitely coming back!

CF_cPuaUn47OPSrhH64yYg.text: Just arrived at Vegas after a long journey and this place was the best stop for dinner. The food was delicious and the staff was very kind and helpful. Thank you Vishal Badiyani for making this time here even better by quickly processing our requests with a sweet smile.   Will be back soon.

6KwzRloZG89zFmbkn6CIxA.text: Had lunch, they only serve a buffet for lunch. I hate buffets. It was delicious, hot, and fresh. I 'l doe it again.

6nSQz_SVoQ9Xhs3uwxbSgA.text: Foods always really amazing. Our server Vishad was really nice and made the experience all much better. Ask for him when you go!

yoqjJcitg_CrDtJcyz8KjQ.text: We went on a Saturday afternoon for the buffet. I love trying a little bit of everything. The garlic naan is delicious! I don't remember the names of all the food I tried but it was all good. I think my fav was the egg curry. The curry sauce was really good!

gyZtBx18RR6GoGg9aQWd6w.text: This is by far the best Indian food I have had when in vegas. Lets start with location. It pretty much accessible from the street and is located in a market complex with other good options for foodies. Now lets look at their menu. Menu is pretty much what every Indian restaurant offers in the States. But you may dig out a few extra ordinary items just like I did. Spicy Haryali chicken is awesome. Dont be fooled by its name its spicynesa can be controlled at the time of ordering. We ordered level 8 and our server suggested to bring it down to level 7 coz 8 would've been really spicy. 9-10 are out of question. Never do that in an Indian Restaurant. The breads are really soft and one of the best I have had ever in the US. Ordered garlic nan and butter tandoori roti. Next and always a must for us is biryani. Its not your regular dumm biryani but quite good spicy and boneless tikka chicken biryani. Overall I am too choosy when it comes to biryanis, yet i would rate this at 7 on 10.   Overall a good dinig place and really the best Indian food option when in vegas. Avoid those junk places that offer cheap buffet dinners. Will surely visit again when back in sin city.

6EV8Gc68GQMUX-LoZIgM5A.text: Ate lunch there yesterday and loved it. The buffet looked delicious, but we ordered off the menu to make sure the food wasn't too spicy for us. Everything was superb--lamb curry, butter chicken, vegetable Korma. The service was attentive and friendly. Highly recommend this place.

wTIRvtM3grhA15KsDulong.text: This place was so amazing! Great authentic Indian food. Tasted so fantastic and fresh. The spices were incredible and flavorful! The service was great the servers were very attentive  it was so nice. I definitely recommend this place

7wbnuJfasZlOm00o4nEykA.text: I've been here several times for their lunch buffet. There's a nice selection of veggies, chicken dishes, and a salad bar. Some of the food is extremely spicy, so, I have to watch the super hot dishes, but everything is very tasty. I wish they would use fresh spinach, rather than frozen, but so far I haven't come across that at any Indian restaurant in Vegas.  It also has a nice atmosphere, and the service is very good. the only thing I miss here is that they do not have a lamb dish at the buffet. But, for a $12 Sunday brunch meal, I guess you can't complain. A couple of times, I was the only non-Indian person there, so you know you are in the right place!

TEJphByj92HuhSy5lrpamQ.text: Wow! Food was amazing! My stomach is still getting used to Indian food, but this was excellent. Definitely going back for more!

QuLD0rBAlHCTrbIOO0sWTQ.text: Amazing buffet for a really good price, chicken massala with rice: Nami!!! Spinach and bread amazing too. A sweet ending with the rice pudding with a nice touch of ginger.  The customer service is pretty good and the place looks clean and pretty. We will come back for sure!

24uALx-phNYB90aerHTNHw.text: My first time trying Indian food! What a great place to try something for the first time!  When walking into an Indian restaurant for the first time, the smell of the spices and herbs they use hits you pretty hard. It was very surprising. It grows on you though.  With my lack of knowledge with Indian food, I just let Nieves D. & Carl I. Take the wheel and order the food.  For starters they bring out their version of Chips & salsa. it's a very thin seasoned chip that you can break.. and for the dips it includes a green spicy dip and a sweet tangy dip. Both quite Delish.   Tikka Masala Saucy chicken- I can't even explain how delicious this was. The sauce had the right amount of spices to give a good kick. The chicken in it just melted in my mouth it was so good. Was not dry at all.   Tandoori sizzling chicken- we got a whole chicken and it was more than enough for us. The most moist chicken I ever had! Again, the spices used give the chicken so much flavor. Spices that I have never tasted before. Chicken was cooked above perfection.   Lamb spicy coconut curry- I'm not really a fan of lamb so I just took a bite and decided to stick with the chicken. But the sauce the lamb was swimming in was pretty damn good. If it had a different meat in it, I'd probably devour it.   Garlic Naan- Their version of garlic bread. You can dip the bread in the sauces of the dishes you order and it pairs up quite well.   You get this mango shake when you check in. The service was good, the food just took forever to com out. But it was defiantly worth the wait! They even brought out mango ice cream with a candle for my birthday! What a great birthday dinner!

FBskUGrt0OIGbVo0546eIw.text: Nice lunch buffet! Service was okay, food was very authentic, and the garlic naan was incredible. Good location near a lot of everything if someone in your group does not want Indian food...it was crowded even at 2pm, but I got sat right away. Well worth the value. The samosas are some of the best I have had!

BbVLAgy3CcNVwGA8qmGIqA.text: I've been here many times before with friends & family for their lunch buffet & would have given them 5 stars each time for the array, freshness & taste of food, & fine service by all the Indian young men. However, yesterday's Mother's Day dinner was shockingly disappointing. I asked for Mango Lassi & Chicken Biryani, which came with a mountain of days-old Biryani rice, not more than 5 tiny bite bits of left-over Chicken pieces, & a watery Raita without any cucumber. The Biryani cost $15. That was simply just RICE! I asked for some curry gravy to make it palatable. The answer was No, spoken graciously but certainly mindlessly. I packed & left.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A mountain of days-old biryani rice with hardly any chicken bits, &amp; watery raita w/o cucumbers.

Sgx0-DxeMAWjrWFrcX2EzQ.text: Been here about a couple times now and I must say I like the place. Service has been pretty good, the staff are friendly and attentive. The food takes longer to make and prep, in my opinion, but worth the wait as soon as you get to eating!  What I've gotten the last two visits are the infamous Tikka Masala and Chicken Tandoori.  Tikka Masala - famous dish in all Indian places that they guarantee all first timers will like. Pieces of moist, tender chicken cooked in a tomato-y, gingery sauce! Very rich and hearty! Suggest you dip their freshly baked Garlic Naan in this sauce!  Chicken Tandoori - sizzling, marinated chicken cooked in the tandoor, on a bed of peppers and onions. Seasoned very well, comes out in the red color because of the spices. Moist and a little spicy for my palette but I still love the dish! Great to eat with their Basmati Rice!  I'm glad we took our friend, Sandra R, here for her first time. A bit scared at first because she hated the smell that ALL Indian places have. She liked it, definitely ate everything on her plate. Upon paying and getting ready to leave, the waiter was so sweet, providing a small bowl of mango ice cream and put a candle on it because it was her birthday.   Small gestures are a plus! Will definitely be coming back when craving Indian food! I hope to try their buffet style one day, but available only from Monday - Sunday 11:00am to 3:00pm.

7eV8VQx87-uXh4tSOE9nRw.text: We had the chicken Tikka Masala, lamb Biryani, and garlic naan bread and I am completely satisfied!! This was much better than I was expecting. Great flavors and huge portions. This is coming from a guy who eats a lot. Haha. All in all.... definitely coming back!!

t1PuBvvtvCjQ4wgvA1DhHw.text: Went here for the lunch buffet yesterday and it was great! Just what I needed on a cloudy beginning of fall day. They had saag which I was happy about since normally Indian lunch buffets I go to don't have that. I also got the chicken tikka, Garlic naan, and a couple other things I don't remember. $12 in total, I'll be back!

OCxPZixP4c1mbaf0SfIjeQ.text: The last time I ordered take out from this place I got extremely burnt naan bread. Willing and excited to give them another try, I put special instructions on my next take out order for non burnt naan bread....   Still got some. Really wanted to like this place because the rest of my order wasn't bad But this killed it for me. Not ordering from them again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt naan

qc3_nYeOpbxDlTLathIDmA.text: Just noticed a picture of Iron Mike Tyson posing with the owner, so apparently this must be a local favorite of his.    I came here awhile back for the lunch buffet and while the selection was fairly extensive, the single item that beckoned me to return was their garlic naan.   Served piping hot straight from the tandoori oven, the aroma is ethereal and it is one of the best I have ever had.  If you wait too long, the soft pillowy texture transforms into a stale saltine cracker-like consistency so please don't hold anything back and just attack that naan like Tyson on Holyfield's ear.  I try to rate Indian restaurants on their regular menu rather than buffet since there can often be a steep drop off in quality of food although their buffet is somewhere between 3-4 stars.  On my return visit with a friend for dinner, we ordered the Goat Vindaloo and the Malai Kofta (vegetable balls served in a heavy cream sauce loaded with spices such as cumin, coriander, and chili) and a side of the chili garlic naan.   The server will ask you to give a number from 1-10 regarding spice level.  We chose 7 for the vindaloo and 5 for our vegetarian entry.  Combined with the chili garlic naan, our tastebuds were on overdrive for most of the meal and in retrospect, I think the garlic naan is perfect on its own minus the chilis and 5 is plenty of spice to perk up the flavors without constantly reaching for water.    The goat in the tangy and hot vindaloo sauce was amazingly tender and very flavorful and was accompanied by some nice hunks of potato.  I actually didn't mind the fact that some of the pieces were still attached to bone since those were some of the best parts.   The malai kofta balls were savory with the vegetable component, slightly sweet in part due to some raisins within the mixture, and the complex sauce was both creamy and spicy providing a beautiful spectrum of flavors.    Throw in the beautiful interior, nice choice in silverware and plating, and the excellent service, this is a great option for those venturing out to Henderson in the mood for something off the beaten path.  Do take advantage of the $5 off dinner coupon for checking in on Yelp and do not leave without partaking in the garlic naan.

qOQLxP2QMUhKjx2w6cQaOA.text: Haven't had authentic Indian apart from the sectional theme at the buffet. However even though this place is buffet style, they manage to keep every dish, tasty, juicy and not over cooked. Ambiance was great, staff was extremely professional, and my overall first time experience was great. I would definitely come back again for my tandoori cravings.

IYG1aNMgW4KQS0H0kSUXkw.text: I love their food, the prices are reasonable, the employees are friendly and professional, but both times I've been there I've ended up with a terrible stomach ache. It makes me sad because it's so close to home and so tasty!

NVGnbQh6Y7SnMlYvjL1uJw.text: I've been to a lot of Indian restaurants & have eaten a lot of authentic Indian food (bc I'm part Indian) so I've eaten better Indian food. Butter chicken is my fav and the one here is just okay. It is so expensive for take out or dine in so go during buffet hours. This prob wouldn't be my everyday restaurant, only when I crave Indian food & I have no other Indian restaurants to choose from.

f5OX8yfbt0Z8Xk_kdzO37Q.text: The best Indian food ive ever had! Am from New Jersey, where there are so many Indian restaurants, but none like this! The buffet spread was so good and the food was too delicious!

tUftalX45pPuFaayqTBxlg.text: Came here with a large group on a not so busy night. I was quite impressed with the service and the food. The naan was tasty and so were the curries. Also got a nice mango lassi with the check-in that hit the mango lassi spot! A good spot to hit up for some Indian food if you're a local. Or even if you're just visiting and craving Indian.

6MjPZTW0w9p4lRA8jl1j-A.text: It's an OK, Indian restaurant. Only reasons why its getting all the positive reviews is because its the only one in Henderson (specially on Eastern). I had their lunch buffet which was so-so, curries were cold and sort of tasteless. They were running low on food at the buffet and the rice was abysmal. How do you screw up rice? The best thing about this place is their garlic naan. I think its the freshsest naan I ever had at a buffet.  There are better restaurants in Vegas, if you want good food, then go to Namaste or Mint Indian Bistro.

O-_W4NUNcNWMNG6QGzSFCg.text: AUTHENTIC! My good friend Tanuj is from India and his Uncle owns this amazing place. Food is high quality and the service is excellent. My favorites are the Lamb and Shrimp Curry. The best in Vegas!

xcbo_FyHOM-FK03S-52mWQ.text: Amazing lunch buffet. One of my favorite places in town. Will be back again. If say probably the top Indian place in Henderson. The Chicken curry is super good. It does get busy so the weekends so plan to wait a few for a table.... But it's worth it.

zfRU5jVg2flxpJso2J7inw.text: The food was good but not the best I've tasted. I had the saag, tikka masala, and garlic naan.

NJjBDJUbananSaGSeXvAag.text: Came here for dinner with a bunch of friends and got seated right away since it wasn't busy at all. The ambiance is nice and relaxing. There was some incense burning and although the smell wasn't really all that pleasant, I got over it eventually and didn't think much of it.  For our dinner outing, I opted for the paneer tikka masala paired up with some garlic naan. The food was alright but nothing to write home about. I thought the tikka masala lacked flavor and the naan was a bit dry in comparison to what I am used to at other places. Other people in my party ordered the chicken tikka masala and I decided to get in on it just to see if there was any difference in flavor between the two. Surprisingly, there was not. Oh well.. I came to get fed and that happened so I guess I'm good haha. Luckily, someone in our group had a coupon to take off some of the damage from the bill.  Not bad but not enticed to come here on a regular/semi-regular basis. I'd probably give it another chance but might expand to other options on the menu instead of my usual Indian comfort dinner dish. We'll see..

gTgBPDwsBPl099yW3nYcGw.text: Best Indian lunch Buffett in Las Vegas, the food quality is consistent, the staff is friendly, affordable priced, you can't go wrong if you like Indian food.  The Garlic naan is outstanding and the Chicken Tikka Masala is the best I ever had.  Try it!

XHc9edAxnCxQPxpZ3yI8Pw.text: We ordered Karahi, Chicken Tika Masala and one more dish called Buryani here and loved all of them. Their garlic bread was amazing! I have had Indian before and this was literally the best. All items were super tasty and flavorful. We had to order a second garlic bread , I can take 10 more home. The service is great as well. Totally worth coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great taste and service!

EilYJ-6V4D8aImSIw50RNA.text: Seven days a week, 11-3, Taj Palace has a lunch buffet for $9.99.  Located in the the shopping center on Eastern and Richmar, this new Indian restaurant is rich in decor and cuisine. The hand painted tapestry style wall mural, lantern style light fixtures, and open lighting gives a bright look that most Indian places lack. The service was the best I have had in a long time. As we sat ourselves, the waiter came over to ask what kind of naan we would like and filled our water glasses. Throughout the meal, our dirty plates never stayed on the table for more than 5 minutes, if even that long. Water glasses were promptly refilled at the half way mark as well.   The food was consistent. I found that I did not hate anything, but the tandoori chicken was dry. The garlic naan is amazing. When brought out, it was piping hot and topped with a copious amount of garlic. The line had two different kinds of rice; basmati and a vegetable biryani. They also had somosas that were tasty. The saag (spinach) here was delicious, but did not have the paneer (handmade cheese). The other non-meat dish I really liked was the veggies in the yellow curry. For those who love their meat, do not fret, because Taj Palace offer some dishes for the carnivores as well. The chicken tikka masala was creamy and possessed a deep, rich flavor. The goat curry was tender and not gamey. Do not forget to get a bowl of the kheer (rice pudding) before leaving. Taj Palace's version is not too sweet and has cashews for a nice crunch. It was the perfect end to a great meal.

pp3W86kZSVH5CHXg0Vmqmw.text: We ordered online and were disappointed that our order did not include rice. When we called back the restaurant didn't seem to care. Come for the food (which is great), not the service.

ewdATU_73uM7mH4_f1131w.text: Food was good the first time. We went 2 more times, and the food was bad, like really bad. Half the stuff in the buffet was intermixed and was not clean around the buffet. Second the glass for water smells really bad, get better soap please. But service was good, water was always filled. All in all there is a reason they have not won best of Las Vegas since 2013

OSwai4iZz3pwPjBZl97ONA.text: I wasn't a big fan of Indian food but my GF  talked me into it . I must say ,they have some of the best food I have ever eaten . The flavor of all the food is absolutely mind blowing .  The food is so fresh and the flavorful . My GF said " It was like Christmas in her mouth ". The Chicken Briani , Tikka De Masala , is out of this world . You won't be disappointed , if you are , you must not have taste buds .

UXTowXeQhzf3_0cqF8ixyg.text: Went to the buffet.... very good and look forward to going back. Waiters were very nice and accommodating, and clean establishment.

Rncx4ZZFceW_0NC-F2oOWQ.text: Good food. Good service. They gave my baby a small cup of water.

_x0lYPxPu8PTHsKS2OgUzQ.text: Decided to try this place due to a restaurant.com gift certificate and we are completely glad we did. We ordered the Tandoori Jhinga (shrimp), chicken tikka masala, one regular naan, one garlic naan, and a mango lassi. Everything was great! Chicken tikka masala was spiced just right (..I think we could've handled a bit more spiciness) and shrimp tandoori was yummy. Garlic naan was a bit overcooked so we ordered a regular naan, which was just right. The restaurant itself is in a great location, spacious, with nice ambience. Overall, I'm glad there's an Indian restaurant in the Silverado area definitely worth a repeat visit :)

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tikka masala &amp; shrimp tandoori

Ve8pro9OL-VONsYCfWhabA.text: Great Indian food--best we have had in a long time! The goat curry was excellent! The naan bread was flavorful and tastety.

zA1HwpcCHaSWjz5LjpB8QA.text: Tried it just too. Definately not worth it. Dishes aren't made the same, lacks quality and well flavor. Only thing they got close was the bread. Maybe another time when I really need something different and dont want to spend so much money. Recommend trying some place different.

0KEJ5i6zgLfjsGMySmouHQ.text: Love, love LOVE this place! The decor is authentic and they have a tv that plays music videos from Bollywood- super cute touch.   My hubby and I go here for the buffet which gets you lots of bang for your buck. Everything is fresh and doesn't taste watered down like they're trying to stretch the food out, plus the price is decent. Additionally, the service is great! Very friendly and attentive.   My faves are the the tandoori chicken, the curried chicken and the chicken tikka masala (the latter isn't my tummy's favorite dish but that's another story for another day).   They also give you all-you-can-eat naan (I get garlic naan) with a buffet purchase. Many restaurants make you pay per order for the naan so that's a huge draw for me.  We've eaten here about 5 times and we've never been disappointed!

fbV1R_fhQ-2r4ed5KV2yfg.text: Good food good service. Our little one is bit noisy (Terrible two). But they are nice with us. Thanks Guys .... We come Back....

1zC2N6jEIbB77v9DELVHsA.text: Craving fo Indian Food and this place was nearby our house. The restaurant wasn't busy on a Tuesday evening. We ordered the Lamb Vindaloo and the Chicken Madras curry. A side of garlic naan and buttered prata. The both dishes were so delicious and on point with spices. We ordered spice level 8 and I think the waiter has to repeat to make sure that's the spice levels we ordered. The lamb was very tender and had cubes of potatoes in it. There sauce thickness was just perfect for dunking with the naan. The curries were served with basmati rice. The one item we ordered that wasn't great was the prata. We asked the waiter if they had the roti prata type and they politely apologize they don't make those. Service was friendly and attentive. Will definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Vindaloo and Chicken Madras curry
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Madras Curry Chicken and Lamb Vindaloo

lx4IlkzbkKW3hh4aUcsDeA.text: I love this place! They have a comprehensive menu with both traditional and contemporary menu choices. I highly recommend their lamb chops, lamb samosas, and both the Spicy Chili Garlic Naan with mango Chutney and Peshawari Naan. They also have an eclectic bar menu, and they make great recommendations for drinks that compliment the menu items you ordered.

vKu4xoiyJunVtOKeGLa4vw.text: Ordered the chicken tikka masala, karahi paneer, garlic naan, vegetable samosas, and gulab jamun. First off, everything in my to-go order was packaged so nicely--there were no leaks or spills! Amazing! The chicken tikka masala was excellent and very delicious--I would definitely order it again. The flavors of the karahi paneer were beautiful. However I found the garlic naan and samosas to be just so-so. I have had better elsewhere. The gulab jamun were great. I was surprised that my order came with rice since when I ordered it clearly said rice was not included. I had read the other reviews saying rice wasn't included as well so I prepared basmati rice at home. When I got home with the food I was pleasantly surprised to see that they had given me a large container of rice. Thanks! I'd pick up from here again; had no problems with ordering, pick up and the food was great.

tnQMqbmueb8v9s2LEwfTDA.text: I can't even tell you how much I love this place! The food is absolutely delicious and the service is great as well. There is such an authenticity to their menu and every single option I have tasted thus far, is crave worthy! The owner there is so kind as well. He greets customers and truly takes pride in his restaurant. Highly recommended!

iLOAz4iHleghbVCnpeBJcA.text: One of my favorite Indian restaurants in town, and a regular for my family whether we dine in or take it home to eat. Delicious food and friendly service! The lunch buffet is great, too! Can't beat the price and the unlimited fresh naan that comes with the buffet.

9P3vlNuUJKxmlH-4yMnDpA.text: Wonderful flavorful Indian food. Love the lunch buffet to try so many different types of food. Great service every time I have eaten here. Highly recommend it.

s-BG9nISmx7prf_PdtP6oQ.text: Always looking for really good Indian food when in Vegas. We tried this place because it was near by and had good reviews.   I do not care for buffets at any time of day. They had a lunch buffet for $11.95, which was a really good deal. However, they allowed menu ordering. Yay!!   Lamb samosas were divine with shredded lamb - not ground or sausage. Cooked with perfect seasoning and very moist. It was a hard decision between the mint and tamarind sauce. Both so full of flavor!!  Hubby had Karthi Chicken at 5 level for hotness. It packed a good punch of spice and flavor. Jazmine rice, light and fluffy, as expected.  Tried the mushroom matar curry. Holy moly what a delightful dish, especially with peas. Only possible improvements would be to use different mushrooms - maybe portobello and/ or shiitake?  We did leave with leftovers, which is always delightful! Service was very good. Not sure the AC was working well but it felt a bit warm. Good selection of Indian beer but no Hayward today.

OJo7OmOXvHQhLEVrfqY9-g.text: This place is close to the house and is very good. Huge portions.   This place is located off the strip on Eastern.   The inside is nice. Nice booths. Very large inside. Very casual dining.  Service is very good.  Food comes out very fast. Very attentive.   As for the food - We ordered pretty much everything they had to offer:  Chicken Masala - Not the best in town, but good  Chicken Tikka - Very good  Lamb Josh Rogan - Very good  Garlic Naan - Fire  Biryani Chicken Rice - So good  Mango Chicken Curry - Fire  A few other curries - very good.   Overall - Good flavors. Huge portions! Not the best in town. But very good!

QHA874FfU2nDmnJn7FD76Q.text: Nice location and the food was good. Buffet was around $12. My favorite were the goat meat and lentil dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

obcvARZRz2evA4TeOBnl-Q.text: The foods was very very spicy. The service was a little slow but over all ok. It was my first time eating Indian food and overall it was good. The decorations were very very neat. The servers were very very nice and helpful. My favorite part was the pistachio ice cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice decor!

Uqfz0RQipHn6WcamAsZMmw.text: Suuuuuch a great place! Amazing customer service, very informative and they offer suggestions - which have never gone wrong. Super flavorful and aromatic. Taj Palace is a family favorite!

jI_ug6wWFgevmgX7FyqiYQ.text: It is with sad heart I have to give this place one star.  There has been some sort of management/partner change and food and service as just gone down.  It was a great local place we enjoyed...but now I don't see a reason to go back.  Food was brought out cold and dishes forgotten.

tanS6mqhumPdykPv3lUqoA.text: So. Good.  I mean,  so very good! I liked how we were greeted, seated, served and cared for.  The food we got was simply generous,  fresh and flavorful. We are fairly new to Indian cuisine and the server was helpful in explaining the menu.  Not many wine choices, but their Indian beer is great. But besides no Pino Grigio, this place is worth your time.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmm

ZpjrIFIjEZqplJFnNguKkw.text: I have been here twice now. The first was for the lunch buffet and second for dinner.   A nice place located in a pretty pretty plaza. It is very spacious, good for small and large parties. They have a giant bar area so I assume they have a full bar. The lunch buffet is set against the wall next to the bar.   Both times service was ok, the bussers were much more friendly than servers. Our drinks were constantly refilled, dirty plates were quickly picked up.   I think the lunch buffet is about $11 or $12, very good deal. The Buffy includes: tandoori chicken, few different types of rice, various types of curry (both vegetarian and non-vegetarian), small salad selection, and dessert. For the price the quality was very good!  For dinner we ordered goat curry, this was so delicious. The meat was tender, sauce was perfectly seasoned, simply delicious! We also got garlic nan, shrimp "fried rice" - we ordered level 4 spicy and this burned a little! We also ordered a lamb dish that was also very good!   Overall this is a nice place for Indian food. Chelsea than their places I've been too and the food was delicious! Will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UDZVavO03NxHHNnS34rwsw.text: This is my ULTIMATE FAVORITE Indian food in all of Las Vegas. Do yourself a favor and treat yourself to their delicious food. So fresh, consistent(we eat here a lot), great service, and home made. Your mouth will thank you.

QCoWlmqm70Nc7eBelnifdw.text: Yes, I'll give it a 4 star (above average to me) for being a nice Indian restaurant in the States. To me Indian food in the states is pretty tricky, if you had Indian food in cities outside of India, like London, you understand what I mean. Finding a fabulous Indian restaurant in the US is like finding a fabulous Mexican place in Europe, very hard to come by.  I have tried Indian food on both coasts and in the mid-west (which I highly recommend not to do) and Taj Palace is pretty darn good.  I have dined here a few times, so I guess it's time to do my Yelp elite duty and review it :).   On my most recent visit, I tried the lunch buffet as I have come in for dinner before. The price was excellent for the amount of choices. I'm not huge on buffets (I know... I live in Vegas)  and only go if I have too. Reason being is, I would rather have a dish cooked great than a bunch of food cooked mediocre served under heat lamps! Who here agrees?? So with that said, the buffet is really quite nice! There were plenty of tasty options and it did not taste dried out, well of course not because the food is in curry form- Duh, Trix! There are plenty of spicy sauces and mixes so you can add to flavor it up to your taste. This was awesome for me because well, you know, I like it Spicy Baby! ;)  The naan bread is fantastic. I ordered the garlic naan instead of the regular. It was not dry but it was so flavorful! I loved how they bring it to you upon order because there is nothing worse than under-a-heat-lamp-dry-as-dirt naan bread!   So yay! A great Indian place on my side of town. I definitely will come back ad definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh. It is ON!

bVOMJl-9BQITcJLCx2gvGw.text: Been here many times! The lunch buffet is great! Has many varieties of curry to choose from. And the best part is the price is reasonable! Definitely my go to place for Indian food!

5P3sRCKKofyHAJGUOBxdNg.text: My chicken was dry and all they did was argue with me about how it wasn't dry instead of taking care of things. I do not like writing bad reviews but it would have been a simple solution but the server even got the cook who then continued to challenge me how it wasn't dry and they would not replace my meal. Very unhappy and I should expect this from an East Indian restaurant they're very cheap and they don't care, all they care about is losing on food costs.

xQd-fkiTRe7dpejZb1esdg.text: Still hit or miss, but you can't beat the buffet price and some days dishes taste so good!  It's just the inconsistency that makes this place frustrating. I never do ala carte here anymore.

qEkJSc0pJMT0Jks7uvnU7g.text: This is a True Vegas hidden gem! Sadly at 6pm we are the restaurant's only patrons - hopefully this is the exception because hands down it is some of the best Indian food I have had to date. The menu descriptions sorely lack detail with the amazing melange of flavors in every bite. We enjoyed the lentil soup which was spicy (as requested) with a great bouquet of aromas and tastes. The main course was the chicken korma and saag paneer with a side of basmati rice and garlic naan. Described as a dish with a creamy sauce, the korma was bar-none the best I've ever had. Herby, rich, with great onion and tomato flavorings mixed into a creamy dish over a lovely chicken thigh (In guessing based on tenderness) it was really good stuff. If you're in the mood for buffet, they offer a daily variety of options (so they told us) so check that out. This will be a return spot for us - go check it out soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White rice. Nuff said.
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken korma - just look how thick and herby it is!
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saag paneer - half consumed.  So filling!

5aM74YJImAmg3z6xWpx8aQ.text: So I dipped into this place the other day and took a look at the buffet. Everything looked great. But I did not stay to eat. Came back a couple of days later and grabbed my food to go. And it was so so so good! I had the China masala, eggplant and basmati rice. Of course mild mild  no spicy mild! Well it had a little kick from what seems to have been the ginger so I was cool with that! Get it, hot ginger cool attitude LOL??? Anyway.....it all traveled well. And both were delish! The portions were just as full as if I had eaten there. I had leftovers  for brunch! Everything was super fresh including the actual fresh herbs and spices that you could actually see and tsste in the food! The service was friendly and very helpful to allergy suffers and Vegas alike. Lots of poultry choices and seafood for you none veggie types. Great choice when in vegas or if you live in Henderson.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the water fall is very peaceful
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the menu

FEeVrh3bPE4XN-vIs8_SSA.text: This place has authentic Indian food! The service is great, the prices unbelievably low and the food quality is extraordinary. I have been eating there for over two years and I have never had a bad experience.   If you go for lunch, they have buffet for only $9.99 and it's totally worth it!   Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fXZ0GpyaCRgfoDRtZorGVg.text: Tried this place today, veggie samosa FIRE!!! garlic naan FIRE!!! chicken curry FIRE!!! More importantly service was quality!! That dude Kenneth recommended just the right level of spiciness and took care of me. Definitely a go-to spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uS3byJCZUk-I5fZ_zWshzQ.text: Great lunch buffet with variety. Both times that I have come here the food was amazing and the customer service was above and beyond. Best curry restaurant in Last Vegas!

XsvAf64kzPraWOjOcm09Bw.text: This place is great for lunch if you're looking to fill out. You can never go wrong at this Indian buffet. The restaurant is a little cramped, but once you're seated you're very close to your party so it's very cozy.  The highlights of the buffet are the spinach,tandoori chicken, and chicken tikka masala. The chicken is a little dry, but I have to give this place 5 stars for making good, filling food and for the unlimited naan. The garlic naan is really good too, make sure you get a plate of those.  The restaurant is clean and the wait staff are all friendly and approachable even when it gets busy. Definitely check this place out!

txp-9ILW7f_LG-qoR7Y2Lw.text: I have eaten here a few times and every time has been great! The service is very friendly and efficient!  The food is also delicious! Everything we ordered was wonderful. I recommend the palak paneer and the chicken tikka. Both are perfect!  I can't say enough good things about this place and I can't wait to return and try some different items from the menu :)

CsC-uYMJw3yvE8vgO-YMBg.text: Still my favorite Indian restaurant in the South of town. Had the chicken vindaloo along with my usual paneer tikka masala. The vindaloo didn't disappoint. The vinegary flavor to it was a great contrast to the masala dish. My only gripe about this place is I wished they put more meat pieces into the dishes. Especially for the price. Although the flavorful sauces are enough to satisfy you, but more meat would be a plus. I'll be more adventurous and try the lamb and goat next time.

Fo-tZ3uThtb6jzTBNBmQHA.text: The lunch buffet is great!  Consistently great food. The buffet is helpful since I'm a vegetarian and my husband is not.  We can both get very tasty food which we both enjoy.  The naan bread is fabulous.

TxhTZFZjZX6ngosxmuiwUQ.text: I had a sudden craving for Indian food and this was the only place nearby. Because I read the hours wrong, I arrived about 40 minutes before 5p and therefore during the time they're closed (their hours are 11a to 3p, then 5p to 10:30p). I found something to do in the meanwhile because I was still craving Indian food and arrived a few minutes after 5p.  As soon as you enter the restaurant, there is a strong aroma that may be a little overpowering. I wanted to do the take out option and was seated at the bar waiting to order. It took longer than I expected, but the people were nice and kept offering me drinks. They took my order (lamb tikka masala and chicken curry) and I played on my phone in the meanwhile. A word of caution. I didn't order any naan because I had rice at home, but it looks like just one piece of naan is $2.50. One piece of garlic naan is $3.50. No, thank you.  They arrived with my food, I paid, and I went home. I've never really had Indian food before and fortunately, I was not disappointed with my choices. Both the lamb tikka masala and chicken curry were delicious. The portions were big enough that I had leftovers that still tasted good the day after. I'd definitely go back and order more food for take out.

h3qSt__wMs1ni4LeNDUikA.text: Okay, So I cam back to give this place one more try. and boy has the service and food quality improved. i love their butter chicken. I am glad I decided to give this place a chance again.

3_8w5-ba2l1k3C0uTv2-lg.text: Food was above par than most Indian restaurants I've been to here in the valley. Gonna check out the buffet next.  This dining experience we had chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, butter chicken, coconut lamb, and appetizers. Everything was delicious!

ZcMaaquyFakgmpWPGM9ylA.text: Immeasurably surprised to find quality of food the likes of which I've only elsewhere experienced in New York City.   Highly recommend you ask for the Paper-thin Masala Dosa.  Even if you don't know what it is.  It's not on the menu. It was actually the best one I've ever had.   It won't disappoint.  I hope they get a better music system soon.  If they do, they'll see a lot more of me.  And most don't get to see me at all.  Oh and better lighting would be great too.  I love to be a bit mood lit when I accompany my dosa.

0KTCH1xAlQwcaSzvXkSpdg.text: Delicious!! Had the buffet for $11.95 and it was fantastic. Huge selection. Very fresh.

wmsohAeTjCcyOyBv4n5yfQ.text: OMG! Thee best Indian food ever!! Do the lunch buffet you won't be sorry. I could get addicted to this place!!

1eDJG3rltDB4TodMfIkyhw.text: Beware! They can kick you out half hour before closing time!!  We were a family of seven driving about 500 miles to visit Las Vegas for vacation and decided to eat food here before heading to our room. We had 3 kids and elderly parents with us. They outrightly asked us to leave the place saying that they are closed when the yelp showed they closed at 3, and even the door said they close at 3.  We had no choice but to look for some other place. We looked at a Thai restaurant ( Pin Kauw)  in the same complex. They also listed the same hours. But they welcomed us with bright smiles and served us fresh food!   I am never visiting Taj Palace again!!

sWkEiqubdDuI1u5E-nQ7eg.text: I have never had Indian food that could even come close to comparing Taj Palace's. If I could leave 10 stars, I most certainly would. The BEST chicken tikka masala and vegetable samosas you will ever come across.

UcPpi-__0E7D21pmEt0CkA.text: First, the timing of this restaurant is not updated on yelp which shows how poor & reluctant the service can be.  When I called the restaurant to check if it is open now, one unprofessional person who could barely speak English or Hindi responded with highly unprofessional tone. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to any one.

CzmmpJPc_gMsUEb9OX3axQ.text: This place is great, especially for their lunch buffet.  They have a rotating menu, and the food is always delicious and fresh.  Garlic naan included and it's always good.  They have a large vegetarian section for a buffet.  I've never had anything here that I didn't like.

WgzK0blWydfzO3DPiLoewg.text: Pros: Food is good. Right amount of spice and flavours. Prices reasonably.  Cons: Service is slow. Also servers can care less about the customer. Don't expect them to come check on you or about the food. They will stand in the back and pick their noses.

BUZcf_Rd_7IELc6w7gSn4w.text: I've had some pretty amazing Indian food at ok looking places and this place looked great but lacked so much in their food/flavor. I've had minute rice that tasted better than this flavorless and grainy rice. I asked for a 7 spicy Vindaloo and I got a level 2 spicy. It tasted like water and tomato paste with no salt or spice. Naan was ok and samosas were alright. BUT WAIT. They charge extra for more rice. If y'all want some good Indian food go to Mount Everest. It's a longer drive for us and in a questionable area but I swear that place just squashes this one. Save your money and go somewhere else.

se1S8TjFNFW6clvhtBNlwQ.text: my go to Indian Spot! They're always quick and the food is delicious. Coconut chicken curry is my go to every time

MvvQo5cKiohi-JslBko97A.text: Chicken Tikka Masala & Aloo Gobhi delicious, nice and efficient staff We'll definitely return

QQflrbY4ePOrGGaYD0BluA.text: Visited Vegas for the memorial weekend and visited this place. The food was wonderful. Didn't taste the closet indian tasting biryani in any other places I tried. ( tried not too many) lol.  I ate here 2 days in a row. I would visit it again. 1 less star because they could improve on cleaning of water glasses a little . Thank you. Good luck!

kP-SyR7ymryNS3qvKDyNuw.text: I come here all the time for the buffet and it's so good. Everyone that works here is very friendly...I just wish they had better options for the desserts other than fruits & rice pudding =|

H3q35RtCUktBewIWIgZVPw.text: Ive been looking for Indian food for some time and thanks to Yelp reviews, I found my new favorite Indian food restaurant. I was really blown away by the freshness and favors. The garlic naan was to die for, fresh out of the oven. Definitely coming back. Don't pass up the opportunity for excellent food, great servers.

BReDUJ9ua1VCg5RyoOaWDA.text: It really is fit for Royalty! I had their buffet couple of times and there are very delicious. The flavor of the curries is on the lighter side not as strong as other places.  I love their ALOO MATAR-Green peas [matar] cooked with potatoes [aloo] & spices, ZEERA ALOO-Potatoes cooked with cumin and herbs ALOO GOBHI-Cauliflower and potatoes cooked with spices and herbs GOAT CURRY-Goat meat cooked with a fine blend of Indian spices TANDOORI CHICKENHALF - you can get half for $11 or full for $20 This marinated chicken is cooked in its own juices in the tandoor, and is the fire and spice of India.  I like everything so far. You can buffet to go as well, they will give you a box, naan and a small cup for soup to go.

IWcIViO-7wfk_XpRwM2lTQ.text: It was okay. 1st time was better but this time they missed the mark. I ordered butter chicken and they made a shortcut by; just taking chicken off the bone that they took off of chicken tandoori & usually supposed to be made from chicken breast similar to chicken tikaa masala it was just too hard to chew for my dad. Other than that flavor was there a little on sweet side was creamy though base was there but just a little rushed. Now for the naan, it had good flavor but so soggy when I received my delivery. I know it's not a delivery issue because last time I ordered delivery it was fresh and had the perfect crisp last time. Last time I ordered everything was great. This experience not so much. Just few suggestions for what i ordered and price point the portion size needs to be a but more for family size or change the minimum for delivery to get the right ratio or money's worth. Next time I will probably dine in but not likely after this experience. I recommend Mint or India Masala  I wish i could rate higher sorry guys!!

RKD-Mvx9HemuVSQ1hScXFQ.text: It's good and I'll return.  I'm new to the area so will have to learn their spice level.  I ordered the lamb curry spice level 4/10. Our Indian waiter stated he likes spicy and eats his food at level 6/10, so I ordered lamb curry level 4/10 to be on the safe side, but it was more of a 1/10. They may have forgotten on mine. The Palaak Paneer we ordered 2/10 was spicier than the lamb curry.  It was decent and on par with most Indian restaurants I've been to throughout various states.  The goat Biryani was flavorful,  one of the best I've had.  I typically don't really eat it, but I'll definitely order there's again.  It's worth me giving them another try on the curry.  The goat and the lamb were fairly tender.  I did have a few tough pieces of lamb,  but most of it was tender.

rcHlvFj3NFRX76Ra9WqSng.text: In our party of 7 on a Saturday night we had one Indian food newbie and a couple greenhorns. We asked the acting manager to bring a dish for everyone to share "family style" that represents dishes of which they are proud. He beamed at the opportunity and the staff was incredible in their service.   Those of us who regularly love Indian food couldn't have asked for a nicer, more friendly and higher-quality experience with which to introduce friends to this cuisine. I even appreciate that they took emphasis to make the vegetarian in our group (me) feel catered among the majority meat dishes. I adored my tikka masala paneer, rice (with pine nuts and raisins) and mushroom-veg dishes, and everyone else raved for the tandoor lamb ribs, curries, and shrimp.   I wish I were eating Indian food like this all the time -- and with management/staff who is this splendid, no matter the cuisine. But alas I don't live in the Vegas area. Taj Palace is a treasure in the land of ordinarily low expectations for nondescript strip mall restaurants.

OixiiwpFEybo2opXSDPPkw.text: Love this place!  My family's favorite Indian restaurant.  Been going there for years.  They have a really good lunch buffet with all the best Indian dishes.   You could try everything. They give an option of plain or garlic naan bread.  Get the garlic naan!! It super fresh out the oven every time.  Mega delicious! Best part is that the place is clean!  The staff is friendly and attentive to the patrons.  Oh and the prices!  The lunch buffet was like $11/person.  Highly recommend Taj Palace for Indian.

g_VKrbuNczQVEOH0CWPP0g.text: Delicious lunch buffet for $10.95! Lots of variety on the buffet line (some chicken dishes, goat, plenty of veggie options, lots of dipping sauces that were so fresh, and rice pudding for dessert). The buffet included unlimited naan (choose between garlic or regular). Their naan was crispier than other naan I've had, but still yummy. Friendly service, awesome decor. Can't beat it!

thk2c4WifKMwvmlRsM5yqQ.text: I found this place on Yelp, so I ordered takeout once. I arrived at the end of the time window they give you when you order. They didn't even know what I ordered when I arrived. After much scrambling around and another 15 minutes of waiting, I got my food. The portions for the takeout were a little on the small side for the price. It tasted good though, so I decided to order takeout again. The second time, I had a certificate from restaurants.com. I specifically looked at the certificate before I bought it and it did not say anything about dine-in only. I called and ordered (about $100 worth of food) and told them I had the certificate. They said ok and then I hung up. I get a call back a few minutes later saying that the certificate is for dine-in only. I told them it doesn't say that, and what did it matter. I then offered to pay them a tip for the whole meal so they wouldn't lose out on that. They said no. So I told them I wanted to cancel my order. After talking to their owner, they were still ok with giving up my business and cancelled my order. Maybe other people will have better luck, but they aren't getting my business anymore.

Pqi4A1bUIqv5X9dEhqOvfg.text: I refuse to support a restaurant that charges $5 for white rice. Sure the food is good but eh I'll pass and go to a place that doesn't rip you off on rice. The meals are already $11-$15 and to pay another $5 for rice is outrageous.

j_1-5mTibrYYd4-I--dPJg.text: Yum. Chicken tikka masala, chag masala and saag paneer, garlic nan and rice. Rice should be included; only caveat. Delicious.

AKeiNZebHjvUs4ULpwJmmA.text: This is the place to visit if you are looking for yummy indian food. I have never tried any a-la-carte items, but their buffet is more than enough AND a great value for just $10. With an assortment of vegetarian and chicken dishes seasoned to perfection with delicious spices, you are sure to find your favorite! I love their tikka masala and tandoori chicken, which is always fresh and juicy. The naan is complimentary and, although it takes a little bit to arrive at your table (it is freshly made every time), it is DEFINITELY worth the wait. This place is so good that even their jasmine rice is on point, every single time.   I do not know about you, but I love a rich mango lassi with my indian meals...and that's where I think they would do a bit of a better job. Do not get me wrong, their lassi is good but a bit too sweet compared to other ones I have had. And, for $5 a piece they are a bit pricey.  Conclusion? Come to this place, especially for lunch, and enjoy a great meal!

rpI6ABog6-vQTQEKQcrgzw.text: The service was a little slow, but the people were super nice and once we were served they were all very attentive. The food was simply amazing. The robust Flavors were right on point. The Mango Lassie was perfectly chilled. They have some really interesting tasty beers if you drink #husband. We had dinner not the buffet. The cost was very reasonable. We ordered enough food for four people and spent less than $50 before tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fragrant rice, Chicken Tikka Masala &amp; onion bashi
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Such a great treat for my Birthday!!
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chicken Tikka Massla is enough food for 3-4 with the rice. #alaCart

X6sBJP8c_m06GbXrHxqCEw.text: Friends and I dined at Taj Palace on a whim. It definitely did NOT disappoint. Tried 3 different Lamb dishes and they were all soooo good. The food is made with LOVE. There are not as many restaurants you can truly say that. Also, ordered garlic nan & and there stuffed cheese nan. Both were delicious. The average entire cost about $18. Depending on your party the serving sizes are enough to share as long as everyone orders one. Not a place I would eat on the regular, but I would go back to eat there for a date night or a nicer dinner with friends. I recommend this restaurant to any one the has a love for Indian food. Staff was very friendly and attentive the whole visit.

UieUNSj-ChWCUC3YB2JulQ.text: I went in and was the only person in the restaurant.  An early dinner.  I ordered Chicken Tika Marsala and garlic nan.  The waiter asked how hot I would like the meal prepared.  I asked for a 6-7.   The meal arrived and was prepared perfectly.  The chicken and marsala was some of the best I have ever had.  The garlic nan was exceptional.  The owner came over and introduced himself.  The staff was very nice.  The Indian music was different.  Indian rap....  They were throwing down.. different but good. I will go back and would recommend.  I would give it a 10.

o1fMobzqHFE957GweqiirA.text: Popular Indian afternoon buffet in Henderson. Very tasty and a good selection in the buffet line. There was a customer who did not like the pakoras today and the waiter immediately asked the chef to personally talk to her. The chef was so accommodating and went to the kitchen to make fresh pakoras the way she liked it. Even personally took them out to her table. Now that's truly making it right for the customer!

7GlFgPNV7nE186ioWlRuiw.text: Really good Indian food - we don't have many in Southern Nevada.  The Biryani is always nice, and the Lamb Jalfreezi is one of my favorites. Wife likes the Khorma best. Authentic Samosas make a nice starter.

GHV4doRYFfWxOxVBmicuYA.text: Lunch buffet always has a good selection of vegetarian and non-vegatarian food items. The fresh garlic naan is amazing as well as the service! Highly recommended!!

UQTDhubullMD9sHOK8QOyg.text: I've been to plenty of Indian restaurants here in Las Vegas so I have no choice but to compare them seeing as how they all do the same 11-3 lunch buffet plan. I decided to try this place as it is the closest to where I currently live.  The Good -- * Their garlic naan is by far the best I've had. It's very light, fluffy, and buttery. A 'little' better than Angara Spice (West Flamingo) and way better than Urban Turban (off Paradise). * Their Tikka Masala and Tandoori chicken are standard fare. It tastes good but no better or worse than the other places.  The Bad -- Their kheer (rice pudding) was chunky and runny at the same time. Angara Spice definitely has them beat here as the kheer at Angara Spice is consistently smooth.  Secondly, they (like most Indian restaurants around town) LACK the presence of a lot of MUMBAI foods, especially street foods like Pav Bhaji. So, Urban Turban beats them there just for HAVING pav bhaji. Nothing I tasted here is worth writing home about. It's all standard fare and their buffet is slightly smaller with less food on it than some of the other buffets. Also, this location is a little more hustle and bustle than the   other Indian restaurants, which is why they have more seating and a larger room.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Second time.  Lunch buffet.

ZJiHKBhivhXkeQddxcK7xQ.text: Always friendly staff and delicious food! I highly recommend  the Peshwari Naan , it has AMAZING flavor. The  Tika masala &  Matar paneer were absolutely perfect!

aIBW6-uGeOLDJNnQxx7EWQ.text: I used to frequent they lunch buffet but no any more. They discontinued the cat fish curry dish. That was what I was mainly there for. I guess I have to find another Indian buffet to go to.

Q4DtNdB2-Q4tBDHMlRdXFA.text: Hands down best Indian restaurant in the city...I should know, I'm Indian! As authentic and delicious as it gets. The buffet is a great deal for that gorgeous spread! I taken numerous friends there over the years and everyone loves it! I'm a huge fan and after trying a few other Indian restaurants in the city, I have to say, this is the only one that reminds me of home. Love it!

LgCGs3TXwEsRyFtDKODZmw.text: Here's The Scoop: This was such a wonderful find. After returning our rental we were looking for someplace to go for lunch. We walked through the mall and discovered this place. Beautiful decorations and lovely booth seating. The food was awesome. The food was setup buffet style. Everything on the menu was delicious! the Chicken Tikka, Garlic Naan, Chicken Biryan, Veggies  and Samosas were very good. We would definitely come here during our stay in Vegas. Beautiful decorstions and comfortable booths adorn interior.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic naan
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala, jasmin rice, samosa, spinach. Yummy!!!!

kB4nZn-B4vXXlmTYMWsa-A.text: Good food if you want Indian food in Nevada. But it doesn't cut it for spicy and rich flavors.   If you are Indian just expect ok for vegetarians.

zZzqEOOuHocoQlCwef-1cg.text: This is one of our most favorite restaurants. We had a birthday celebration dinner for one of our family members. It was a great atmosphere, great and friendly service and above all the food was fantastic!! Thank you Taj Palace for a wonderful evening with family.

NC-PPOI0zPeRQYKc2Lk6VA.text: 3.5- food good, decent ambiance. Fair price. Went there today for the buffet. Lots of vegetarian options. Left pretty full after 2 plates. Their garlic butter naan was very good. Light and crispy. Would come back again

hlpQxF1sIWVxoayZixz2SA.text: Lunch buffet was delicious . There was plenty of selections to choose from . They also had several vegan dishes.

CaurWrQP53p2zSPBEU40kA.text: $17 for a little container of curry?! That's just way too much. 1 star because it tasted good but it hardly had any chicken in it and it was too small of a serving for the price we paid!   Might try this place for their buffet since I guess that is what it's known for. Until then, 1 star!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $17 for this! No rice or pita included! What a ripoff

Mu6LbF13bezuRrBSMP30Ug.text: I forget how much I love the beautiful spices and breads offered in Indian cuisine. My experience at Taj took me back to my favorite restaurant in San Francisco!  First, the garlic naan bread lived up to my expectations providing  a light,  tasty, soft with just enough crunch texture.  The prawns were perfectly simmered in a delicious sauce. The lamb dish was deliciously tender and at an 8 heat level,  provided just the amount of spice I was craving!  Finally, the vegetarian stew rounded out the table atop the light, fluffy rice. I wanted to keep eating but I was too full!  Staff was soft spoken and interested in our dining experience!  The owner introduced himself and welcomed us to return another day. We were almost the last diners to close the restaurant down so it was late. The staff waved us cheerfully good bye.  Probably because they really wanted to call it a day. But they never made us feel rushed. I'll be back for the buffet as I really want to try more items. And oh that bread, it's devine!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic naan bread
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian dish
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb and prawn entrees!  Deeeelish!!

Z1l8KxdMnN7GKtvhDs_Law.text: Great Indian food, we ordered chilli paneer, dal makhani and chana masala with garlic naan and rice, all of these dishes were exceptionally good. Taste matching to what you get in india. Best part was the spice level it was really north Indian level. And to top it up service was very good.

wUj4dGmdV-u_-IyTf30QpA.text: Please try their biryanis it's too good. Best biryani I had in a long time, with small pieces of chicken, unlike other restaurants who just put whole chicken big pieces as it is.  Main course is good and distinctive too. You won't feel that any 2 items feel the same, they stay True to there name and taste like proper restaurant food. Then check their Dal fry equally good and different. Best in the vegas for the Indian food at awesome prices too!

sNTAJE1irCdhOVVFXENiQQ.text: Expensive and small portions. I am sure the lunch buffet is much better and worth the price. Service is good. I've really had it with Indian places charging extra for rice....it's rice, not gold. Just charge an extra dollar if you have to but bring me a nice portion of rice. They charge $5 for a full portion....ridiculous. We might go back and try the lunch buffet, but won't do dinner again.

iGegkXFDjXEXAHf8Nlbf3w.text: I love this place. We happened upon it at lunchtime, on Presidents day holiday. It was not only open,  but everything was fresh, hot and delicious, all the chairs were filled!!!  So many GLUTEN FREE options.  There are vegan, gluten-free, vegetarian, Halal meat, Jain dishes.

MuxuhGTld6I2acpw9PwWKw.text: Now I'm not a connoisseur at Indian cuisine.  This is probably only my second time ever having it.  One thing I know is when food is delicious...and this food was fantastic!  Very attentive service as soon as I walked into the door.  I knew I wanted to try something vegetarian, so the waiter helped me out and let me know some of the favs veggie dishes. I knew that I wanted to try the samosas, so I started my night with some of those.  I must say that they taste so much better than the frozen ones I usually buy from the supermarket.  Haha.  Great potato filling with excellent seasoning. I don't really know what the green sauce is that comes with every table, but it paired well with them.  Decided on ordering the Paneer Masala, full order of basmati rice, and I've read so much about the garlic naan that I had to see if the hype was real.  Mann it sure was real!  That naan is top notch! I had no idea it would be so much food (just meant that the next day...leftovers). I ordered the masala with a level 6 spice, and it was very mild.  I know now I can take it up to an 8 or 9 on my next visit.  The richness of flavor really hooked me in, and the naan pairs perfectly with it.  I now know that a full order of rice will feed two (or me twice). The paneer has a tofu like texture and didn't taste like cheese at all.  I'm wondering if this type of meal can be super fattening.  Guess I'll find out soon because I will be back again!  Great flavor, cool atmosphere, relaxing decor.  This will be one of my favs

4E5u1Z14FEGGlMSqyM_Z_g.text: Love love this place.  The chicken tikka is the best. Order the naan bread and basmati rice to go with it.   Promise you will love it like I do

9R4TcesRygMzVMFq-Kyijw.text: Decided to try a place in the plaza it is located in since we always drive by and NEVER stop so we avoid the moronic green valley drivers and their needs to all be on the road at the same damned time. This stop was more than worth it. 1 st time ever eating Indian and was extremely pleased with everything....Friendliness, atmosphere, aromas and visuals. Owners are so happy to make you experience the best possible. We had the lunch buffet and have been back several times

eRpJuCq3EPqsokoJHkXxKw.text: Very good food however I ran into one issue.  The menu states yiu can order a half a Tandori chicken and I did order that.  I was expecting to get a breast and wing with as part of that but I only got the back half of the chicken.  I wasn't happy about that and had some language issues resolving it.    They keep the breast meat for other dishes so even if you order a whle chicken your really getting two back half's   They did make it up to me and all of the food was exceptional.

kvathTscwQVm2tKkfT4rog.text: They have a great buffet in the early afternoon until 3p.  Good selection of both vegetarian and meat dishes and varying dessert and of course naan.  Great way to get our kids to try different foods to find what they like.  Well worth it!

kefOawHEh8BipweJJLT0tQ.text: Our favorite Indian food restaurant in the area.  Best chicken tikka masala I've had since I was a kid.   We normally get the Non-Vegetarian platter for 2 which comes with an order of pakora, chicken tandooria, your choice of a chicken dish, their dal of the day, tomato basil soup, an order of naan, an order of basmati rice and a dessert for about $50.   We normally get the chicken tikka masala, but I've heard their butter chicken is excellent. Every bite of food is delicious here, and all of the servers are very knowledgeable about people with a gluten allergy which is always helpful. Most Indian food, except the breads, are gluten free friendly, and I have never gotten sick from eating here.  Great service, fantastic, flavorful food and a relaxing ambiance. Best place in town.

ApWjZIXya4qWouyCsbwwLA.text: Middle of the road Indian Buffet. Hit or miss. My favorite dish was the Navaratan Korma, this Saag Paneer was poor. The Naan is fluffy and delicious.   If you're craving Indian it's not bad, but I'm not going to go out of my way to come here in the future.

QR5TL2pfy4XrsdQlwJNIYA.text: Went for their buffet lunch special with my family and everyone left full and happy.  They have a good selection at their buffet at a good price! Not to mention the unlimited warm garlic or plain naan brought to your table.  My favorites were the curry, tikka masala, and samosas.  My family said that the tandoori chicken was also 2 thumbs up but I did not get a chance to try it.  Next time I'm in town and craving Indian I will definitely be back!

DvEY8-XlY6TflCgrQA9LFw.text: The food is ok. I really liked coming here a year ago now it's not as flavorful as it used to be.

R6Gi5QlnJLLXLzQAu6bGdQ.text: Yummmmm!  The service was so so but the food made up for it by far.  Would recommend and would eat there again if we lived in the area.

KZE4Ft45Cei-ABMfmbRmuA.text: Super slow service.. We had two hours for dinner before our show, but we never saw the main course..  Go there only if you have a lot of free time. Though mango lassi is good.. But not worth wait time.

0veBJZegXbNYrHCqUN5m_A.text: Service was very good and the food tasted as expected. Preparation time took a while but that is acceptable as it was prepared fresh

j7sCQwgArXyEIitjsBf6MA.text: Delicious food great service, relax environment! The buffet has freshly cooked portions. Chicken, goat, lamb meat all cooked so the meat melts off the bone SUPER

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chana Masala; this is one of their vegan dishes with garbanzo beans and tomato base masala sauce

x5u9ZK_tKRmMy_MlFsIWNw.text: Everything was amazing!  Tender meat dElicious sauces. Menu needs more pictures because the food is even prepaired beautifully.

oOr-dzmnhAsq6JzxFAesLQ.text: They can serve Jain food !   A classy and sophisticated restaurant at a few miles distance from Vegas strip. Delicious food and the staff was very friendly to accommodate our Jain food requirements. Try the Paneer butter masala, totally worth it! Don't forget, Yelp check-in provides free mango lassi.

LKcbWBVrEBE7Dc4NKvhjYg.text: Another good Indian restaurant. Good buffet pricing for a fair selection. However, I do like when they serve the naan fresh tableside.

caiLWjAb8NRCFNyGitSmEg.text: Was looking for an Indian restaurant for dinner in the Henderson area, and Taj Palace has 4*, so I figured why not. I had the chicken tikki masala, and my date had the paneer tikkia masala. We also had a side of rice and an Indian beer. Even with the $5 Yelp discount, the bill came out to $37 after tax. While the food was definitely good, as was the service, that just seems like a lot of money for what we ordered. Every other Indian restaurant I've been to in town is cheaper, and even more so when I use a restaurant.com certificate.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HY6za_LcEZmJ-M5ppLZiDA.text: Terrible buffet. Went with 3 of my friends and everything was salty, stale and no desi pop to anything. If you are desi and accustomed to good tasting foods avoid the buffet!!!
