Mz2XB-tXY1sKtUf6InnkIQ.text: Taj Palace is the best Indian food in Henderson. We order take-out from them all the time through the Eat24 app. The food is always tasty and they even give us extra papadam or rice sometimes when we've been in a lot. We've eaten in the restaurant as well and it's a really nice ambiance. They understand special diets. We are vegan, gluten-free, and have a few other allergies and they are always able and willing to accommodate us. Thank you to the Taj Palace for always being a great place to count on whether we are celebrating or just need a good meal in a hurry.

8uJhAJH9aY0BInt-Oicp0A.text: ---Rant---  Great stuff~ The rice dishes were as spicy hot as I'd hoped they were, and the Tandoori Shrimp were more like Tandoori Prawns (REAL sized prawns). Portions were huge!  That's always awesome!   Service was great; just what I expected. Answered questions, brought us more water on a regular basis, check came quickly, food came quickly, etc.  This place is WAY better than Mount Everest India's Cuisine!  I don't know understand why that place gets more stars than Taj Palace; this place has better portions, comparable prices and better service.  And the food comes out faster!!!  After my first visit here, I came back the very next night for takeout; more Tandoori Shrimp, Basmati Rice, and the usual Chicken Masala.  Can't go wrong.  If you want great Indian food at reasonable prices, and you have a big stomach, definitely visit Taj Palace!~  Criticisms: - Lighting could have been better, seemed kind of dingy - Decor could use an upgrade  ---Overall---  Service: A.  Servers were friendly and answered questions I had about the food  Food: A+, great selection, BIG portions  Atmosphere: B-, chill and relaxed, but could use an upgrade in lighting and decor

Igqw5NqCQelOIohAKIxZ3w.text: Wouldn't deliver. :(  The app for delivery didn't work. Called and they refused to take a delivery order, saying use the app... which doesn't work.

SaxUu5AoDwf2mw55ETlpxg.text: This is worse Indian I ever seen.. I ordered lamb chops they were so tiny and dry unfortunately I couldn't eat them, my wife ordered goat Karahi it was too salty and big pieces of vegetables and they were uncooked and Raw I wouldn't recommend this place to any meat Lovers

WCFxFg-NTk2Pl_jebuQ5ig.text: Best Indian restaurant in town.  Servers were above and beyond helpful and pleasant to interact with.  We will be back next date night.  Monday night was great, not too busy, felt like a special secret restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This beer is goood
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vv93rwLBWyl7DfLnu8YhHA.text: My review may be biased as I have only had one item off their menu and it was DA BOMB! Lamb Tikka Masala Spicey 8/10, this dish is a TEN. Get that the next time you go.. it's unfortunate others have had such bad experiences..

TgnqiNpHV0t5ofkSy-kPrQ.text: The food is so good. This is my third time here. I've been for dinner and the lunch buffet. I highly recommend

cSUe7W66lajXGebW72WciA.text: I wanted to take my 79 yr old mother out for her first taste of Indian cuisine. I had visited Taj Palace many years before and decided to take her there. It was great! Our server, Vishal B., was wonderful. I explained it was my mother's first time trying Indian food and that I'd like recommendations for something that wouldn't be too spicy and scare her away. He gladly told my mother that he would take care of her like "She was his own mother." He made several good suggestions and offered help on what spice level to try it at. She had the Tiki Masala and really enjoyed it. I had the Chicken Korma, one of my all-time favorites, and it was delicious. Everyone was very polite and attentive. The restaurant was clean and the food came quickly, was hot, and tasty. Mom and I will definitely back be back. Vishal suggested the buffet and we're hoping to try it next! If you're in Henderson I would definitely recommend trying Taj Palace.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our delicious Chicken Tiki Masala &amp; Chicken Korma.

cx8Zx_OG_6X0QzCgWSqgLQ.text: The restaurant looked very exotic and clean, the waiter is friendly but the service is horrible! First, we asked for a chicken tikka masala with CHEESE just like how I like it, and the waiter even said "Okay" (language barrier?) anyway, we got chicken tikka masala and buttered chicken, and my husband and daughter ordered coke. I asked them for water also, which they served first along with the crunchy pita (which was half burnt, but we didnt really mind since it was free). I also got a free mango lassi from Yelp, and that was very delicious.  Our food came after 15 mins, and when I asked if the chicken tikka masala had extra cheese, he looked at me like I was dumb lol i asked again if theres cheese in the tikka masala and he said no, but he put extra butter. I asked for CHEESE, how is that the same as B.U.T.T.E.R???   Anyway, the tikka masala and the buttered chicken tasted EXACTLY the same because they put extra butter on it   Also- they didnt give us the coke. We asked for it when we were almost finished eating, and they served it after we finished eating. They said the bar tender wasnt there. How hard is it to pour coke on a glass? Lol they said they will give it for free, but we were already done so we really didnt want it anymore.  Overall, the place looks great, the food was still good, mango lassi was great, the crunchy pita was not good (but not bad either), waiter is friendly but the service is horrible. We spent about $80 on 2 dishes with rice, which was pretty pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chickken tikka masala and buttered chicken! Fragrant jasmine rice ftw

VYwv3odeNJGiWTryPaXemw.text: This place is good but it's not the best that I've had. It's in a good location and the restaurant is nice. Everything came out a little bit spicier than we wanted. My family really liked it but they don't eat out often at all. I felt like from all the Indian places that I've ever eaten at this one was on the pricier end. The stuff seemed either and like they couldn't be bothered. I know that sounds bad but we had a lot of questions to ask about the menu first and the questions weren't really answered. I think we were too starving to care at the time.  But I have definitely had better Indian food experiences. Are used to actually work at one here in Vegas and it was more warm, friendly and focused on customer service more than here.

bxXYJfJs9C603kQp0pnlIQ.text: The service was some of the worst of any restaurant I've ever been. Our server was downright unfriendly, even hostile. The manager (I think) who seated us was also very unfriendly. The only friendly face was a young man who I think was a busboy.  Otherwise, it was extremely unwelcoming. Unfortunately, the quality of the food did not compensate for the awful service.  It was okay but I have had far better Indian food in almost any restaurant I've ever been and I've been to many Indian restaurants as it is my favorite food.  I would never ever return here due to the hostile service and mediocre food.

BbNX38Zjp1R1Afvgg09w3w.text: We loved Taj! We decided to ask the waiter to bring us what he thinks is the best for the night... Chefs choice! There were four of us and he brought us four main dishes: one vegetarian, one chicken, one lamb, one fish. Lots of garlic naan and beautiful sauces.  Thank you Vichel B For the beautiful service and attention to detail.

Bqk2bHYcrbdujn2PY2LvRQ.text: I love this place - my friend had been eyeballing it for awhile and so we decided to try it. Inside it is decorated so beautifully - with hand painted details on the wall and gorgeous lighting. The staff is incredibly attentive and lovely. Vishal B. was our server and he was really great. The food was also exceptional - everything from the Chicken Tandoori, rice, naan and the Butter Chicken. Loved the experience - definitely check it out.

iqA5a0gG6Irur5LuEp_Bpw.text: Everything is delicious:) Our Family favorite and only Indian restaurant in Las Vegas.

ZCV7AlOFHO6ZaHgAO1zmTA.text: I've been to Taj Palace twice now: Once for dinner and once for their lunch buffet. Both times, I was really happy with the food and service! The restaurant is in a very restaurant heavy strip mall, so you literally have a ton of choices, but let me tell you that Taj Palace is one of the better ones.   The first time I went was for dinner. I got Chicken Tikka Masala and my friend got Chicken Vindaloo. Both dishes were delicious! So tasty. The servers were friendly and regularly refilled our waters. The second time I went was for the lunch buffet. They have a bunch of options on the buffet, including salads, vegetarian/vegan options, and meat selections (chicken and goat in various forms). The food was delicious, but not as spicy as if you order a dish off the menu.   I'd definitely recommend going here anytime you're looking for delicious Indian Food!!

7GU7Y1gTLExZ2nIAonR-qg.text: We came in for the lunch buffet and it was a bit disappointing, also the entire restaurant was filled with smoke because they weren't properly ventilating the ovens.

TjlMIN4ufxUMCiybFVct9A.text: My family and I  absolutely loved the service and the food . I would highly suggest going to this restaurant one of the restaurant  people helping us , Vishal B really made us feel welcome explained on what types of food they had it was excellent . By far best Indian food in Henderson

GJplYwp3U7A2D8UgQNUzZQ.text: My husband and I loved this place. The food was delicious. We had the tandoori chicken which came out sizzling and was so flavorful. A wonderful spicy level that was not overwhelming. The paneer tika masala was to die for. Ordered a 5/10 spicy level and it was just a small bite on spiciness.  My favorite by far in Vegas. Garlic naan was buttery and so fresh. Got a free mango lassi thanks to yelp. New favorite place and will be back!  Cute decor! We went on a Tuesday night so we had no wait.

XQ63qa4QoscBqbGcglTxkw.text: I ordered through uber eats, spent about $30 and was so disappointed, the portion I received on a half tandori chicken was ridiculous, I seriously have never seen such small pieces in my life, not an exaggeration!  It was very overpriced for what I received and I called the restaurant and nothing was offered for this visit and even argued about the chicken, I would only recommend the lunch buffet.

aVZ4bExzghmLrxOpAy0a6Q.text: Very good food. Easily the best Indian food I've had in a while. The dinner menu is a bit expensive but if you go to their buffet you can save some money and they have everything available. The waitstaff is very attentive.

c7NguTPMk2Y55Ys37BwA1Q.text: The lunch buffet was good. We even got here after 2pm and they close the buffet at 3. The naan is fresh and so a little slow in coming. But the food was good.

F5XVl9gg5Q0xoaC5TbDb5A.text: Amazing Indian food. I had Lamb Madrass Curry and my wide has Saag Paneer, we both loved the food. The spiciness was just right to our request. Taj Mahal beer was a great choice also. Amazing service by Vishal B. We'll be coming a lot more often.

9ooZeSLWPu06lfDGvl_Row.text: Yum!  1 star = customer service was awesome.  They really helped me out as it was my very first time really eating Indian food.  My friend is also on a Vegan diet and they helped him pick the foods he can eat.  Extremely helpful!  2 stars = for the environment!  Handcrafted art and tapestry walls surround you in the restaurant and it feels kind of intimate and romantic!  3 stars = GARLIC NAAN.  Don't leave this place w/ out trying it especially if you're into bread and garlic like I am.  It is so tasty I finished the entire basket myself!  4 stars = Chicken Tikka Masala!  Yum! Buttery curry and mildly spicy over a bed of their rice; so good!    5 stars = Fried Okra!  My friend ordered spicy so it was a lot to handle but the veggies went really well to compliment my Chicken.  Coming back for sure!

bDyGWvdyhhJPFkQBm6U0Qw.text: The food is a little tough and not warm and took forever for service they act if we're in their mercy but the buffet is yo die for and is amazing so would recommend to go during the buffet time

8v7ZTesbnjagGOeqHcy2sA.text: OK, first a disclaimer. I'm British which may mean I have overly high standards for Indian food. That said, I've lived in the US for 8 years, so I feel I know what to expect.  My main gripes with this place were the fact it's overpriced ($5 for rice after ordering a $16 lamb curry) and the fact that the food was bland. The waiter asked how spicy (mild, medium, spicy) and I said medium. When the food game, it looked nice, but there was very little flavor and no spiciness I could detect. It wasn't horrible, but I've enjoyed Indian food in mall food courts more than the food at Taj Palace.  The service started off great (four waiters taking care of the two of us), but we were oddly left for 20 minutes after we'd finished out food with not a waiter in sight.  Also the booths were rickety! They don't seem to be attached to the walls, so I could feel every time the person behind me moved. It's difficult to describe this annoyance without sounding ridiculously petty, but I spent most of the meal leaning forward at an unnatural angle.  I really wanted this place to be good (not least as I'd talked my girlfriend out of her favorite Thai place that's in the same strip mall). A curry and beer on a Friday night ... the stuff (Englishmen's) dreams are made of! Maybe the lunch buffet is great, and that why this place has great reviews. I can't think of any other reason.

b1X0Fh0DV0EHlI3P_KbR0g.text: Great food, excellent authentic flavors and very afforable lunch buffet special for about $10 a person. Their rice pudding and tikka masala were stand out.  Also, go with the garlic naan! Very good Indian restaurant in my neighborhood.

YldmHOsIzHk-hU6bxXubvw.text: This has got to be my favorite Indian place of all time... The food is always amazing and the service is as well. If you are new to Indian food the servers are always happy to help you order a dish that you'll LOVE. There lunch buffet is great too for $10.95 all you can eat and its a great way to try all the different dishes. This place is highly recommend!

Y7ZX0AdtlPTOdIOxIZ_viw.text: Ordered take out the other night. We asked the guy taking the order what their best chicken dish was and he suggested karahi chicken. Ended up ordering karahi chicken, palak paneer, dal makhani,naan and roti for our guests. When we brought home the order, we realized they had given us shahi or karahi paneer instead of the chicken. I called back and the guy was apologetic and offered to deliver the chicken to us. SInce the order had taken over 40 minutes and it was a busy saturday night, we offered to come and pick it up. 4 points for customer service as they compensated by giving us a complimentary pulao rice, and some achar relish and corrected the order. 2 points for the food however:  dal makhani-was extra creamy but tasted the best of the lot. palak paneer-was ok chicken karahi-which they claimed was the best chicken option was flavorless and pretty tasteless. pulao-was not bad, pretty decent. naan and roti were well made. they let us keep the paneer karahi as well, but unfortunately that was pretty tasteless too.  I usually love leftover food the next day but this I was happy to get rid off.  I will try them again as this may have been a freak day since they were busy, but it was disappointing considering our guests were looking forward to a nice indian meal and price wise the place is not cheap! I guess I will stick to the buffet for this one, as somehow the buffet experience has been ok every time but have not had the same luck with take out orders.

voVIkorCTG4gWOhd8Rqwjw.text: Very enjoyable food would highly recommend best Indian cuisine we found in Henderson Nevada to date. We will be back

Y3zEH_Souwf90UmERH2DlA.text: Had the lunch buffet & it was excellent! I met a group of friends here & everyone really enjoyed the food and atmosphere.

vzaSbuGXro-XJHoI5wJJKw.text: First of all let me say i rarely ever rate a place 5 stars .Today was my first time trying indian food, i must say my experience was very pleasant! I am super pleased with this place and will be coming back soon! The service was excellent! I ordered the garlic naah and the chicken tikka masala with rice. I also got a mango smoothie free when i checked in here. The ambiance is also vey nice. Im impressed. Honestly cant think of one negative or bad thing to say.

nlFHMiHP81CkyWiirWLpoA.text: Top-notch Indian cuisine! The samosas are not greasy or fatty, and they offer 10 levels of spiciness. I wish they had cheese naan, but it's no big deal. The only reason I gave it four instead of five is because they don't have a full bar.

8X2TI6iXbBg28fJVrfp-VQ.text: AWESOME food great service .. My wife and our 2 year old son always come here and we enjoy the food and the music :)

NfeN6ePxdrJyCqTD1sPsmw.text: After reading great reviews for this place, I was very excited to order some take-out for the family. I am by no means an Indian food connoisseur, but I know what it's supposed to look and taste like, and this was not it.  The yellow dahl was mealy. The spices were alright, but the texture was all wrong.  The vegetable biryani was dry. I also bit into some sort of pit.  The chicken tikka masala was a real joke. The chicken looked and tasted like an old breast cut into pieces and thrown into sauce (which was, fortunately, acceptable).  The chili (spiciest) chicken was just hot to be hot. There were no real flavors, making this dish a bust as well.  The highlight was the mango curry chicken -- nice juicy pieces of meat in a flavorful sauce. The naan was also ok.  None of the entrees (about $15 each) came with rice. If I had ordered enough for 4 people, it would've cost $10. Unbelievable.  I will not be ordering from/dining in this restaurant ever again. If anyone knows of authentic Indian cuisine in the Valley, please let me know.

La-H7y0rjayUybxTPqc44A.text: As far as Indian food goes, Taj Palace is delicious. As far as service? Our waiter Vimal treated us like queens.   It's the typical strip-mall exterior, like almost all restaurants in Henderson, NV. Coming from Los Angeles, I'm starting to get used to great restaurants like this - after all, many wonderful treasures can be found in strip-mall style buildings in LA.  When we were seated around 8:30 PM, the entire restaurant was empty, so there was no wait. Vimal brought out Papadum (Indian bread, crispy and very thin like a cracker) with hot green sauce and a tasty plum sauce. We ordered veggie Samosas to start, which seemed to be hand-made at the restaurant and were spectacular. Vimal convinced us to try Nasi Biryani rice instead of the traditional white Basmati rice I normally order. It's like an Indian fried rice, with golden raisins and almonds that has a yellow coloring from the spices. Delicious. That came out with our chicken tikka masala in medium spiciness and our garlic naan. Every dish was better than the last. At this point a middle-aged couple came into the nicely decorated restaurant and sat down to dinner as well.   I think it's surprising that the place was so empty, considering how yummy everything was. The other couple verbally recognized this and asked Vimal about it as well. It seems new ownership took over more than a year ago, and he just needs to get the word out. So here's the word - we'll be stopping by again soon to check out the buffet for lunch, that seems like a great value!

xmXW8p-jRdBZO48oEfrENA.text: Best Indian food in Vegas!  Chef Binu is a master at his craft.  I eat here every time I come to Vegas.   The layers of flavor do a dance on your tongue that you will not forget.

rbThW1204Og1flqDUiThfw.text: My girlfriend and I were new to Indian food. This place was recommended by a coworker. The lunch buffet was only about $11 and had a large selection. Everything we tried was amazing. We tried a little bit of everything, serious. The chicken korma is top 3 for sure. Great attentive service. Decor is intimate. We will keep coming back for sure.

aYwaysOwYtsqrUDN5vKHoA.text: My daughter and I love Taj Palace and we are quite picky. Very authentic, full flavored and good quality. We'll be back - thanks!!

rDgdWEq3KCYBuTd-LkVGyw.text: I ordered two entrees on Uber Eats, the food showed up and was SUPER oily and didn't have any of the meat and veggies in the description. Worse part is it came without any rice. Every place in town includes rice with the entree, mine showed up an oily mess and no rice :( I called them and they said I had to order separately which I don't mind paying for but I didn't know I had to so now I have two dinner entrees swimming in oil and no rice. Terrible food and service

lmHHA53CrfMzYijYQXPWPA.text: Loved the ambience and beautiful wall art.  Tried the Spicy Coconut Curry with goat and the Lamb Curry - both were very good and it was nice to have the goat option.  Downside is the price is high for dinner and the rice was an add on. All other Indian restaurants we have dined at have included the rice with the entree order.

6BlGPZH4k4ARMdSL9qFTyQ.text: Pleasant service and decor.   Had the buffet and everything I tried was very good.    One could say selection is limited for Vegas buffet standards but it's still good enough and reasonably priced.

sWW4zDD-GziRHq4I8ycYBQ.text: We decided to try this place for the lunch buffet, and it was alright for 10.95 (before tax and gratuity).  We opted for the garlic naan and it was delicious.  My favorite dish of all time at Indian buffet is the goat curry.   There was goat curry on the line, however, it wasn't flavorful as I would have liked it to be.  Thank goodness they were tender.  The chicken tandoori was kind of dry.  The kheer, which is the rice pudding, wasn't so delicious as the one over at India Palace.  I have to say that I enjoy the lunch buffet at India Palace much more.  I probably won't be coming back to Taj.

mRsOwmyA4i3lTrMd0onl8Q.text: I had high hopes for my meal at Taj Palace.  I read the series of Yelp reviews and even recall a few friends stating it was a good place for curry. I have to presume, it was a bad night for the team at Taj Palace. As much as it pains me to write a "negative" review, I have to be True to my experience. We arrived on Friday evening around 8:30 pm. The Yelp reviews for Taj were higher than Ping Kao 3 my intended destination.  Upon arrival I noticed the large dining room had a total of three occupied tables.  The friendly waiters greeted and seated our party of two promptly. To make a long story bearable I will cut to the chase. I ordered a medium butter chicken, at $17.00 I anticipated a fantastic dish. My Partner, ordered a $16.00 lamb dish. He will write his own review.  To our amazement, the two dishes did not come with Naan or Rice. We ordered these items on the side. The plain basmati rice was $5.00 and the Naan was $3.50.  The food came out within ten minutes. Have to give an A for speed and service during the pre-dinner service. This team was on top of it. There were four servers for our table. Our water was never empty and the empty or unused plates/utensils disappeared quickly. So on to the food. I will only speak to my own dish. I have had several butter chicken (Murgh Makhani) dishes at different places. I am familiar with the expected flavor. This particular dish just did not taste like any butter chicken; I have had in the past. The color of the dish looked proper but the flavor was off. It almost tasted as if they used mayonnaise instead of cream or yogurt in the dish. It was slimy and did not have a good flavor at all. To supplement the flavor the meat within the dish was chopped into small bits. There were also chunks of bone, fat and bay leaf. It was just awful. Some might say, you should have sent it back. I have warded off sending any dishes back at restaurants, there are too many horror stories.  I simply did not finish it. The post-dinner service left us sitting with dirty dishes for twenty minutes. When the two waiters finally collected the plates they did not ask about our experience and did not notice most of my butter chicken was still in the dish.  I do not expect anyone to read my mind. It had to be a bad night.  Maybe, I will try again in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter Chicken

tcr0oU7qealyqdWBZaoXfw.text: I hate that I have to give this review as there are so few good ethnic restaurants in Henderson. I have done take out from here on five or so occasions and my gf and I decided to eat at the restaurant this time. Huge mistake. The vegetarian app was good but was served on a bed of lettuce that was old a month ago. On to the entree's. I had lamb and she had fish, we added the basmati rice and some garlic nana.. Dinner was dropped off by a food runner and by the time we realized her order was incorrect everyone had disappeared. Well by the time I got up 5 minutes later to f find our waiter he was busy playing with his phone and flirting with the waitress working with him hidden behind a partition. Without asking our preference he took her plate leaving my entree, the rice and the nana and disappeared again. Now I had the dilemma of eating my food which was too spicy for her to share or waiting. I decided to wait. Fifteen minutes passed and her food was returned correct but by now my entree, the rice and the naan and the rice was cold. I picked at mine and she ate some of hers but it ruined the night. I worked in the food industry and this was just awful and unacceptable. When bringing the check he asked how everything was and I told him word for word and his response was 'well'. I will not return again which is a shame but wow. For $52? I am hoping the owner will see this and realize he has a near empty dining room nightly fora reason. Cannot remembered service.@

XLb4tWpUBgTedjNLDxKYjQ.text: This place is good.  It's just a little overpriced for my taste.  I'm better off making it at home.

HYelpwCuru6HJWLtNoBaCg.text: The best in Las Vegas; maybe the best in the U.S. The food was incredible and the service friendly and impeccable. Their samosas are exceptional.  And a gorgeous dining room to boot! You must try!

L1APMHCz7iVdtp1fgUGvZA.text: Exceptional food we loved every dish we got. Restaurant is well decorated and staff was really friendly. As authentic as it gets.

iuwDavbteoRBfE7H829FmA.text: Had such a great time at Taj Palace!! Our server Vick was a pleasant mixture of  cute and charming. We were first timers at Indian food, and Vick took the time to explain the dishes. An extra detail not gone unnoticed!!!!!!!!  The food was delicious, so flavorful! All in all, it was a wonderful first experience and we can't wait to go back!

SpdRtKMh0MXKrCzZgHe1xA.text: Pretty solid Indian food definitely the best place on this side of town. Definitely worth trying.

4VJ8TyTXmkGuzq9IgeP_Ow.text: I was in town on vacation, and decided to try this place on the recommendation of a co-worker, and let me just sum up the place in one word- WOW! As a Chicago resident, great restaurants are nothing new to me. But this is hands down the best Indian cuisine I have ever had! I highly recommend the Mango Chicken, and even moreso the Mint Chicken, which is quite possibly the best Indian chicken dish I've ever had.   The decor was nice, and the waiters very attentive; my glass was never below half full, and let me tell you, I was guzzling iced tea due to the heat from the dishes (I was asked how spicy I wanted my dishes on a 1-10 scale, and ordered an 8. I hear if you're really adventurous or just plan masochistic, you can go off the scale!)  In short, don't hesitate to try this place. It's nothing short of exquisite!!!

hXbmTUYNbtivcGoAJRIeeQ.text: This is our favorite Indian restaurant in the city.  The staff always remembers us and is very friendly.  The food is so good-the best vegetable samosas!  Plus, they carry Taj Mahal beer.  We have tried many other Indian restaurants in the city but we always end up disappointed.  Try it out, you'll love it.

nUAy-5pEFEsLJtR7DFbsiw.text: Lunch buffet is very worthwhile. Food is always good and fresh and buffet prices are good. Dinner can run a bit pricey so be mindful of that.

WUzaKhZtv5LNb8cFWgAY1g.text: Amazing goat curry, masala mushroom... And above all.. Amazing service...!!

k9Z43Kqi6voep67jV_L9YQ.text: Was here for the lunch buffet. Decent taste, good selection of buffet spread. Would be better if they have a better dessert option.

GNaou_TOP9v0pBGcCCLpOA.text: Checked out this place tonight for the first time. I've been looking for a great go-to Indian restaurant nearby, and let me tell you this place does not disappoint. First, we were greeted immediately and sat at the bar to make a carryout order. The server made a recommendation for my bf- Good Ole Butter Chicken... Amazing. Great flavor. I got the Bengan Bharta (eggplant dish) which was also wonderful. And an extra bonus- while we waited we ordered a beer that the server recommended- Haywards 5000. It was so smooth and incredibly flavorful. The servers were perfectly attentive- not overbearing. Overall- great experience. We will be back!

S8slkFQklqfag0hHAwsCzA.text: JUST SHORT AND SWEET to let others know...this place is wonderful in every way.....best Indian food I have ever had and best service and low prices...BEST OF ALL...they do not have a liquor licence BUT encourage you to bring your own wine or beer and they will open for you, NO CHARGE.

1zDYhbUWHenxWxb8f_qZVA.text: Been here a few more times, still great!  Food is the best Indian we've found in town, that's been consistently good.  Service is polite.  Not too expensive.  Love the ambiance.

kBgFRzy0nX_nFE8_Lprlvg.text: The things I really enjoyed at Taj: the decor, the service, the Yelp check-in offer for $5 off $20 or more. I sampled the lentil soup, the paneer tika masala and roti. All of the dishes were good, but I was a tad disappointed in the lentil soup. When done right, lentil soup is one of my top 10 favorite things to eat. Their rendition was a little lifeless.  The masala had a nice flavor. However, one thing that really took away from the meal was the incense burning behind the front counter. The scent was overpowering. Maybe it's a personal thing, but strong aromas (that aren't related to delicious food) take away from my ability to truly enjoy a meal. If we were in the area, we may stop back in to try the lunch buffet, but it won't be a destination dine for us. However, I would say it is a safe bet for a first date if you're looking to do something a little different.

gWBHkD2M3UqUFC0luz_b2w.text: Delicious authentic food . Excellent service. Great staff. Reasonable prices. Beautiful ambiance very relaxing yet entertaining.

gPpI_7mrAA8X3opErPOT8Q.text: Not being someone that has eaten Indian food before I wandered in here during their lunch buffet and was pleasantly surprised with the spread... everything was tasty.. I just wish that the place was a little more friendly, as I was enjoying the food employees kept staring at me awkwardly, I almost wanted to ask if there was something I could help them with? However it may have been because I was the only one in there.... at any rate... I would return because I thought the food was good.. hopefully their employees can occupy their time with something else other then people watching...

9j2GRpzkybzzaCNpteM9CQ.text: Had the lunch buffet here...such a great deal for the authentic cuisine! Everything was delicious, especially paired with the fresh garlic naan. The restaurant is nicely decorated and had a warm, inviting feel. Great place to stop by with a group or even for a date :) The staff was courteous and made sure we were taken care of.

qqHFlrXnnfkL1b-U3xMH8Q.text: I really like the Garlic Nan, We actually ate at the lunch buffet, which is definately worth the $10 price. I couldn't tell you what to order but we had some kind of mixed vegetable dish that was really good.

yCAhgRDA5Bp44UBd3h5QJg.text: I seriously can't get enough of this place. The food is absolutely amazing. I'm a vegan and they have so many delicious options. Nothing beats home cooked but this is pretty freaking close. One of my favorites. The photo isn't too pretty since I had it as take out. - Saag Aloo

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saag aloo

g7IU2XfuUHNlVDYcsGMYtg.text: Just yesterday I enjoyed a delightful dinner at the Taj Palace. I've frequented several Indian places, and this place fairs well among any restaurants you will find. We ordered many and strictly vegetarian dishes for the table and they all tasted fab. The staff successfully showed up to accommodate our needs kindly and politely and we had more than a few which is why I mention it. I enjoyed the meal, ambiance, company, and of course the naan. I've also been here for the lunch buffet and that is really awesome! The buffet has a great selection of really delicious dishes both veg and non veg. They have a fabulous goat curry, my favorite and their tandoori chicken is very tasty! This is a place I'll be back too.

qx6Jpxvuog3LqqyISPMuoA.text: This place is lights out good. We just picked up a late night mango curry. This owner takes pride in flavor. The naan.. garlic infused. Rediculous. Real concentrated flavor. Makes you close your eyes and savor every bite. So tired of ordering shit food. This place is my go to. Try it. Trust me. Every meal wrapped in clear wrap. Hand made. Real Indian knockout.

wtrj9ngELIm91MZY_OYPBA.text: I've been to Taj Palace a couple of times: for dinner and their lunch buffet. I've been to a few Indian restaurants around the valley over the years and that's what I'm comparing it to although I'm no expert.  Most Indian restaurants around town do a lunch buffet type of service and then a normal sit down dinner where you order off of a menu. Lunch buffets are a great way to find what you do and don't like and to experiment how you like to eat the food.  Most buffets separate the food as a salad bar and fruit area, a vegetarian area, and a meat area. I will say that I really liked their vegetarian options. My stand out dish was the vegetable samosa. The pastry was so flaky and buttery and the filling was very flavorful.   Taj Palace doesn't have a huge variety in my opinion, but most of their dishes were good, although a little light on spice and flavor. I did like how thin their naan bread was. I had a couple of dishes that had meat. I did enjoy their tandoori chicken which was most and seasoned well. I also enjoyed their goat curry which was very tender and flavorful.   Overall I feel like it's a solid Indian restaurant, but definitely not the best in town. I like how they have a wine list. The price is a great deal as with most similar establishments at around $12.99 per person. I'd advise they amp up the flavor and interact more with guests their paying or check out process is not the best. Their vegetarian dishes is what kept the rating up for me.

NBeO1bSL38VRUYecjoqeGA.text: My first time to dine here with a friend who also loves Indian food. I heard about this restaurant from an Indian man I met while eating Thai food one day in Henderson. He said it was his favorite buffet for Indian food and I should try it. The ambiance is warm and welcoming, comfortable seating and we enjoyed the Indian music. There was a friendly smiling man standing back watching over everything and when he stopped by our table at one point we found out he's actually the owner. My dining mate and I told him we thoroughly enjoyed our food and I thought the samosas were the best I've ever had. Flaky outside, stuffed full like little pillows and very well seasoned. We both cleaned our plates which is unusual at a buffet and thought the spices and seasoning were aromatic and delicious. I prefer my Indian food a bit spicy hotter so next time I will add some of the wonderful condiments they provide for heat. But honestly, one cannot fault the spices nor call the food bland, IMHO. We both agreed this will be our new buffet choice for our own pleasure as well as out of town guests. Also, the garlic naan was just pure tasty deliciousness and I will return soon for dinner to try some menu items. Give this one a try, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious plate from buffet
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room at lunch
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet separates vegetarian options from animal protein

scdjVOMTuE-aN3tIkec0Aw.text: I haven't been here in over four years. Glad to see that time has been kind to it.  Taj Palace is an Indian restaurant in the massive Sansone Park Place plaza on the eastern side of Eastern Ave, near Richmar. This kind of place is still not very popular throughout the Las Vegas valley, and it's the only one in Henderson. I don't actually eat Indian food all that often, and I didn't have it at all on my radar.  Back story time: a friend had invited me to join a small group for a weekly Thursday dinner, but he hadn't informed me of the location. I was ready to go home for leftovers after grabbing a milk tea with several calorie-laden toppings from Brew Tea Bar, one of the newest stores in the same plaza at Taj. In walked one of the person whom I know is in the small group for dinner. I said hi, we talked, and I followed them to dinner to greet and kinda surprise the others. After I smelled the enticing aromas while still standing outside, I caved in and joined them to eat.  Service was oddly slow to start. We grabbed a table but didn't receive a menu for at least ten minutes. At least we were able to chat and munch on some sort of complimentary cracker, along with the two sauces on the table. The tamarind sauce was sweet and therefore easily enjoyed, and the mint/cilantro sauce was also satisfying until I really started to feel the spiciness on my tongue. Cue foreshadowing.  We each ordered an item to share, and most of us also utilized Yelp to check in for free mango lassis ($5 regular price). I loved this drink. Not only did it help to cool the burn later on, but the mango flavor was strong, the sweetness was on the right edge of being overpowering (in other words, it wasn't quite that saccharine), and the hint of cardamom was a welcome counterpoint.  The food almost seemed to arrive faster than the menus. One item arrived oddly early, then a huge platter with the remainder arrived. There was some sort of rice which was either complimentary or was a side dish meant to accompany an entree, but I don't recall which one that may have been. The rest of the items were priced and listed on the receipt as follows.  Chicken Tikka Masala ($16): a very good version of this British national dish (seriously, look it up) which somehow didn't completely destroy my palate despite being ordered as a 7 (out of 10 in spicy level). The protein was moist if not especially flavorful in and of itself, but obviously the tikka masala part is the store. There was plenty of sauce to be sopped up with carbs, so you won't go wrong with this order.  Garlic Naan ($7): one of said carbs. We had two portions, each of which comes with four pieces of the flatbread. It wasn't especially prominently garlicked or buttered, in my opinion, but it served its purpose, which for me was mainly as a "hand" for clumsily shoving food onto my fork. Yeah, I do that kinda stuff if I can.  Shrimp Biryani ($18): my choice. It's almost at the end of the menu, and the full flowery description of this dish enticed me to pick one. Went with a 5 out of 10 on the heat scale, and it didn't really annoy my capsaicin receptors except on the first bite of shrimp, which had a properly cooked sort of bite to it. Biryani appears to be an Indian version of something like pilaf or paella, but the star wasn't actually in the tasty mixed rice portion. It was the raita, a yogurt sauce served on the side. It adds creaminess and a mild acidic element. I absolutely adored the combination and therefore highly recommend this dish.  Lamb Curry ($16): I definitely recalled that lamb curry was ordered and that this dish was announced tableside as lamb curry, but I didn't taste anything at all that reminded me of lamb and only remembered that it was lamb when I saw the receipt. I guess the plus side is there was clearly no gamy taste? Consequently, I would not recommend this dish to lamb fans.  Tandoori Chicken ($11 for a half-size portion): four of the "drumette" portions of chicken wings, reportedly cooked in a tandoor (no, I didn't walk into the kitchen to try to spot the traditional clay oven) and served on a sizzling platter with onions and other veggies. Delicious and not dry. I tried out a squeeze of the lemon wedge that was plated with the chicken, and I'd say the result is different but just as good.  I never forgot about Taj Palace, but I won't overlook them now that I've had this dinner. It is a great change of pace for Henderson residents and could be a good change of scenery for those living across town. I'll definitely have to schedule a lunch buffet revisit to cushion the blow to my wallet.

fG_b0oZFN0u7sa5hig-sjg.text: Great little hole in the wall Indian place! The wall in our booth was less than clean and they played random Bollywood music videos on a screen above the bar (think Britney Spears meets Bollywood) but the food and service were terrific!   My hubs had the tandoori chicken and I had the chicken tikki Marsala and had some garlic naan bread. We also had the chicken samosas - honestly they looked like they may have been frozen (not 100% positive) but they were pretty tasty (and VERY spicy). Everything was absolutely delicious and there were plenty of leftovers for us to take home. My only side note would be I think the naan was overpriced- we got like three pieces for $7 but was yummy either way.   I never had to ask for a refill on a drink - servers were on top of taking care of us from start to finish. Overall great experience and we will definitely be back!

OgoBOQt152UbtbLRt68Ncg.text: Tried Taj Palace while in the south Vegas area and got my normal order at any Indian restaurant, of Chicken Tikka Masala, vegetable samosas, and naan.  The samosas has a really spicy potato and pea filling. And I mean spicy. Like a HOT order of Indian food. I've eaten samosas at many places and these were so much spicier than I've ever had before. The tamarind sauce was delicious, sweet, and slightly tart. The pastry was crispy and flakey, but I would tone the heat down slightly.  The chicken tikka masala was spiced to order (I asked for medium) and the chicken was really tender. Great balance of flavors.  The naan was soft with crusty parts just like it's supposed to be.  4 stars because the samosas were super spicy

AOdRd7exhqrqA3XTkyYhKA.text: Good service snd food is good.  Some a bit spicy but that's ok.   Breads were excellent. I love naan and theirs was tasty.   I've had better Indian food in California but for now this is as good as I've found here around Vegas.  Try for yourself.  Worth the try.

oKwzvHi35D4jBS7i2LYvJg.text: This review is for vegetarian stuff only.  Selection of plates was ok, I would say on the slim side for a buffet, but not bad either.   Its fairly clean, no complaints there. Not amazing, but not sketchy.  The samosas were pretty good, as were the sauces. If it was only for the samosas I would give it a 4.  The problem was the food was totally bland. Sorry, but blanched Spinach with no spices at all is not what I would consider Indian food. The dishes just had no flavor at all, it was bizarre like somebody forgot that part of cooking.   The service also wasn't very good and they kept on running out of plates.   All in all, I would try another place.

mMnMWbsKQqFRSeHq4YB_tA.text: My go to for Indian food. For some reason I have to go several levels up on the spice scale here otherwise it's bland. Usually I need it pretty mild. But great flavor with those higher spice levels. Gluten free options. Always fast service and great prices.

NP0PPBcsvjKd2NMw9Y8hRA.text: Really decent lunch Buffet. Service is good and it's quick and easy.  I ESPECIALLY like that they play Indian music.  When I go to ethnic restaurants I like getting the full flavor of the food and the culture.   So often Mexican, Japanese, Thai restaurants play western rock, thinking that is what we want.  They are so wrong!  Thank you Taj Palace for keeping it real!!

VTyehC_D2L7URX9Xkdpi9g.text: Rediscovering my love for Indian food, I had decided to try this place out after discovering how close it was to home.  This establishment is located in the same lot as Cafe Zupas, BJ's, and Brew Tea Bar. Walking in the spacious interior, I was a little concerned about how empty the restaurant was. However, I decided to stay and give the place a try after taking its many positive reviews into consideration.  There are many dishes to choose from and the menu is very expansive. I chose the chicken tikka masala ($16). If you do not want chicken, they also have vegetarian and goat versions available. The flavorful dish comes with a side of basmati rice. I had ordered a level 6, which usually suffices my sort-of-there spicy tolerance, but it was not as spicy as I had hoped. Though it is a little pricier than I expected, the portion was pretty big and I could have easily shared with someone else had I known before hand.  The garlic naan ($7) that I had ordered on the side was very delicious and paired perfectly with the rest of our dishes. It came out warm and pillowy. I could have eaten the garlic naan for my entire meal if I really wanted to (but then again -- it's bread. And who doesn't love bread)!  Mango lassi ($7) was very refreshing (and much needed after deciding to try my boyfriend's maximum spicy curry). It tasted very fresh and creamy. I think I drank it a little too fast!  Service, though pleasant, was a big lacking. They were there when necessary, but if you needed something you have to wave someone down to come to you.  The food will definitely have me coming back. I'm very excited to try more dishes and maybe check out the lunch buffet they offer. So happy this is close to home, but my wallet isn't as excited!

1panJWyNSDzGTtN4U64eYw.text: Very sad to write this review. I have been eating at Taj Palace for 3/4 years now. I was a big net promoter of theirs however on Sunday I ordered masala and rice pilau (something I always order) and the rice looked weird, different color to the typical yellow and all the nuts were burnt black.  How do you send this out surely you see!  Yesterday I ordered again almost on auto pilot as I eat their so often and it got worse the rice again was weird, mushy and filled full of char burnt ingredients nuts Etc.  The worse part is the curry was very weird, heated up it would not join and settle. The oil was separating, representing 30%. The consistency was way off and the food looked so bad I couldn't even try to eat it.   IMO the chef must have left and a server picked up the reins.  Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me. There will not be a third!  To send this food out demonstrates the lack of quality control, I can no longer trust Taj Palace to cook and deliver food.

vQZix5xAvcuv3-xhzfhgMw.text: The lunch buffet at Taj Palace, at $11.00, is worth every penny. The food here is unbelievably good. Great vegetarian dishes are included on the lunch buffet along with Chicken Tikka Masala, excellent. They'll bring you as much naan as you want; order the garlic, it's delicious.

XwxOz_hgwbNGwpx3CVr7RQ.text: buffet is great for the price (for 89123 zipcode folks) until i came across this odd situation ... well it needs to be mentioned here.   I noticed there tandoori chicken is half cooked. not just one piece , the whole thing there. after i showed them, they immediately fixed it. Not even an Apology from the manager or the waiter. I should have taken some pictures but before i did they grabbed my plate and took it into the kitchen. Tandoori chicken is often seasoned well so you might not recognize the half cooked chicken until you see what you are eating. Tandoori chicken is one thing i like there but they ruined it for me.  I am pretty sure, its not the way indian goat curry will taste. There Biriyani is tasteless.  I like the samosa portion, very filling.  There vegetarian section is not great either.  Indians do not like to taste the rawness in the chicken. Normally they cook it to perfection in Turmeric and other spices. Americans might not notice it but Indians do. if you want to notice what i am talking about, take any chicken piece , clear off the sauce and take a bite and you will find the difference if you ever had a authentic Indian meal at a friends house.  Can not say any thing great about there desert but if its your first time go for it.  There Nan tastes good and during lunch buffet hours , they don't charge extra for garlic Nan.   staff is very kind and courteous. bathrooms are clean.  There is no use of having a TV in there, always some decoration will be blocking your view from any side.  Summary: Overall there is no soul in the food and i will not recommend this restaurant over other indian restaurants like India Masala (1040 E Flamingo Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89119) or Shalimar (4001 S Decatur Blvd #31, Las Vegas, NV 89103)

RH5y3Gte4vqRGvq05RinsQ.text: Excellent service and they made he food as spicy as I asked for it!

7Q9b1ZNdxOtRIz_ICT1b9g.text: I am English so Indian food is part of my diet. This place is excellent. If I want spicy they hit the mark. I am now a regular.

Y8oo0sbVrvpD997-iA1mhA.text: I dont go anywhere else for indian food in vegas after finding this place. Staff is very attentive and polite which is nice, sometimes i go in on a slow night with my 5 year old for mommy son dinner dates and the place is empty so i dont feel like he is bothering anyone. Plates are def big enough for 2. Decor inside is beautiful, date worthy.   I always get the murgh madras combo. I have had it spicy and non spicy by accident when they forgot to ask. I have to admit spice is key when it comes to flavor here but the meat is always very well cooked.. Must go spicy!

MgCI4nDW1YAyTKazNcR1tg.text: I've put off writing a review of Taj for a few months because, dang, the staff was SO kind and nice. I just couldn't say mean things.  But dang if this isn't the dullest Indian food in town.  I'm sorry! I'm sorry! I'm sorry! But, DAY-UNG.  We had the buffet and sat in a very pretty booth with light and elegant (and elephant!) art on the walls. No paneer whatsoever was on the buffet, which happens sometimes and is disappointing but fine, but I heard one of the staff explain to a customer that they didn't offer any cheese dishes on the buffet because people wouldn't pay higher price they'd have to charge.  What? How do the other Indian restaurants do it? (I won't name names, but if you're already on the east side of I-15, there's a well known and Yelp-adored Indian restaurant that has made a point to always serve a paneer dish on buffet, and not just the same old sag paneer, either.)  I see the restaurant is highly rated by many others, and I'm genuinely happy for those diners and the restaurant alike, but my plate of miserable chickpeas and other tasteless vegetables (when Indian food is normally outstanding for vegetarians) said otherwise. Believe me, I'd LOVE to have a reason to visit this shopping center more often (as it's also the home of the super-fun Popped), but what I tasted was so dull that at least four other Indian restaurants in this valley would have to go out of business before I'd give Taj another chance.  Maybe it's better if you order off the menu? Or if you are timid about Indian food? Or if you haven't had a wide variety of Indian food? Or if you're unwilling to leave Henderson? Or if you aren't a vegetarian? (My husband would disagree, but maybe his just-as-tasteless experience was a one-off?) I don't know. I guess I just wanted to break my silence and say, listen, if Taj Palace ends up being your first Indian dining experience and you don't like it, please don't write off the cuisine until you give somewhere else a chance. I've had more zing! and finesse come out of a foil packet.

Bj1IVz0fa2hqgNUaOfeS2Q.text: Our fave place. Service superb. Food Delicious! Reasonable price. DELICIOUSNESS!!

YXOJprKWftzfHtTMmLUDJA.text: Just enjoyed the lunch buffet, which included several dishes I've never seen in other Indian restaurants. The Vegetable Samosas are better than I've had anywhere else,  ever. Service was very good.

t4BucBLZRzHfbiS7c57vMg.text: Darn good Indian food. Nothing special about it to be honest, but it made my stomach happy.

micWvg9-rXZ1RKH4AX-yjw.text: This was my first foray into Indian food and I found it using Yelp.  The staff was friendly and helpful, explaining what each item was on the buffet.  I tried a taste of everything and found the Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Tandoori amazing.  I scooped it up with delicious garlic naan.  I usually love curry, but didn't care for the goat curry.  Nor did I like the vegetarian dishes with spinich or lentils.  I chk'd the menu prices as well and the buffet is an excellent deal.  I'll be going back there soon.

8LXDNU2X8gJMXlhs_eFbzw.text: A narrow menu selection, but good quality. I only recently realized that they charge for rice (at dinner), which I thought strange.

_AkFLPLA7UpZLfImYQ9sjw.text: We are so thrilled to have excellent Indian food so close to home! I can't believe we didn't try it sooner.  We loved the Menu with all the many items not found in every Indian restaurant.  I love hot, spicy Vindaloo sauce, which was cooked to perfection in their Lamb Vindaloo.  My husband had the Lamb Madras, not quite so hot, also cooked to perfection.  The accompaniments of Basmati rice and Naan bread, along with delicious Mango Chutney and cool, refreshing cucumber Raita more than our expectations.  The service was great and the ambiance as well.  The best part was, we had leftovers for lunch the next day! Next we will try their lunch Buffet. We will highly recommend it to all lovers of Indian Cuisine as well as novices who want to try something to really treat their palate, especially lovers of spicy, hot food, like myself.  Their offer of Dine-In and Carry-Out, as well as Catering makes it complete!

EhjSH_VgFMbXviKWWQ3UBQ.text: I love this place. This is hands down the best Indian restaurant I have ever been to, and I have been to a lot!.  The buffet is awesome and comes with your choice of traditional or garlic naan bread.  This is a haven for any vegetarian looking to experience great flavor as there are many vegetarian dishes to choose from. Also for non-vegetarians you can enjoy the delightful scrumptious chicken dishes prepared by Chef Jaipal as well as the vegetarian dishes.  If you like goat the buffet includes a wonderful goat curry. When ordering off the menu I recommend the lamb or chicken  Vindaloo or the lamb and chicken Haryali, but everything on the menu is delicious.  If you try the buffet keep in mind  that the heat factor is at a level 5 from 1-10. When I order off the menu I like it spicy so I usually go between 7-8.  Also the service is impeccable; every one is friendly and every now and then Chef Jaipal will come out and say hello.  If you love Indian food, this is definitely the place to go!

Rp_fUMgTjpe4GHRbohgBuQ.text: One of the best buffets I have ever had.  Fantastic fresh food friendly service reasonable price went for lunch three days in a row.

R5VGBZftjZdrDQUYh3PJXA.text: My husband and I visited this restaurant Sunday night after an entire day of craving Indian food. Well, we couldn't made a better choice other than trying Taj-Palace. the service is great, fast, and firendly. The food quality and taste are awesome,  one portion was enough for the two of us. We love every dish we ordered. We were so impressed with this restaurant that we just came by today again with a couple of our friends. Again, the food is amazing and authentic too, my husband is from Indian origin and he is hard to please, well he left happy and satisfied and we definitely recommend family and friends to try a piece of India is the USA.

rTRDCFMGV-YUiPtDUkzAxA.text: love the food, recommend chicken tika masala (you can't go wrong with this one in any Indian restaurant) want to try lunch buffet sometime.

DSehiWGvmrs5bieqyshZ7w.text: I was really hesitant reviewing an indian restaurant. Since living in LV for 3 years I had pretty much resigned myself to the idea that indian restaurants were just mediocre. Taj Palace completely changed my idea and I think it's the best place for real (i.e. not covered in oil and cream) indian food. My hubby and I have been here a few times, and even brought other friends out here who loved it! Firstly, the food is really fresh which is important. The pieces of meat they serve are big cubes, the flavors are bold and remind me of how my family cooks. We've tried their lunch buffet which has a really big variety of veg and non-veg food, I love that they bring fresh naan to your table! I have to say that we tried their veg samosa  and it was one of the best we've ever had, crispy on the outside and piping hot on the inside. I think i even dreamed about their mango lassi, it's so good. We've tried a variety of their chicken dishes and while they do an amazing murgh makani (butter chicken) last night we tried their chicken kadai (chicken with green peppers and onions) and my hubby LOVED it! I was craving aloo parantha (a bread stuffed with potatoes and peas)  and saag paneer (spinach and cheese cubes) and it blew me away. In fact, the food is even better the next day!  The service is amazing, and everyone is really nice. They remember us from previous visits and that makes it more special when we eat there. Unlike other indian restaurants where we've waited 10-15 minutes to even get water, here they serve you drinks immediately. Also, I would give them an extra star because they are one of the few indian places that serve ras malai which is hands down my favorite dessert in the world. And it was soft and perfect and delicious, I didn't even share it! All in all, we'll be regulars here for a long time!

QZd2m26KBf8AM8nyMtzIsA.text: This was my husband and I first visit to Taj Palace and was impressed! This was my husband's first time eating Indian cuisine and he absolutely loved it!! I wish there was more of a selection of foods to try at the buffet, but what they do have is absolutely delicious! My husband tried everything in sight, and I tried almost everything myself. My favorite was the jasmine rice topped with with oxtail, and potato's and corn. I enjoyed the vegetable samosa very much. The garlic naan was out of the world!!!

HFAg5YWxXjBds5TJYy3s8g.text: Our daughter's choice for birthday dinner.  Unlike some ethnic restaurants the Taj is beautifully decorated, low lighting enhances a feeling of privacy, booths around the walls and table in the center.  The restaurant  is halal, so don't come expecting to order a pint of Kingfisher.  We started with the vegetable samosas, which were perfectly spiced, and delicious.  They could have used a sauce, but that wasn't the presentation. For our main courses we had the rogan josh, a carefully spiced lamb stew, chicken tikka masala, and gobi alou, a cauliflower and potato dish, also beautifully spiced and perfectly cooked.  The vegetables were just barely cooked through, still firm and faintly crisp.  The two meat courses were a little disappointing but we have to take some of the blame.  We ordered them a 5 on a scale of 10 for spice and we could easily have done 9 or 10.  The rogan josh especially cried out for more flavor, though again the lamb was perfectly cooked, the chunks just beginning to fall apart.  The chicken spice was brick red and delicious.  We'll be back.

2eV0z2rPrR_Bq4_q_5kxug.text: Nice to have an Indian Restaurant in Henderson.  My wife and I were going all the way into town to eat Indian food that was not as good.

hpWcs4Lt89vypasmZrsYoA.text: Best curry I've had in a really long time! I actually had a sit down dinner here as I'm not much for buffets.  It's a little pricey, but worth every penny. We had a tikka masala, lamb rojan josh, and the mattar paneer. Each dish was cooked to perfection and had its own flavor profile, like it's supposed to. So many curry houses seem to have a one size fits all base sauce, which ruins the food. Thankfully, this is not the case at Taj. The portions were generous in both size and with meat content. Though it was a little at the high end for a curry house, I do feel as though I got my money's worth.  They are still waiting on their booze license, so at this time, no beer or wine yet. I can't wait to go back and try some more of their yummy curries!

1ARg_EER-gbASiOs5h5HgA.text: My husband and I just went for dinner and it was wonderful. Our waiter, Bobby, was very nice and patient, he recommended and explained some very good dishes. We had the murgh tikka masala, chicken in a tomato and cream sauce, and the mango chicken curry. Both were very flavorful and in combination with the rice and garlic naan, was a home run. The food was good and the service was awesome, only drawback, it was a little pricey. I'm definitely going back to try the lunch buffet.

uOlhSjGxVexVrhn7RBGOAw.text: We were very hesitant to try this restaurant because there had been a couple of prior indian restaurants in the same location that were really bad. On a whim, we stuck our heads in and WOW did it smell terrific! Our family is really in to Indian foods and have traveled in India so we have some knowledge of the cuisine and my husband, in particular, is a bit picky. I must agree with a prior reviewer about the Vindaloo - probably the best I've ever had. Tikka Masala is good, too and the Saag Paneer is yummy. We definitely have a new favorite and no longer have to drive to the sleazier parts of town to get a great Korma! Convenient, nice place, nice people and excellent food.

VQwjODk89DcWTrrqouxXIg.text: I was first introduced to Indian food back in Riverside, California, a number of years ago by my significant other, who LOVES Indian food.  I have to admit while it was tasty, it wasn't anything I was in love with.  We found this place because it is across the street from our apartment complex.  Price-wise, it's a bit expensive, but the dishes are amazing.  My first dish was the Mango Lamb Curry (mild spice level, mind you). Delicious.  The lamb is tender with just a bit of fat and tendon to make it just that more yummy, but not make me feel guiltyl for eating that extra stuff. My significant other ordered a Paneer dish. Also delicious.  A few weeks after we went there, he discovered that Taj Palace had a lunch buffet for only $10.  Yay!  All their dishes were scrumptious. During the lunch buffet, I tried the Goat Curry, some vegetarian platters, and their Peas Pillau.  The goat in the goat curry was as wonderful as the lamb in the lamb curry.  Their vegetarian platters were all delicious and the Peas Pillau was gastronomically pleasing.  We have made several trips back to Taj Palace and will probably be making more! Oh! And one can't go to an Indian restaurant without ordering Naan!

n9bXpPTXyZY83Hm5MF3-5Q.text: my husband and I went to Taj Place, the food was good and tasty, the service was good, we really like it.

f22GtGLz9KJ3-aQ893juQg.text: Wonderful experience -- food is fantastic and service is delightful!

_EMccsH_UzNWthR9ZSWYcQ.text: Been there to eat last Ssturday.  The lunch buffet was awesome.  Very good tasty Indian dishes and delicious garlic naan.

IwFMh8CDPIlse7iKrOQNxQ.text: So someone would call me crazy for yelping this place again and I usually don't even Yelp.  I was craving their food again so had to make another trip there.  I really had a great experience and this time I went with my guests and they loved it as well.   41/2 stars this time because I know the staff is really friendly but I think the person who takes the order just need to speak up a little bit. He speaks so softly that I have hard time understanding so I am just hoping for an enthusiastic person to take my order next time.   I would go again to eat :)

3Ud88g-ija_V7Ntzt1Bs6w.text: The food was excellent! It was a little expensive but well worth it, seeing as I enjoyed everything and had leftovers for lunch the next day. Definitely try garlic naan and there was an excellent rice with raisins and peas that was amazing with the lamb masala.

WLYOf4THah_rtzpUO37kVw.text: Great food!! I have been to almost every Indian restaurant in the Las Vegas area and can say without a doubt that this one is one of the best. Sure it's a little pricey, but they give you huge portions. Food was great, staff was very friendly and took care of everything I wanted. Stop by here, you will be glad you did!!

5d_99NTxL2q6O2MvdWdpcw.text: Just got back from dinner at Taj Palace with my dad. Being Indian food lovers, we're never disappointed by the wonderful traditional food served there. The staff was very kind and accommodating, and even created a special Saag Aloo (spinach and potato) dish as opposed to the normal spinach and cheese dish that a vegan like me couldn't enjoy. We've been there many times for both dinner and the lunch buffet and  the food never falters in its flavor and freshness. Our favorite dishes include the Dal Basanti, garlic naan, mixed vegetable appetizer, and the Gobi Aloo. Overall: Beautiful interior, nice staff, delicious food... just go eat there. Just go.

7c3nSWJ_QGeqiC_561uOdw.text: Really great food - flavor, spice, everything.  At first I was unsure about the price, but  the value is great: a ton of food, enough to share and for leftovers. Everyone that worked there was so nice and courteous. We'll definitely be back!

nF2Emy25AlHyj3Xq_RZIjg.text: Good selection for the lunch buffet. Garlic naan was made fresh and the taste was very good. Great value for lunch.

zMhv6eD_cA2hh_e6OtX9Eg.text: This place just reopened with new management and is absolutely amazing. The owner is very active and makes sure you are enjoying your meal. The food was spiced great and the service was awesome. This is definitely a place you could get into a habit of going. We will be backs ASAP!

bq7YbEfQoQ-7c5qaTsM65Q.text: I enjoyed the food here and the servers were very nice. We had the chicken tiki masala and lamb vindaloo, both were good. The naan with the onions were delicious but the onion bhajis was not that great. I'd go back because it's local, nothing really wowed me.

pSKcAijwp6h-O69lk3K9Pg.text: This is the place you hardly ever finding for Indian food in Henderson area,. I was accidently stepped in to this place to check it out their buffet and, it was their very first day re open for the public after the previous jai - Ho restaurant is gone..i was extremely happy about all the flavors of their food and specially tandoori chicken was the best... Great selection, Great staff, Great atmosphere...

UmQvKrfVGJowFXgmNZ9_Iw.text: Great food especially the goat curry and mango chicken

KieqNK-gvgGdjkDhWSQCkg.text: The friendly wait staff is here to please knowledgeable Indian food eaters. Complex flavors on traditional Indian dishes will treat you right. Check this place out. Recommendations: anything tikka masala, garlic naan and the sagg paneer. Cheers.

9cqf_hejJHcp9InQdxsd_Q.text: Came here fresh off the plane and we were craving indian food so we landed on this strip mall restaurant. I wasnt hungry to begin with but ended up going with the large lunch buffet.
