-ddUxScakJ9UkF1WvrsiwA.text: YUMMMO!! After reading several YELP reviews for local Indian lunch buffets my BF & I decided on Taj Palace. The naan was fresh warm and AMAZING. The service was polite and efficient. The buffet was filled with many vegetarian selections..and (among the many meat selections) an amazing Chicken Tika Marsala. The great lunchtime buffet selections, cleanliness of this buffet and its convenient location make this a five star lunch without a doubt!

BH9ZgWX_5yA6x05uvHurFg.text: Even though I asked for a zero on a spiciness scale of 1 to 10, they messed up my order and gave me a 5.  If this wasn't a problem, the food still wasn't exceptional.  Mint on flamingo is waaay better.

cgvdPUFC4opUfmeiqpnFHA.text: This is probably one of the best Indian places.  The service was friendly and fast.  We ordered 5 different plates and it was all good.  Naan are always good.  At first there was only 3 tables by the end of the meal there was 10 tables filled!  Definitely going back there for the lunch buffet soon.

TlYuc_je_0u3_4fgrOD5fA.text: We visited this place last night for dinner.  There were 4 other parties dining there when we arrived.  The place was nicely decorated for a strip mall restaurant and the staff seemed friendly and welcoming.  Nehil was our waiter and the experience we had with him garnered Taj Palace this one star review.  Another couple came in after we did and Nehil spent 10 minutes chatting with the couple at the next booth, talking about himself.  When he did stop by to take our order I told him that I wanted the Vegetarian Appetizer Platter and he said "you don't want to order that, that's going to fill you up and you won't eat the entree."  I then ordered a potato filled bread and he said "you don't want to order that, take the garlic naan"  as if he wants to tell me what to eat.  I deferred to my Husband who wanted the half tandoori chicken and Nehil said to him "you don't want to order that, take the fish entree".  I asked to speak to a manager and he said none was available.  I then asked for a business card and the name of the owner and as we were leaving a group of men entered through the back door.  I spoke to one of them and told them about our experience and they just stood there dumbfounded.  We left and had a wonderful $75 dinner somewhere else.  Too bad Taj Palace - you lost our business forever.  The quote for this place is "Guest is as good as God".  I think not.

RC7Z7D0HxsB2CEWMR8_r5Q.text: I like Indian food on the spicier side, and they got it just right.  Their saag has a pasty, airy texture.  Overall, quality buffet.

o_TAY3OVXhp2POES5hicTQ.text: Was a little skeptical because my family and I have eaten at quite a few Indian restaurants in town and there have only been a couple that have passed the test. Taj Palace is definitely another Indian restaurant that we will be frequenting in Las Vegas!

U6OlgngkItB7DY8vxfJrGA.text: What a great place! I've been eyeing this joint since I moved here. My wife and I loved it!! Prompt and friendly service, nice causal atmosphere, we will definitely be back!

RjdP7fq9MTs0Gashsz9vhw.text: I have now eaten here several times and each time the food is gotten better. The manager was very polite and willing to take advice regarding the food and seems to have taken some of my suggestions to heart and continues to make the quality better. The cleanliness of the restaurant is excellent. The buffet is a great value and very well done. I would highly recommend this Indian food restaurant to anyone near the area.  Peter

kIyWW5RRrD_qduGng0M3sQ.text: Pretty tasty Indian food. The naan is amazing and I love their tandoori chicken. I don't know the names of all the food but the green stuff was great the brown stuff was yummy and the samosa was great. Everything was pretty good. The lamb was soooo good. The people were nice too

AMXgtkPd4MN3yuPSSoUQag.text: Let me be straight, I love Indian food. What's better than sopping up all that extra sauce with tender naan bread? You really can't go wrong.  We haven't had the pleasure of a  Indian restaurant close to home, so when a friend of our invited us to Taj Palace for dinner it was a no brainer! The decor is subtly lit, and classic Indian culture. Pretty much what I would expect walking into an Indian restaurant. I was quite excited to see the discount for check-in on Yelp! The screams "Smart" business to me!  Our server's name was Vick and he was a class act! He made some really amazing recommendations. The most unexpected and easily most refreshing was a yogurt based mango drink (non-alcoholic). If you don't do alcohol this is a MUST! It was subtly sweet, enchancing the earthy flavor of the mango while wrapping you up in all that yogurt creaminess. I don't even like mango and I was in love.The wine list was pretty limited, but I can't say I was expecting a cellar list to be presented. The Pinot Noir I ordered was pleasing, but pinot's a typically easy drinking wines.  We started with a lamb samosa & chili paneer. Both were presented quickly, and were delicious.  I wish that I could remember, pronounce or even spell some of the Indian names of the dishes we ate....but alas, I cannot. I know, lame! I had the non-veg combo platter. It included Chicken-Tikka Masala - Butter Chicken - Chicken Curry - Dal - Riata - Naan - Rice - Rice Pudding. I went with a level 4 on my food. I like the spice, but want to taste the flavor. My husband tried the Shrimp Curry at a level 7.  The Butter Chicken at Taj Palace is nothing short of incredible. Don't get me wrong, everything was delicious, and I have few complaints. As I write this review however, my palette is overcome with the savory lingering of the butter chicken sauce. YUM! Vick, our server, actually had the Chef make me an additional portion to take home for Naan dipping! What an awesome guy, he's an A+ in my book!  My husband's dish was SPICY, and rightfully so - it was a 7! The shrimp was perfectly cooked and saucy. My only complaint was that his Garlic Naan was quite burnt around the edges. This was disappointing, as I had read many reviews about how great the garlic naan was. Oh well, maybe next time.  And that's where I'll leave you my Yelp friends. There will indeed be a next time. Taj Palace was delicious. The atmosphere was comfortable and classy. The service was on point and attentive. Give Taj Palace a try, your tummy will thank you!

NnRglmjp9C0Jl5LHKqiBDg.text: I recommend this place to everybody who likes to try different types of food. My husband and I went to the lunch buffet. Everything was fresh hot and delicious. The naan bread amazing. We tried a little bit of everything and loves it all. That is our number 1 spot for Indian food. Next time we will come back for dinner. The atmosphere is great. Very traditionally decorated. The service was excellent. All the servers were very prompt and polite. We got water and bread right away. 5 stars all across.

XeisDUFLVGPKsbz4P2p20g.text: Been wanting to try Taj Palace for a while since it's the closest Indian restaurant to my house and I'm obsessed with both Samosa Factory and Mt Everest from my work lunch breaks.  Even though it averages 4 stars here on Yelp, there was always something about the reviews that made me a little tentative.   Well, that and the non buffet prices.  What is it about Indian restaurants and their dinner prices?  They always seem about $3-$4 more expensive per entree than I expect.  Compared to most of their lunch buffet or lunch special bargains, it drives me a little crazy to go to one for dinner and get much less food for a lot more money.  This type of thinking is why my pants I just picked up from Men's Wearhouse barely fit, but I digress.  I ordered the Veggie Samosas which is one of my standards I judge any indian restaurant on, some plain naan, and goat curry spicy 7 out of 10 (love this scale!).  I asked if the curry came with rice, and I was told no, but that I could do a combo of 1/2 rice and 1 naan.  Sure, sounds like exactly what I need.  When I arrived, my total bill was $29.  Now the curry was $16 and the Samosas were $5 (according to their website) so I guess the naan and rice cost $7 or so? (shrug)  Started with the curry over the rice first.   The curry had a nice flavor, it was thick, smoky, and the spice level was perfect.  On top of the rice or being sopped up with the naan (the naan was about what I expect, which is a good thing), either way made me happy.   The goat was tasty, but there were a LOT of bones and pieces of fat and cartilage throughout which was a bit of a buzzkill. It was rare to be able to get a bite of meat without having to constantly spit out a small chunk of something (best visual ever, I know).   I actually would have ultimately preferred it with JUST the curry sauce by the end of my plate.  The samosas were very large and perfectly shaped with a great flaky crust.  Honestly it almost seemed a little too perfectly made which had me wondering if it was homemade or not (I have no way of knowing honestly, it's quite possible it is).  They tasted fine on the inside, but I found the outside to be overly salt or peppered or both.  I'd honestly never had a samosa with so much seasoning on the outside of it, and my fingers were covered in spice whenever I'd pick it up to eat it which I wasn't used to..   The green sauce it came with was good, wasn't so much a fan of the red.  Overall a good version, though I prefer Factory's or Mt Everest's.  Final conclusion is that I enjoyed my meal overall, though I wouldn't exactly say it was worth the price I paid in total.   I did get leftovers out of it which softened the blow a little.  I think I'll stick with Samosa Factory and Mt Everest to satisfy my Indian cravings, though if I'm ever in a dire need for some curry in Henderson (it happens.  It definitely happens) Taj Palace warrants some consideration.

cj-c1VXgjwq9m-rMTaSHyg.text: Butter chicken is to die for.  Get it once a week at least.  Service is always very friendly and fast.

IhfeBeTpgbWmfPvGnN-YwA.text: I love this little restaurant! Everything on the menu is delicious and the service is always great. Their butter chicken is amazing, and the lentil soup has really intricate flavors - absolutely delicious. I also love their chicken tikka and tikka masala - you really can't go wrong with any dish here! And don't forget e garlic naan :)

gFyZ_9pwv576YJM9oiuLjA.text: Great Indian food.  Not as greasy or overwhelming like some other restaurants.  The check in Lassi is nice to have, and the portions are appropriate.  Delicious masala for sure!

oM4-UL6FzDRaH6o1YlbJuQ.text: My husband is Indian therefore I would like to say we have tried nearly every Indian place in town...Mount Everest (watery, monotonous menu) Mint (overpriced, snooty) ...... This place rocked our world. Fresh choice of regular or garlic oven baked naan brought to the table, dishes have been different every time, the range of spices and flavors are near intoxicating. Best rice pudding...ever. Make sure you try a sweet Lassi and the Vegetable medley curry.  Also the deco is fantastic and it's never crowded.

16v8zXzzJdfzK40oKxtD-g.text: This is a review of the lunch buffet, I haven't tried anything off the regular menu.  The buffet is awesome , always fresh with an excellent variety.  The nan is very good, highly recommend the garlic nan.  Service is good and the staff are always on top of bringing more nan and refilling table drinks . They buffet hot plate area is always clean and very presentable .  If you go here you will easily consume a thousand calories or more, so it's a great stop after some good physical activity ;)

RKoeMr6H34_1eWqYCNWQpg.text: Awesome service! They are very friendly and helpful. I Also loved the very relaxing environment. The food is great but I'm only saying that for the rice because I can't do spicy but My husband loves the lamb in curry sauce.

R3dhBR600FYaqhtipQFE-A.text: Super awesome food. Had chicken tikka and kabobs. And had the best beer in the world - Haywards 5000. Great host and servers. Highly recommended!!!

IPWtJqT6ljEOXPwAB_R6JA.text: This was my first time here, never heard of it before.. Just happened to drive by and I was hungry.  I got the $10.95 lunch buffet.  It was soo much better then I expected.  The garlic naan was delicious.. The samosas were great and I can't say one bad thing about all the entrees I had.  I tried the chicken tiki masala, goat curry, and another spicy chicken dish I can't remember the name of.  All here cooked and spiced perfectly.  The spinach saag was perfect.  Only downfall of buffets is you can't adjust spice level. I like it face melting hot but I totally understand why they have to make it mild.  I'll defiantly be coming back to try the rest of the menu.

mVaRW1NeF4qcXKo_gdojqA.text: I placed a pickup order tonight and I'm disappointed that I received a totally different sauce on my mushroom masala than when i previously ate here. I'm not sure if it was pure laziness or what the case was but definitely unacceptable this Wasn't even close to the taste I was looking for. When you pay for something people expect to get what they pay for! Fail Taj Palace not that you care otherwise I wouldn't have received a crap meal!

soZUeGwzNTpG5kLLQdZZ_Q.text: This place is flippin' amazing! The lamb tikka masala is not one of the best Indian dishes I've had...it's one of the best things I've ever had. Period. End of story. Also recommend the biriani and you definitely have to try a mango lassi to drink. Next I'm gonna have to try the lunch buffet, $10.95 all you can eat...yes please!

823yHAoI0Lzq_kA3kL1dJg.text: The best Indian food in Vegas!  I love Indian food so I've tried a lot of restaurants but this place is my favorite.  I've only been to the lunch buffet, which is very reasonably priced at like $11 per person.  You have a choice of fresh naan-regular or garlic.  My favorite is the garlic naan.  My favorite items are the chicken tikki massala, saag paneer, tandoori chicken, basmati Rice, and some other items I can't remember the names but are also yummy. Remember to use clean plates for each trip!

716GACDklvsdTQvU1ghPTQ.text: This is anything but authentic indian food.  My only guess as to how people rate it so high is they've never actually had real indian food.  The flavors were ok,however there was absolutely no spice at all in any of the buffet dishes and the meats were all tough.  I'm guess something has changed in the last couple months since the average ratings given during May was almost a perfect 5, but in the last month the average ratings have been a 3.

WQFq5eJ_WpOEHXL-nw-WEQ.text: We came here for dinner and loved it! The service was good, the food was great! We ordered spicy (between 5 and 7 on their scale) and we certainly weren't disappointed. While I've had better naan elsewhere, I have to say the entrees were as good as any other Indian place in town. Add the nice decor and friendly staff and this place is definitely a winner.

4hzIWD-ow0YtIY4gF5yfmw.text: Being such an unoriginal foodie I have been working on branching out to different types of cuisine.   Indian Food was on the must try list for me. Admittedly my very first Indian food dining experience was some time last year and I failed to yelp about it *insert hand slap here*, but that only means I will have to revisit the eatery (drumming up repeat business) and yelp about it then.  Back to Taj Palace: YUM!  Last night was my second time dining here and it was equally as delightful as the first time. Excellent service, not a glass gone empty all night, food seasoned to perfection and plenty of left overs to enjoy today.   My only gripe menu item gripes were regarding the appetizers, Paneer Pakora and the Fish Pakora; both were extremely dry and virtually flavorless.   All in all, stellar service (the place is rarely packed), delicious eats (if you steer clear of the fried appetizers), distinguishable meats (white meat chicken used, yey!), and delicious flavors will have me and my friends coming back for more.

5hkiRjdQ9JPiZXBO_yltTQ.text: Staff is incredible. The beer was twice as big as expected. Amazing food. Vegetarian super-friendly.

MBRr2_O07_MK3CjObAgaDA.text: Lunch buffet here was solid. For the price that you pay, the quality is superb. I'm no expert at Indian food, but I love the variety here. It was very busy when we came on a weekday, and they were able to accommodate our large group of 12 at neighboring tables. We ordered garlic naan (included!), and it took a little while, but still got it fresh and hot to eat with our 2nd plate. I'd recommend ordering this as soon as you get a table so they can get it started. It's also a plus that it doesn't sit out in the buffet and get soggy. My favorite things here are the vegetarian samosas, chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, and garlic naan. All the other curries are delicious too! I wish the dessert side of the buffet was as good, but we were too full anyway.

Xk7YK5BIdNqx72aesWnlVQ.text: First time trying Indian and it was amazing! Ask for Vishal, great server with a sense of humor.

VRd1HJQFWRpAd6RXdomf5w.text: Excellent food, i usually come here for lunch buffet... never disappoint.

DZb9Xk2n1-TsRkdO2GNnqA.text: So I'm not an expert on authentic Indian...but I'd say this place is as good as it gets!!! The food is exceptional and the service is even better!

9s03IjWxWwx1t529SInJ9w.text: 3 and 1/2 stars actually.   This was the third Taj Palace for our trip. We had been doing Vegas, LA, SFO and were back in Vegas to complete the Hoover Dam tour before heading back to Austin. So we had been to almost a dozen Indian restaurants in the last 10 days. We stopped here for our dinner.  The Paneer Tikka Masala was good, but $15 for it is pricey especially because there wasn't much of paneer in it. Which is why the 1/2 star goes. I should not forget to mention that the Naan and Lacha Paratha ($5 per paratha) were good as well.

mjBUFX1CAsRtyPAFYnAYkQ.text: One of my most favorite Indian restaurants. Their tandoori chicken and butter chicken are to die for. I'd recommend this place to anybody who hasn't tried Indian cuisine yet. You won't be disappointed.

IxKt2zF7Yif8P9LQJ84ohQ.text: Seriously my favorite Indian place in town!! The staff is always attentive, the food is always consistent and wonderful. We catered for my daughters baptism, and the food was a hit!   Be sure to check it out for the lunch buffet! You won't be disappointed!

JGTT-B6VgaErgcuAhngT1g.text: I tried it for the first time last night and it need not disappoint. Garlic naan was AMAZING. They use fresh garlic (not the power stuff). I also had the chicken tikamasala and the chicken mango curry. Both dishes were delicious.

2c4wOa3SVffJ521nnKEpmA.text: Vishal.b provided great service while we enjoyed our delicious meal! We drive 20+ minutes to come to Taj Palace. Some of the best Indian food in Vegas. A must go when friends are visiting from out of town. Absolutely fantastic!

DAwpBd2EfAewQUXIueCwXw.text: Omg! Seriously i rarely write reviews, but practically live off yelp..and this place has been on my list of places to check out for a longgg time..i finally made it in tonight and WOW!  I ordered the Chana Masala, which is vegeterian and a bit pricey at 14$ but worth every cent!  I lived in Kuwait for 3 years which has a huge indian population and also where i had the best Indian food of my life...until tonight !!!  no exaggeration if your on the fence about trying this place out, just go, the food is 5 star!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh native tattoo at Taj Palace

P1I7Hb7BstVmHUfJVfVdAA.text: I think the first sign that it is a authentic place is that you always see Indian people eating here. I have eaten here many times over the last few years and it is always good. I usually come for the buffet at lunch time and love the samosas. They also serve dinner, which can be pricey, but if I really want some good Indian food for dinner, in a nice setting, I'm willing to pay. I see people complaining about their take out orders being soggy or not hot enough.ni have never had their take out, but it is common sense that hot fried food will get soggy in a styrofoam container, and your food won't be piping hot like it would if you ate there. Also, the prices should surprise people when theyborder, since they are on the menu. I recommend and so do several people know. Go n for the buffet for the best value and selection.

ji3phpKiORK0vdv7DD5tpQ.text: People that work here are not very courteous, no thank you, not very friendly, therefore gives you no reason to really return. Food is alright but way too expensive for the quality. The tandoori ckn is a rip off for what you get. Ive had better in NY. Garlic naan is good but like I've said its pricey for the amount of food you get.

0Y304ighRA2YmAMXqbTyWA.text: Best Indian food I have had. The people are friendly the service is prompt and the food is again just amazing. I recommend this for anyone who is anywhere within a 10 mile radius. All hell I'd Drive farther than 10 miles

fz4cCVGGG3zigck9fS7mlQ.text: Whether you like to eat meat or a vegetarian this place is a great place to dine in. For a decent price during lunch a buffet is served and during dinner time it is a la carte. Either one will do the job in filling you up without the "I'm too full feeling." And the service is great. You don't just have 1 waiter , you have at least 3 at all time taking turns and asking if you need anything without that feeling of being rushed.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m45yN4OvFmaGcItHVdv0fA.text: The buffet was excellent. I went for lunch and it was busy.  That's usually a good sign.  I'll be back for sure.

2l7gUn4F2tEttROEcQRY4w.text: Just amazing, amazing food. I did not eat the buffet even though we went for lunch, I like my food spicy so I custom ordered it! And I can't tell you how much my boss and I loved it. Raving!!!

S8MAblx5O1nSNk1xQpnvjA.text: Place was awesome! From the jump the service was on point. Our daughter is lactose intolerant and they were in top of it offering us all sorts of guidance. Every dish was excellent with even our children who this was their first Indian experience, enjoying every bit of it. By far the best I've had in Vegas. All in all, a 5 star experience. We'll be back! Great job guys!

NlH-FCyWk9mbNg-VcTgKMg.text: It was alright. I might come back here due to the proximity from my house. However, I ordered a Chana Masala at the highest spice level and it had no spice at all. It tasted good, but I lacked heat. The naan I ordered was horrible, dry and burnt. Overall it was just okay.

rWQuniek8NUKeKuz8e_eUA.text: So I've been eating here for a couple years now. Always nice food and service. Today I ordered take out because I wanted to stay home. When I went to eat they forgot my rice with my butter chicken and tikka chicken. Beyond disappointed!!! I called them and they said I can drive all the way back and pick up rice..... Then the lady said she offered me rice when she didn't. Those dishes always come with rice. Again disappointed this time around

VFOiQ_eapYeHL9bBjixEpQ.text: Sooooooo good!  We had the Tandoori salad, butter chicken,  and mango curry.  All were equally amazing.   The naan was made perfectly as well.  Great menu full of choices.   The staff was friendly and helpful.  The restaurant is very clean.  Will definitely  be returning!!!!

4GIVyWx554i80CC-mSQeOw.text: We visited the place for a lunch buffet when we were finishing our trip to vegas and were about to leave. The buffet options were limited but still with a lot of variety. Sambhar, Yellow Dal, Mutton, Chicken Tikka masala all were really good. Gulab Jamun also felt like freshly made. Mango Lassi was nice and refreshing. Idly and Saag were the ones that we didn't enjoy much but the overall food experience was really good especially when we were craving for nice indian food after the lack of it 4 days prior to that. Service was good as well. Thumbs up from me

tER0NxBUuhGddMc5Sorg5A.text: I have been looking to try this restaurant for quite a long time, but I must say that I was very disappointed. I came in during lunch hour for the buffet and the condition of the buffet was very bad. Most of the items on the buffet appeared to be very dried and old. There was only three small pieces of tandoori chicken in the tray and it appeared to be also dried out. Actually the best thing about the whole meal was the bread that came with the buffet. My Friend decided she would order just an appetizer from the menu after taking one look at the buffet. The staff seem to be very friendly, courteous, and numerous. You would think that they could assign at least one person to stir the food on the buffet line and keep it looking fresh. Oh well, on to the next Indian restaurant.

BEqKq09R9RZ8YDgPFlCIZA.text: We stopped in for the lunchtime buffet immediately after their doors opened on a Saturday. As of this review, they are open for lunch daily between 11am and 3pm. They also have dinner hours.  Shortly upon entering, the entire restaurant was full and understandably so. The service and quality here are first-rate and the space is super-clean and stylish. The food here is truly excellent and their Masala chai is among the best I've had in recent memory. The only criticism is with their lack of variety; especially among their dessert options. Several dessert items such as Gulab jamun, included on their dinner menu, were missing from the lunchtime buffet-only option.   Overall: 4-5 stars for Taj Palace in Henderson, NV.

O2XTf04CeQT0eZraLLwOXQ.text: Best butter chicken in town!!! We visited the restaurant on Monday night and ordered butter chicken (Good Ol' Butter Chicken), Karahi Chicken and two different kinds of naan. Karahi Chicken lacked some flavor, but butter chicken was as good as it can be.  The restaurant wasn't crowded and service was really good as well.

bGGz73tRkfYC2nJci0IDkQ.text: Love this restaurant. My family goes at least once a week. The staff is always friendly and willing to make suggestions on new dishes to try. The food is delicious and the atmosphere is inviting.  Always our go-to for Indian cuisine.

NyNtZ5K6of3uWqp_gGHksw.text: Had a wonderful dining experience here at Taj Palace.  We started with the vegetarian platter.  It was so good. Perfect for two.  My husband has the Bengan Bharta and it was amazing.  It came with rice and was so much we took more than half home. I had the Vegetable Biryam... all I can say is WOW.  Perfect seasoned and spiced just right. Come for the food and service, both are great

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AJ7MFU2sohdCILAzbFyPHQ.text: I was really excited to come back. First experience was good.   Came for the buffet. Everything was so flavorless. Asked for plain naan. Guy can't understand me and brought garlic. Asked for mint sauce and he kept saying they are bringing it. After asking again, the guy said it was at the buffet.   Really dissatisfied and taste was below par. Tasted like watered down curry. I'm pretty sure prison Indian food would've been better. Good thing it was only $11.95.  Then they charged me for 2 people when it was just 1. Like um  Hello do you see anyone sitting with me.   Beer was the only thing good.

CeUuNyjRh_w0CeVls4vzSA.text: Really good food and the pricing isn't too bad. The chicken tikka masala was great with the complementary rice. Ordered naan bread and used the masala sauce to dip in. 5 stars because I loved the seasoning of the food and enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant.

zywbQzLV2l-Y4_48Xk36Kw.text: Came here for dinner, and the food was pretty good. Chicken tikka masala was solid. The flavors were great, but the quality of the chicken wasn't the greatest. Almost tasted like frozen chicken. The lamb curry was delicious, and the meat was really tender. The portions of the garlic naan were smaller than I'm used to, and they were pretty thin. Still tasty though. Sadly, the service was really slow, and the food took forever to come out, even though the restaurant wasn't that busy. The server never informed us of why there was such a delay. They can definitely work on their service.  Got a free mango lassi for the yelp check in so that was nice.  Will I be back? I don't know. I'll prob want to check out their lunch buffet before coming back for dinner.

hsWBJd1y2S4Xtn9dYqfQrg.text: This place is some of the best Indian in town. I really want to give this place 5 stars.. but more often than not the service is absolutely terrible. If they don't forget something it's usually a language barrier and you receive the wrong order. It's incredibly frustrating. It takes up to three requests for a beer which equals to a 30 minute wait and then get the wrong beer and have to wait another 30 for the right one.   I'd like to say that this is only a one time thing, but I'd say something like this or similar happens every other if not every single time.   Bah humbug.

nE1RW639mNZwgYwOSX4XZA.text: Actually amazing food here & the staff super attentive.  Clean as a whistle. Was there after closing one night & the entire staff wiping down every chair & table thoroughly.   Buffet very good... ;however, only 1 dessert choice w/ dairy (I arrived late though). May be more options earlier...  Only reason not 5 stars is 1 chicken ordered &  chicken came out hard as a rock.  I think it was a fluke accident. I will return & update.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So delicious ! Make it spicy
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uoFbhL4ZyjCtQTbSxHLlCg.text: Great variety of dishes, flavors and tasty. We chose them after comparing other places on Grub Hub that had a super limited menu. I grew up with an Indian best friend and her family in my neighborhood and they cooked amazing dinners so I feel well-versed in the cuisine. But when we ordered they got the spice levels mixed up via Grub Hub and they didn't have a drop down menu or any buttons to select the level of  so we wrote them in the specific request area below each item as the four of us ordering differed in our love of spicy foods. Also, we found small bones and/or cartilage in two of our dishes. And our friend who got the vegetarian biryani was put off. I hate to give them two stars as maybe they just had an off night?

XmrIz2QjZi1Gj1rWiST1IA.text: I really loved this place because they have good Tika Masala. Unfortunately I am now on keto diet which means no carbs nor sugar. Tika Masala meal is included with rice which that is considered as carbs. I called the restaurant asking if they have cauliflower rice that they can provide me with their order and he responded no. So the next question was can I bring my own cauliflower rice since it is not offer in your restaurant. The man responded with "NO I CANNOT ALLOW THAT" . What? Seriously? It made me feel bad and now I don't even want to eat there or recommend this place ever! I have been to other restaurants and they let me bring my own rice since they are not offering what I needed. I just wish they considered or maybe adding cauliflower rice on their menu to cater to people on keto

xyMwHLkH6dErjhVVpFpXgA.text: Selection wasn't great, taste was below average, including a subpar garlic naan which happen to be extra soggy.  You can find better buffet options in Vegas/Henderson.

YPAQAaD0mXjPLBXmlfENEA.text: So with the colder weather, how can Indian food not come to mind to warm you up? Well that is precisely how we stumbled upon Taj Palace recently after looking up reviews in the area.  Upon arriving, we were a bit concerned because it was pretty much empty despite how big the interior is. We liked how clean it looked so we opted to stay and we are super glad we did!  So first thing is first.... not much goes better with spicy food than ice cold beers. And we were pleased to see that there was a pretty sizable selection including Indian varieties as well. Only thing that goes almost as well with spicy Indian is the mango lassi which we were please to find upon checking in on Yelp that we were entitled to one complimentary. It was creamy, tangy and delicious!  We were starving when we arrived so we quickly ordered a couple of appetizers while we pondered the menu. We ordered samosas as well as curry mussels. The samosas were a bit dry so we weren't crazy about them however the curry mussels were spectacular!   For our entrees we opted for both the tikka masala as well as the vindaloo. Oh and of course some garlic naan. Both were delicious and warmed us from the inside out.  Decent size portion so we even left with extra for lunch the next day!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zy6J7zp8OK5-Wok6kZEiBQ.text: I have not been here in a very long time, but remembered them being solid.  I had been craving Indian food, and did not feel like driving far so tried them out again.  First with the positives. The service was excellent. They were very attentive and professional.  Also the mango lassi was very yummy. Then came the veggie samosas , flaky piping hot and delicious... But they had put a seasoning on it that was salty ... Which I found odd.  Then the chicken tikka masala was so salty I only could eat so much...this was the same with the lamb korma.  The lamb itself was at least cooked well. Often places can make it to chewy. They are killing the magic of their food with all the extra salt though.  This seems to be a common issue lately at the indian spots I used to like. I would say its more like 2.5 stars, but i couldn't give it three since I really dont see myself going back.  I took the left overs home not wanting to waste them.  I hope i can figure out how to dial down the salt levels.

_HmySgMWfH2mqW7-uP8CKw.text: This place was sooo good! First things first: if you check in, you get a free Mango Lassi drink. Man!! I love pretty much anything mango, but this may be my favorite drink!! It was slightly thick and creamy and very "mango-y." It was so good, I ended up ordering another and one to-go! They have so many good selections that I wasn't able to decide what the heck I wanted. I ended up just asking my waiter what his favorite thing was. He gave a few suggestions, some of which he said were the chefs specialties. I ended up getting one of the lamb dishes he suggested and I honestly don't even remember what it was called. All I know is that it was delicious! I got the spicy level 6, which was just right! It came with a side of perfectly cooked rice and we ended up ordering some naan. Garlic-y goodness!!!! I will definitely be back soon!

fQckCRQCoFmC3U0I8s_bPg.text: This place is my FAVORITE restaurant. Whenever I have a hard day I find myself craving Taj Palace, lol. No other places compare to the food here! I got my parents hooked, and my boyfriend gets so jealous whenever I eat Taj without him. Ive been coming here for almost two years now, it never disappoints!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lamb tikka masala is BOMB

6r2ve5vre2QMNIRo_wl3qw.text: Had a craving for Indian food and yelp highly recommended this place. Called in a to go order and was there within 15 mins. Once I got there, I could smell all the yummy flavors and different types of curry!! I was thinking I should have eaten there lol. Welp, got my food order and hurried home to eat!! Must say, WOW!!!!! This food was yummy!!!!!!! Spicy, flavorful and a large amount!! The bread was a bit soft but that was due to the condensation from being wrapped. Next time, I'll enjoy my food in the restaurant. Great experience!!

UUiT0xuNWmuZ3trtk6DfAQ.text: Great food and service...We started with Veg Samosa-very light and crispy.  Our mains were Murgh Vindaloo and Paneer Tikka.  Both were very tasty and plentiful-we could have shared for sure, but now we have leftovers:)  My husband and I love our spicey food, so we order HOT, the waiter warned us, so we toned it down.  Thankfully!  It was almost too hot to enjoy the taste of the food.   The only downside was that some of the basmati rice was a little crunchy, just mine not my husbands.  Two different batches in the same bowl I guess.   Manager/Waiters were very pleasant and attentive. Thrilled to have a good Indian restaurant almost in our backyard!

Zbj1I3dPB-IRXIBApS5HcQ.text: I'm sad it took me so long to try this place! Great lunch buffet with a mild to medium spice. Attentive staff, very clean and well decorated place. However, I was disappointed that they didn't have rice pudding on their buffet.

v9IkgsFqvKbW8hz_pUh5WQ.text: Best Indian food every love the coconut curry and the samosas are the best! I cant wait to go back.

NhpJdB6lL4uyKlLdw3JfmA.text: Very good quality food and great price. Not to mention the service is very attentive and the restaurant is very clean. They have a greta selection of different types of naan bread. It's tucked away in the shopping center that it's in and doesn't seem to be anything special but when you go there and try the food it's unforgettable. They have northern Indian style & Pakistani dishes and it's perfect for vegetarians.

wWF1gdg20DLX86FLv33W8A.text: I just moved to the area, and this is the first Indian I have tried in the Las Vegas metro.  So I am comparing it to the only other Indian places I really know, in the Kansas City metro.    This place sucks compared to KC.  Nothing was free (no papads given, no lassi or kolfti samples)  NOT EVEN THE RICE.  You had to pay for the rice separately.  It wasn't very good, either.  The food was mediocre.  I can make a better veggie korma and I am a white girl from Wichita, KS.  The service was very poor.   I won't be in a hurry to come back.  Maybe I will try the lunch buffet at some point.   Maybe.

dUKknQVt0qpiD9fUnHPjeA.text: Listen, there are only one or two other indian restaurants that compare to this one in town.  Mint is great if you want real clean high quality indian food with tiny portions.  Origin is great if you want a fine dining feel and you want to pay a lot.  THIS PLACE is great if you want delicious and huge portions.  I would skip any other Indian place in town.

_HPdxGDjghPMA_s2zIQA8w.text: I love Indian food! This place is by far one of my favorite places to visit in the Las Vegas Metropolitan area. The lunch buffet is only $9.99 and the selection is nice and fresh. I love the tiki masala, the fresh garlic nan and the samosa's are also pretty big and flavorful. I'm not a vegetarian, but have to admit some of their non-meat dishes are also quite tasty and delicious. It was hard for me to find a decent Indian restaurant in Sin City, but this location satisfied my Indian cravings and is definitely a spot to check out if you're visiting Las Vegas. Located in neighboring Henderson off of the 215 freeway on Eastern Ave.

42yxrD8DaPPe_TLsF2IDFw.text: Great food! By far one of the best Indian restaurants I've ever dined at. During our first visit, my husband and I ordered the butter chicken for dinner. 2 days later, we returned for their buffet. The tiki masala was amazing.

HmDPkNZYk1ZQnc4qetNYug.text: Ordered take out last night and it was surprisingly fresh and good! The chicken tikka masala, aloo gobi and mushroom mattar all tasted authentic. The samosas and naan were excellent!

IzMVhbbNp4GHrkqsmcnOgQ.text: Came here for the buffet. It was very good until I found a string of plastic in my samosa. There was no manager on hand to talk to. Staff apologized and offered more buffet food but my appetite was lost by that point.

lJJ_p07OMiZazbZzkJCVJg.text: Great food. I love the lunch buffet. I took my wife for her first Indian food experience and she loved it. She talks about it all the time and wants to come back every week. I highly recommend.

GeENWjAKyiRS9yyD_x38JQ.text: Great food and great service! Very friendly staff and right in Henderson! We will definitely be back!

y9Aqc9CZlixXDvPurZ-Dlw.text: We got delivery from here last night. (a Tuesday!) The food was awesome!!  Everything was hot, crispy and very flavorful.  The gentleman who took my order was very polite and made sure to get all of our details correct.  He recommended the rice with raisins and cashew, which was not to be missed!  It totally made the meal.  Everything in the vegetarian appetizer platter was still crispy, not soggy like I expected from my usual delivery experiences.  The portions were generous but not too much to finish.  We will definitely be repeat customers to this fabulous gem of a restaurant.  Maybe next time we will dine in for the full experience.  Thank you for the yumminess!!

YElck8xwwN3ojCRFwTYFfA.text: Excellent service and they made he food as spicy as I asked for it!

G-CwxRTV4lqakQtwlfC0nQ.text: They have a good selection for their lunch buffet (have both veggie and meat options). Always love their dessert options and garlic naan. Staff is friendly.

wCbTNRcElvBvyfS5zz4NOA.text: Very good indian food. Not as spicy as I would like, but the staff offered to give me an extra dose of heat on the side. The chutney tastes so homemade and delicious! Will definitely make this place one of my regular dr in places to go

dq3C90R8B-e2h2NuVpQuIw.text: My husband and I liked the fact that it was close to home, had a very nice atmosphere, extremely friendly and helpful staff, delicious food, and reasonable prices (considering all the previously mentioned perks).  We walked in and were immediately seated.  Our server provided us with menus and asked if we had been there before.  After answering that we had not, he asked what Indian dishes we enjoyed and recommended some very yummy items on the menu.  We ended up getting LAMB DO-PIAZA, CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA, GARLIC NAAN, PEAS PILLAU, and 2 FLYING HORSE ROYAL LAGERs.  Everything was very tasty and full of rich flavor.  We couldn't finish and our server packed up the rest for us to take home.  We will be going back soon and will be taking our friends with us! :)

2wAUzcS8ElnxEM3F6HlXRA.text: For a lunch buffet priced at $10.00 with killer garlic naan and the best service I have seen at an Indian place, this place gets 4 stars automatically.  The food?  Well, it was simply wonderful and amazing and delish and oh so perfect.  I came here solo for lunch two days ago for the first time and found the place to be a hidden gem (to me, maybe not to others).  I'm sure the options might change daily for the buffet, but the first two things I tried were the only two things I ate - because they were that good.  The lentils with rice and the chicken tikka masala - can't go wrong.  For some reason I just wasn't in the mood for lamb, but it looked very good.  This place is good and you can't beat the lunch buffet price and food!

9v-aXvVgTFZeKpvyYqWlrw.text: Most of the time i pick up take out from here, but my boyfriend and I have also dined in at this place. I love their chicken tikka. It's always fresh and has never been overly dry like a lot of places. Their basmati rice is really good and pairs well with any entree. The naan is great too! I've also had other chicken dishes and lamb too. Prices are good, the employees are always nice, and the best part is that they are open until 10, which is later than most places.

XuRtUSa8y-1vjvEI6uO_bg.text: The food is good, but I have to warn you, if your body is not used to curry, be afraid. LOL

Ha5I6pnSkXUiwrktPW4DYw.text: Really hits the spot when I am craving masala dosa or a whole different range of Indian food.  Their buffet is probably the best quality at the best price range of anything in town.  I have been fortunate to have been to India many times and this place is authentic.  The staff are always responsive friendly and are fantastic with my kids (I have a 5 year old that loves goat curry go figure).  Good range of vegetarian (not vegan) options if that is your thing. If you want Indian this is the go to place on this entire side of town.

M6Pm8rIaVQuGUM-Y9YGQQQ.text: I love this place for its great variety of vegetarian dishes in the lunch buffet. They change every now and then and are prepared very well. But I am also a big tandoori chicken  fan. This place used to have the best tandoori chicken ... Perfectly tender ... As red as the napkins. For three months now, and I told them already twice, the tandoori chicken is totally black burned and just horrible. Dry and  overcooked. They told me it is good (Not sure how they kept a straight face). It is totally black and burned and horrible. So if u r a vegetarian, this is the perfect place ... If u like tandoori chicken ... Don't go there. ..

vVHBfPql2z4NE0IH3QTxvA.text: Give me 5 additional stars. I swear this place deserves every single one of them and more.  This is my FAVORITE INDIAN RESTAURANT! Hands down my favorite. I haven't even come close to the quality of food and service in other states. This place holds my heart... and my stomach.   We came in one day for lunch and were simply starving. We took advantage of the lunch buffet and could not even speak to one another because that would take away from the flavors of the food. The wait staff were wonderful and so pleasant and helpful to us.  We came a second time a month later and usually that is the ultimate test for a place to see if it lives up to the first impression, and my goodness it did! The whole table was drooling over it and could not stop eating. The smells, the flavors, the quality of each dish was beyond expectation.   Thank you Taj Palace, we loved every bite!

ydIA5y_yu49SlvSAcb-igg.text: Came here for lunch and received great service and yummy Indian cuisine -- buffet style!  I really recommend trying the Saag, the Biryani rice (their version of dirty rice), goat Vindalo, veggie Samosa, and the Mango Lassi (check in on Yelp to get a free one **during dinner only**).  Reasonably priced for AYCE.  Highly recommended for those who want a new Indian restaurant to try!

WvozKtx-NnYvtI7UX0W4gA.text: My rating is solely for the lunch buffet, which we tried for the first time - It's $10.95 per person, but the selection didn't really impress me. (Maybe I'm just used to Asian buffets or AYCE sushi joints where there is an abundance of items and made-to-order quality, respectively. Or casino places, even.)   We arrived during the last hour, so perhaps that affected it, but the food looked slightly unappetizing to me sitting under the heat lamps.   They serve the naan fresh, though. We got a basket of the garlic variety, and it came out hot and soft - perfect! We were promptly served waters and the setting was clean, and aptly decorated. I asked about the yelp check-in for the free mango lassi, but I guess it's only valid during dinner. (My mistake though, it's stated clearly on the offer.)  My favorite were the SAMOSAS! They're huge. Very filling and I could see the flaky layers. I also had some basmati rice and saag. My boyfriend tried the lemon rice and the chicken tikka masala, which he said was a little too spicy for him. I tried it and I think it was just the amount of spices and seasonings he didn't like.   For dessert, they had this rice pudding and a few fruits. Watermelon was great on a hot day like this, but again, not too much selection.  I'm sure dinner is a different story, but I probably won't come back to an Indian buffet again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. first buffet plate: samosa, basmati rice, saag, and a chicken dish i forgot the name of.

QnFugnpSAtXdxtfWUJ3uHg.text: Love this restaurant! I feel like the servers do a great job of reading the customers, they aren't constantly bothering your conversations but they do ensure that you have everything you need.  I've had both their lunch buffet and their dinner menu multiple times, and there are pros and cons to both. You definitely get more of a bang for your buck if you do the buffet option, however if you like your food spicy like I do, I would recommend waiting until dinner.  My faves are their samosas and the saag. Stop by if you're in the area!

AS8FjG0D6FQ4NAwOIenF4w.text: Perfect! Beautiful interior, nice, location, spacious parking lot, great food! The staff is extremely friendly and will make anything however spicy you like. The buffet is fresh and full of variety! Everything is delicious, especially the lamb and the eggplant, also enjoy veggie Samosa with amazing mint/cilantro/love sauce! Go, the buffet is more than worth it, and the menu is full of surprises!!

3VVIaEgdSwEOiiEoN7MqcQ.text: This Place is great! I've been coming here the last five years and the food is always fantastic (speaking of the dinner not the buffet lunch) The mango chicken curry is absolutely my favorite! But I will say the  music TV they always have blaring in there used to and sometimes still does overwhelmed me with noise pollution. But it's a small price to pay for such great food!

gsOg8tZg68asEgRJnYP3iA.text: Excellent food!   This place knows what Indian food should be.  We ordered 6 dishes and shared them family style. All of it was tasty and authentic.    The service was a bit spotty ( hence they dropped a star ) but it wasn't horrible.  The food overshadowed the service.

MXOUUx6t1yggVa4Rd7emew.text: I was pleasantly surprised last night when we had a hankering for Indian, but didn't feel like driving across town to our normal spot. We decided to give Taj another try from the first time last year when we'd just moved to the Vegas area, we sampled the buffet and was not super impressed. Last night our general regard for Taj was won over.  We arrived around 6:30 on a Thursday night and were promptly seated in a large booth. First, I noticed the Indian decor, lots of gold and jeweled tones, elephants and tree of life, glass lanterns overhead, very nice ambiance. Bollywood videos play on the tv over by the bar (beer and wine), which is always fun and entertaining to watch.  We ordered veggie samosas (the best I've ever had, curried potatoes inside were delicious!), tandoori chicken (it looked dry I thought, but my hubby said it was juicy and delicious), chicken tikka masala (very good, more cinnamon or something than I've had before, but still excellent), chicken vindaloo (my hubby said it was good, but he wished he'd gotten it a little more mild, he asked for a medium to hot), garlic naan (nirvana), rice, and a green salad (simple with lettuce, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions). We stuffed our faces and waddled out happily. I'll definitely go back to Taj now, the dinner is much better than the buffet, as is with most buffets, yes?

Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tandoori chicken
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tikka masala and chicken vindaloo

N6Z0538y_r0WrTFgu91hiQ.text: My favorite! I live in Green Valley and this is the best Indian lunch buffet. I eat here once a week.

QWkJy-0fdBoamlNF8RjmmA.text: I didn't taste the food but am pretty sure I will not show up to this place at any cost. They don't do the food estimation time and kill the time of customers. I willnot suggest this place for any occation.

agVaBvV8Hoovuevi_5d7-A.text: I guess it's a question of supply and demand. The Las Vegas valley has a puzzling paucity of Indian restaurants.  This place....holy smokes.  First, it's shockingly, outrageously priced.    For  $17 you get a modestly sized curry? And have to add $3 for rice?  In other words, $20 for a pretty good but not---by a long stretch---phenomenal entree, at Indian restaurant?!    In almost any other city in America a meal like that would be: (a) better, (b) bigger, and (c) around $13 plus tax and tip.  Absolute madness. To their credit, I suppose, they have some Vegas-sized cajones, or however you say it in Punjabi...

l2X2UnYYyNA5gIniKTbrxg.text: The food here is always wonderful and our waiter Vishal was kind and on top of anything that we needed

QBseTCgf7p54Ez1KDGXq8Q.text: the food is amazing!!! definitely recommend if it's ur first time trying indian food! they have a good amount of delicious food for their lunch time buffet!! if only this place was closer to where i lived i would come every weekend!! i come eat here everytime i'm in the area!! super yummy and inexpensive !!!! plus, the staff is super friendly. :)

eefI3rOAJ5-5Ouwouw-c0Q.text: I'm a vegan and my boyfriend is a vegetarian. He used to live in mumbai and we are indian food snobs. Best lunch buffet that i've tried thus far.

vDIfiD_91dyDGaOLf2v1ig.text: Went here on 3/8/13 with my friend Robin G. for dinner and let's just cut to the chase - we're not coming back.   As we poured over the menu, we waffled back and forth as to what we should order. The waiter came by and told us "First order a drink and I'll come back." I felt like it was a command, not a suggestion! Neither of us cared to drink, so we stuck with water.  It's not cheap so we decided on an appetizer sampler and an entree to share.   Non-Vegetarian Sampler: $13 2 pieces of Chicken Samosa: Unidentifiable orange-colored paste and peas. Flavorless and boring.  3 pieces of Chicken Pakora: overcooked and tough.  5 pieces of Onion Bahjji: mostly batter but tasty.  Mushroom Matar Curry: $12 About 2 cups of a mushroom sauce. Good, but nothing to write home about.  When we ordered, the waiter began to ask Robin what rice he wanted with his curry and what type of naan we'd like. The waiter said we'd be getting some sort of rice with peas in it and asked whether we wanted regular or garlic. I stopped the waiter and said, "Wait a second, does this come with the meal or is this extra?" He replied, "Everything is extra." We said no to rice.  The waiter brought out the naan. 1 piece. ONE piece of naan cut into 4 pieces. $3.50. Really?! REALLY?! What a rip off. When our basket of one piece of naan was empty, the waiter said he'd get us more bread. For $3.50, a reasonable person would assume that meant that the waiter was getting a refill of the bread and they just bring out more when you're done. Nope. "I'll get you more bread" and taking away the basket means charging another $3.50 to the bill for another piece of naan that is cut into 4 pieces. Waiters shouldn't "refill" things when they are charging for the refill without disclosing that information first.  I had the Yelp check in offer. "$5 off a purchase of $35 or more." I showed the offer to the waiter and he clicked "used" and didn't add it to our bill. You know why? Because our 1 entree, 1 appetizer and 2 pieces of bread came out to... $34.59. No discount. I wish he would have told us that our bill was just shy of $35 before he clicked "used" on my offer.   If you want to have a bunch of stuff ordered ala cart that you thought was part of your meal, come here. Very quick to word things in such a way as to convey items come with the meal when they're ala cart and overpriced.   The waiter ended the night by saying, "Was it your first time here?" We said, "Yes" and he responded, "I could tell because you two didn't order much food." Wow. Rude. Maybe if your prices weren't a joke, we would have.   No bueno.

j-XHNZE4r2_-URw_2Kkjwg.text: I've eaten here a few times and it's usually been ok. To be honest it's close to my house and works for a take out option. If I were to go for a sit down meal I'd go to Mount Everest.   However, last night I got a Chicken madras and a Garlic nan for takeout - 20$... That's a bit on the expensive side.   But my biggest issue was the madras was inedible.... I'm guessing the chef knocked the salt shaker over and it went into the pan.... It was terrible and I could only eat 2 mouthfuls.   As it was a takeout, I couldn't be bothered to go all the way back and complain/get a fresh dish.   I probably won't eat here again... I'll make the extra effort and go to either India palace or Mount Everest.

_uj94RlG032uCj6gNFA47Q.text: I enjoyed the lunch buffet.  11.99 per person and it had a nice variety of dishes.  The palak paneer was lacking a bit though.  Decor was nice and it was clean, good service.  Would recommend it!

5MQSTCiylgNWY-QvXyE3gw.text: Another bad Indian Restaurant. Not a very good quality of selections were there and the number of selections were limited as well for a weekend lunch buffet. Dessert section was very basic. All in all, food was just okay, not worth the price!

IilYylX3rXZ0X-AP4SvG5g.text: This place is really good. I had the paneer tikka masala and it was delicious! My hubby got the chicken biryani which was also pretty good. He ordered it 4 for spicy and it was pretty spicy so it be careful with the level of spice.   Dont forget to check in to get a free mango lassie, its probably one of the best ones I've tried. I would definitely eat here again. The chai was good too.

K95XAN3KvQD7QcKSOTPIiA.text: This place is in a shopping plaza next to my hair thing.  They do have awesome lunch buffet.  Compare to others, I think they have fair amount of vegetarian options. All the suces do look yellowish but I can tell the difference.  Some is Indian cheese, some is curry and some is lentils.    I wouldn't say much love about their lamb dish here. Of course I would have very different choices if I am in San Diego or other areas. For Las Vegas, I think this one deserve a 4 stars.  Would probably be 3 if I am in CA.  $14 is the cost of lunch buffet plus tips.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QcdEFkqBBrLTfeRto614cQ.text: Taj Palace has been on my list to try for awhile. I finally made it in recently for the lunch buffet and loved it.  The buffet was better stocked and better quality than my previous Indian food go to for lunch.   Inside we were quickly greeted and seated. A couple of servers took care of us. Both were friendly and attentive. One of our servers was very sweet to my baby, stopping to pay her attention each time he'd check on us.  We arrived immediately after opening at 11am and the entire buffet was already set up with everything out. I loved that they were ready to go and we didn't have to wait for any of our favorites.  The buffet had a truly impressive selection. All of my favorites were on the buffet plus some items that were new to me. The buffet starts with a choice of regular or garlic naan that is brought to the table. On the buffet there are two sections of entree items, rices, and samosas. Proteins include chicken, lamb, and goat. There were quite a few tasty vegetarian dishes too. The last section of the buffet has a salad bar, chutneys, and some desserts. Every item had a clear label.   All of the food I tasted was delicious! Butter Chicken and Chicken Tikka Masala are my favorites. The garlic naan was fluffy and warm with the perfect amount of garlic. What really surprised me was how much I loved the couple of vegetarian dishes I tried. Sauces and chutneys didn't disappoint. I love sweets so the gulab jamun made me happy as an ending to my meal.   The lunch buffet is a great bang for your buck at around $11 or $12 per person.

kCAg2I1vtywY1q7h8veEDQ.text: Sometimes I just get a crazy craving for Indian food. If I'm in the Henderson area, I'll often stop here. I've dined in for the lunch buffet and a la carte menus, and grabbed takeout once or twice. Service and food quality have been consistent, and it's likely I'll continue to go and recommend it.  Favorite dishes here are the goat curry and biryani, and I always get the garlic naan. I like that I can bring almost anyone here because the buffet is consistently well stocked with a variety for various diets, including pescatarian (fish korma) and vegan (several choices). The aloo gobi gets rave reviews from those friends in particular.

VKHJFRh8-fMp5grc7nCGcw.text: Why offer a free mango lassi with Yelp check in and not honor it? I showed the guy my Yelp check in he forgot to bring my drink and I had to remind them that I ordered it. When the bill came they charged me $5.00. I didn't even bother making a fuss over it cuz it's not worth it. Just know I wouldn't come back or recommend this.  Anyhow for appetizers we started off with the chicken soup and veggie pakoras. The soup was okay super spicy and the pakoras were not your typical pakoras. They weren't very crispy and didn't taste good at all. We didn't even finish this dish.  We also order plain naan, butter chicken and it comes with rice.   The naan was overly buttered and didn't even really taste like naan that I'm use to having. The butter chicken was blah, the chicken pieces were cut small but they weren't good. For dessert we ordered Gulab jaman and kulfi. Kulfi was okay and the Gulab jaman is definitely canned Gulab jaman warmed up.  Service was good by only one person the older, short bulky gentleman. He was very sweet.  I didn't get a good vibe from this place. Rice doesn't seem fresh either.. I'm surprised it's rated 4 stars it definitely isn't in my books.  I've had way better Indian food definitely wouldn't come back.

Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup and free mango lassi with Yelp check in. Guess what they still charged me $5. I didn&#39;t notice till after we paid the bill. Annoying

BKx_5VSMJrcq8HpBhHq4aA.text: I was pretty sure I wrote a review about this place before, but I shall write of its goodness.   First, you check in and get a free mango lassi - mango and like yogurt mixed to form a delicious, creamy drink. It's like dessert before the main course. My friend ordered 2 more in addition to the free one.  Peruse thru the menu and there is sure to be something for everyone as you munch on there delicious crackers and sauces.   I ordered Karahi Paneer which was tomato, garlic, ginger, bell peppers in a tomato sauce, spice level was 4. Perfect choice as I was not in the mood to feel the heat, just a kick. I also ordered garlic naan, my friend ordered food and rice came with it. We couldn't tell who's rice it was, so we shared and it paired nicely with the paneer.   This was definitely a "treat yo self' meal, but it was well worth it! Each time I come here, I had the same guy. Any questions you have about the menu, he is sure to answer them  They have a buffet, of which I haven't taken part in, however, I hear it's really good a reasonably priced.

jWsKQnTKDOAZsHE9BH0qEA.text: First time having Indian Cuisine - will be back to try other dishes.   Had the chicken samosas, chicken tikka kabob, chicken tandoori, garlic naan and for dessert we had gulab jamun and was great!   Met Smeet - great place!   Thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tandoori and chicken tikka

CI95q20fUphhMnTCdJZOGg.text: I am a huge fan of Indian food and every time me and my boyfriend travel to a new place, we always try the Indian food there. Taj Palace is by far one of my favorite Indian restaurants out of all the ones I've tried. It is a little bit pricey but the people are so nice and the food is amazing. I always get the classic chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, vegetable samosa, and the mango lassi. (The mango lassi is extremely addicting btw so BEWARE). The meat here is also halal so that is a plus for all of my muslim friends :) This is definitely the perfect place to try if you are ever craving Indian food!

Bi0kDGklgxYLnZjpWD1nDg.text: I've been eyeing Taj Palace for a while since it is close to my house, and decided to come and try their lunch buffet ($12.95). The interior is clean and nice, and service is very attentive with frequent water refills and plate clearing.  The Yelp check-in offer was a glass of mango lassi; it was flavorful and you could definitely taste the mango.  The buffet was a bit small but all of the food was tasty and relatively fresh. The garlic naan was also made fresh and they didn't skimp on the garlic.  I personally prefer slightly crispier naan and would have liked even more variety in dishes or maybe some more unique dishes, but for the price no major complaints.  Definitely recommend Taj Palace for Indian food! I will have to try their dinner menu sometime.

Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taj Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic naan.

y36OxvvFtCU764Dhmre47Q.text: A cold, cloudy and wet afternoon had me craving warm spicy food. I have been wanting to try the lunch buffer here for quite a while so it was a perfect time to check it out.  Located at the busy shopping center on Eastern Ave between Silverado Ranch and Richmar there is plenty of parking. We arrived just after opening at 11:00 AM and it was already pretty busy. We were quickly greeted and seated and asked for our drink order and what type of naan we wanted and chose the garlic.   The lunch buffet is from 11-3 daily and is reasonably priced at only $12 including unlimited naan and rice pudding or fruit for dessert. The buffet is set up in 3 stations. The first station has starters of rice, samosas, cabbage and a few vegetarian dishes. The second station offers mostly chicken dishes like tandoori and tikka masala as well as lamb korma. The last station is a salad bar and the two dessert options.   The definite highlights of the buffet are the samosas and tandoori chicken. The samosas had plenty of filling, the perfect amount of spice and were nice and crispy. The tandoori chicken was excellent as well with lots of flavor although it does stain your fingers. The garlic naan was also delicious with lots of garlic, butter and spices. After we finished our first order they quickly brought out a second one. As far as the chicken tikka masala it was a let down. Really dry chunks of chicken and the sauce was quite bland. The other dishes we tried were pretty good, lots of flavor as is expected with Indian cuisine.   The service at lunch was excellent. Drinks were constantly refilled, staff came by twice to check on us and make sure we liked the food and as mentioned a second order of naan was brought out quickly. I am really happy we tried Taj Palace and will definitely be returning soon!
