R-5GUCh1oc7JZ67XI87SsA.text: Food is good and I was a regular while I stayed in Henderson, NV for my business trip. One point disappointed me is that they did not offer me free lassi which was to be offered on a check-in on Yelp... Yelp said on any order, while the restaurant said its only if you dine in... even if you serve good food, cheating is not accepted and thats my last visit... now i visit other Indian restaurants..

tYHA0OoDaSCdj1lbmUoLOg.text: It makes me happy when I walk into an Indian restaurant and get blasted by aroma of all the various spiced which go into their food.  It is also a treat to see all the the themed decor and hear the Indian pop music.  This is precisely what I received as a first impression from Taj Palace.  I knew I had come to the right place for dinner.  A place that caters to all the senses is alright by me.  I was greeted promptly upon arrival and seated right away.  I walked through the door just a few minutes after they opened for dinner and they were not yet busy.  After I was seated, I was given a glass of water and my napkin was removed from the small plate infront of me.  This is where the service went out the window.  I was brought the two sauces for the papdum but they neglected to give me the papadum.  They must have forgotten to leave it at the table.  They had it in had when they left the sauce.  They also neglected to give me a menu at first.  Once they finally got up and rolling they brought all that I was missing and made it right.  I think they were not fully prepared for me as I was in the door early.  On this visit I decided to stray from my normal order.  I've had so much tikka masala and chicken mahkani.  I've had saag dishes plenty.  I wanted to try something different.  I finally decided to try something vegetarian, bengan bharta.  This is a tandori roasted eggplant with onion, ginger, tomato and peas.  I ordered a spice level 3 (out of 10) and it was about as much as I could comfortably handle.  It was very good though.  All the flavors blended well.  The only individual elements I could pick out were the peas on top and the few chunks of tomato.  Sopping it up with some garlic naan was they perfect way to eat this meal.  By the way, this garlic naan was some of the best I've had.  While the service started out rocky, it finished strong.  And the food was delicious.  For that, a solid four star review is warranted.  As this is one of the closest places for me to get Indian food, I will probably be back some time.  Maybe for a lunch buffett so I can try even more food.

urSO1mextUaT9TaY5dIuxg.text: I have been going to this place for a several years now and there are times when I have been dissatisfied but I had more satisfied times than dissatisfied ones. The atmosphere is always pleasant, and I enjoy the buffet as well as the dinner menu. They treat me like part of the family each and every time which keeps me going back!! Thank you Vishal for being such a good friend to me! Thanks to everyone else who treats me very well and caters to my needs. I give you guys 5 stars because well : I LOVE YOU!!

_M3UfTFyUAusvnrNLW0U3Q.text: I have been coming into Taj for over 2 years.  They have an amazing buffet daily, that is so delicious and filled with variety.  And to go with garlic naan that is out of this world.  I really don't know why have never posted a review, but after today, I want to make something extra; known.  We were having lunch today and my 12 year some how left/lost her ear buds.  We were almost home before realizing what had happened.  We turned around and went back with little hope of someone having turned them in.  We assumed it would be a server that would have found them while cleaning up but again not sure if we would ever see them again. But to our surprise, when we got there, they had found them.  I just thought that they should be given credit and to let everyone know that not only is the food amazing, and the staff honest and we appreciate them so much.

UYGbQF8poWOxM-izBx6KDw.text: We just moved to this side of town and were hoping to find our new favorite Indian place, but we were pretty disappointed by our experience here. The place was about half full on a Friday evening, and the staff was nice enough, they were just woefully inattentive (except for the stoic man who diligently kept our water glasses full). We were seated for several minutes before we were given any menus, which should have been our first warning sign. The food took a long time, but it tasted fine, except for the glaring issue of getting a few small bones in my butter chicken when I was halfway through eating it. Until that point I had been looking forward to coming back another time, and it did not get better from there. Our server never checked back in on us after our entrees were delivered, or I would have sent my dinner back. We had originally intended to try their peshawari naan for dessert (a favorite of ours at our old favorite Indian restaurant), but after finishing our entrees, we were sitting there about 20-30 minutes before any employees even acknowledged we were there, and it would have been longer had my husband not stood up to say hi to a friend who was sitting at the bar. Remembering how long it took to get our entrees and then afterwards just to get a check, and annoyed by the bones in my food, we decided to pass on dessert.  And we weren't the only ones getting the shaft. Our table was near the entrance, and there was a gentleman there waiting quite a long time for his takeout order, and he was getting angrier by the minute.  Based on the food alone (minus the bones), it's a 4 star place, easily. The inattentive service, long wait, and issues with my entree just shattered the experience, 2 stars being generous. We will not be returning.

TxSdfTKWGAy2KTiACP4bJw.text: Taj Palace is a great option if you're in the mood for Indian food. I've tried their appetizers, Onion Bahji and Chicken Samosas were pretty good. The Garlic Naan & Chicken Biryani is to die for! The two is cooked to perfection, ughhh so good! The Chicken Tikka Masala was alright, the meat was just very chewy in my opinion. I've been here twice during their dinner time, but I'm looking forward to trying their lunch buffet special very soon. If you're around Henderson area, definitely give this place a shot!  The only downside I experienced was that the servers seemed bothered when my boyfriend & I had a question about the menu or needed extra napkins. The service was okay, but could of been better.

1Gz8J3SizujrWLuXxecezg.text: Randomly came across this place when we had decided to get some Indian food.   Vishal B was our waiter and did a fantastic job, was super friendly and kept up with our drinks.  We ordered naan and garlic naan, I absolutely love garlic(and most places seem to go super light on garlic) but was pleasantly surprised how much they used for the naan, was absolutely delicious.   We ordered the Buttery Chicken and the Lamb Curry.  Both were great, but the buttery chicken stole the show. Was more than enough food for us and we had left overs, which was every bit as good as when we first had it. We ordered a mango drink and a strawberry one, they were like smoothies. Highly recommend getting the mango one again.  Will definitely be coming back here

gVuuU4jbBSZZASaWbfCdJQ.text: This place is the bomb. I love the butter chicken. I've tried many dishes and they are all excellent. also great customer service

n29tog0o63EsC4S0yNWeQg.text: Food was so delicious & fresh! The vegetarian platter was excellent. Lots of options for vegetarians. Service was awesome. Decent prices! Would highly recommend!

QygSpBWxC1i-BhmKP0m5QA.text: It is the best Indian food I've ever had.   It is high quality all-around.   You can tell they care and are in business for the long haul.    I get it delivered and it's always wrapped in clear wrap so it's hot and fresh and tamper proof.  I recommend shrimp vindaloo, fish vindaloo, coconut curry shrimp and same with fish.  Peshwari nan is really nice.  I will order tonight come to think of it, otherwise it will be on my mind for days.  I have never been into the restaurant.   Thanks Taj!  Always fantastic.  This allows me to feel free to try new things on the menu because I know it will be excellent even if not my favorite.

SH7hps4yVxVwmENfKo3B5Q.text: Always delicious, always excellent service! The staff at Taj Palace make you feel at home and are eager to recommend dishes or spice levels to suit your tastes. The dining room somehow is always busy enough to reflect its popularity but available enough to accommodate without reservations. The wine is excellent! Favorite dishes include: veggie samosas, shrimp tikka masala, and dahl soup. And they offer takeout, if you prefer to enjoy it at home. Vishel B was particularly attentive and ensured a happy experience. We love introducing this place to our friends. What a find!

lX9tTpLS3r4PonUITVjxyg.text: My favorite Indian place in Henderson so far! Service is great and ALL of the food is flavorful. I try something new every time and it always comes out great. I'm thankful they are part of yelp cash back because I place too many orders here lol.

dK4muPHN91kok-CyGLXlcA.text: Is there better Indian food out there? Yes. Taj Palace is great for convenience and leaves you satisfied! They've plenty of options on the menu and there serving sizes are quite generous compared to other joints I've been to.   If you're in need of a quick fix for Indian and aren't looking to drive clear across town, this place fits the bill.

9f_T1_G37f0CXOdDzHyNsQ.text: This is my favorite place to go to for Indian Food. From service to the quality of food, it's amazing. Buffet is from 11-3PM.  The interior makes you feel like you've walked into some fancy fine dining restaurant. I am always seated immediately and water is served immediately. Then they ask if you want garlic or regular naan. Freak yeah gimme that garlic naan. Dip that shii in everything.  My favorite items from the buffet is the tandoori chicken, chicken tikka masala (OF COURSE) and the samosa. There were other curries that were delicious too but I can't think of the name. The samosas are crisp and flaking with potato filling. Those usually go fast. Their chicken tikka masala is the best I've had in Vegas. Like I said, DIP THAT NAAN IN EVERYTHING and this is one of those things that you just can't eat unless you got naan. I don't think they could give me enough naan. Anyways, the dessert choices are minimal to fruit and this yummy rice pudding.   I give them 5/5 on service. Never had a problem with any of them and they were very kind. Food is 5/5 too. Everything in the buffet is delicious, you will not be disappointed.

OE7_uxtWB7OVli8IslzwaA.text: The food here is great and the service is good... A very good ambience and the staff were very courteous...  I had the lunch buffet, everything was piping hot and tasty...  One of the best Goat curry I've ever had.  The chicken tikka masala was also good.  The naan both garlic and garlic butter were excellent.  The navratna kurma was amazing and so was the bhindi masala...  On the whole I would rate it 11 out of 10...  Will definitely be back

FU7gPDwB8MrUO2LPY7qsNA.text: I'm going to keep this review short and sweet, mainly because I have leftovers to eat.  Charles Bukowski said "find what you love and let it kill you."  Well, now that I've found Taj Palace I finally understand what he meant.  I love Taj Palace and since I am diabetic I am going to eat all the carbs on their menu and die from them.  Circle of life and shizzle, y'all da bomb dizzle and anybody that says different don't no NAAN.

NULOU4vyQNKqzCAzJLeo4g.text: My kids have traveled extensively and when it comes to food they are True connoisseurs. Los when my daughter came to visit from Alaska this was one of the places they chose. I am not very fond of Indian food, but this place changed my mind. It's buffet style and the food is extraordinary. What I thought was going to be a dull lunch where I would eat a couple of dishes l turned out to be a delightful experience. The owner is a very nice man and cares very much for his guests. And my kids? They are not that easily convinced and they loved it. Cant wait to go back.

RU8VfRS2uCZMmgQvxF9H_A.text: Im very happy with the selection and quality of the Indian cuisine here. I love the goat curry and the different rices.

n-CHNb2is_TlwTinFkoJtw.text: Loved this place.  We are always looking for good authentic Indian and this place is it!   We went Americanized and got the chicken tiki masala and butter chicken with lots of nan.  All were really great.  The nan was really flavorful.  I especially loved the Garlic nan.  The  butter chicken was a little spicier than the masala, but both were awesome.  Their rice was really flavorful.  They add a few herbs to white rice and it puts it over the top.   Service was very good as well.    Yelp has a deal to get a mango drink for free, so I got this...it was so good!!! I would order that again.

5QlimPdewHTYfUmiafsnpg.text: Came here for a dinner date. Nice decor, clean, and good service. I'm not a connoisseur of Indian food, so I cannot vouch for authenticity, but the spices they used tasted Indian.   Had onion bhaji for appetizer, lamb curry, garlic naan and mango lassi.  Appetizer was good, like onion rings/ straws but dusted with spice.    Curry was served with rice. Also good. Can order spiciness to your preference.   Naan was buttery and crispy. Good, but expensive for how much we got. Not enough to take a star off.   Lassi was creamy and sweet.  Overall impression is good, we would come back. Great food and price!

-Sy9KMA4EIjx5tJF9NHOSw.text: Food - 5/5 Value - 5/5 Service - 5/5 Atmosphere/Decor - 5/5  Excellent, flavorful food. Very polite and attentive service.  Butter chicken - Perfect butter chicken, just the right amount of cream. Chicken is well seasoned and delicious. Served with basmati rice. 5/5  Paneer Makhani - Perfect paneer makhani. Again, just the righr amount of cream. The best paneer I've ever had, the cheese has just the right consistency. Served with basmati rice. 5/5  Naan - Excellent naan, cooked perfect and with butter. Served fresh. 5/5  Roti - Excellent roti, again, cooked perfect and served fresh. - 5/5

YhvWpD4BcASnPjizxVGiCQ.text: Food was of the typical buffet fare. Chicken tandoori, chicken tikka masala, lentil, spinach paneer, etc.  The chicken tandoori was a bit dry, but the vegetable dishes were very good. The naan and rice were freshly made and the service was excellent. I didn't like the fact that they only had 1 dessert and the chicken in the dishes were a bit dry. The lamb was tender for the most part.

4LUkp3ECn5yCpFBIpRvm9Q.text: Slow service, but food is very good. Love the Chicken Tikka Masala and the garlic naan. Never had lunch buffet, but I'm sure it is good.

lLZBbQBSEpEP8QPIQfWB-w.text: Clean environment. Professional staff. Lunch buffet for $10.95 per person.   Buffet has the standard selection you'd expect, as well as the standard plain/garlic naan bread. Taste of food is good; seasoned well and fresh.   Recommended to anyone who enjoys Indian food, and to anyone interested in trying Indian food for the first time.

GyXt8TMz-CsvVO_uPd1rdg.text: The place is clean and great interior. Customer service is fine. These are positive side. Buffet was not impressive. They don't have enough options. 1st Indian restaurant buffet that don't have Paneer subji. They don't have proper bowl for sanbhar. Desert wasn't good. I'd not recommend this place to my friend.

ymsipUxLrFUS6cS3MyvWww.text: Excellent!  What a gem.  Good food here.  The lunch buffet 7 days a week is by far the best deal for $10 and it was fresh food. Good way to try the offerings. My wife and I also had dinner here and it was a little more expensive but outstanding. Tandoori chicken is some of the best I have ever had. I noticed it is a little spicier when you order for dinner which I thought was great.  Also good vegetarian selection including the lunch buffet.  Highly recommend this place.

yMOgETRRyR5UbIN_3HsMTw.text: After recently relocating to Las Vegas, I decided it was time to scout out a place to turn to when I'm experiencing a craving for Indian food.  I wouldn't say I'm an expert, but I spend most of my dining-out experiences in Indian restaurants and this time, I wasn't too impressed.  ***DISCLAIMER: I have left behind the perfect Indian restaurant where I recently moved from and I know nothing will ever compare***  We ordered Paneer Pakoras, Chicken Tikka Masala (spice level 7), and Chicken Curry (spice level 5).  The Paneer Pakoras were fresh and fluffy, but lacked flavor or spice.  The sauce for the Tikka Masala was okay, but no amount of creamyness or richness would save the dry chunks of chicken.  The spice level was pretty good, but if you like spicy Indian food, you better order something higher than a 5 because a 5 is the equivalent of mild (in my opinion).  The Curry was tender, but just okay.  Nothing much to report on that.  My biggest problem with this place is the price.  The Naan and Rice are an additional $8.50, not to mention the fact that each entree item is about $15 a piece.  Yes, you get a lot of food, but that's standard at any Indian restaurant.  The Naan is nothing exceptional, either.  Our total bill came out to $45, which is crazy!    With as many places Las Vegas has to offer me, I won't be returning.  The staff IS nice, though!

VIRRSJ3Lg36F1pedFEkh2g.text: It was my first time here and loved this place. The taste and quality of the food was awesome. The staff was very friendly and the ambience was nice as well. I would definitely recommend this place.

d_XqIdzD6xu-Y_pLgvSEKg.text: Great as always. The garlic naan is the best I've ever had. Always seem to eat at the buffett and always eat way to much. If you are unsure about if you might like a certain dish it's a good way to try something you new.

YSQ8VpdAUQMxVh628IVrXw.text: Best Indian lunch buffet I have ever had.. excellent service, really nice clean atmosphere if you want an awesome  Indian lunch try this place

Mn3gsmhwT7rMN9RvaktXZA.text: It is a well decorated, charming Indian restaurant in the middle of a strip mall on Eastern. Parking can be a hassle on the weekends for dinner due to it being located next to overly popular and equally overrated BJs.  The service is always incredible. The servers are friendly, accommodating and extremely willing to make suggestions to get you out of the "chicken tikka masala" comfort zone.   For dinner, boyfriend had Spicy Vindalo ($15) which is chicken cooked with potatoes, spices, and vindaloo sauce which is the red variety of sauce. It was not very spicy as I believe they modified it due to fear of us not being able to handle the heat. I love my food spicy. The dish was good, nevertheless. I had the Spicy Haryali ($16) which was chicken cooked in spicy green sauce made with onion, spinach, mint, cilantro and green chili. Once again, it was very delicious but not spicy.   We ordered side of gralic naan ($3.50) and it was very good. Also, the server suggested we get Peas Pilau ($7) which was basmati rice seasoned with peas, nuts, and raisins. I didn't care for the raisins and probably would opt for just regular basmati rice next time.   We also shared an Indian variety of beer based on the server's suggestion. It was good and quite large. ($8)  All in all, the food was good and the portions generous...but, the total did leave a bit of a sticker shock. I think I'd opt for the lunch buffet and try to sample more of their dishes.  The service, as I mentioned before, was superb.  I would recommend this place if you are in the area and craving quality Indian food and great service.

2CODG7ydVnSqGpZavWOJ1w.text: Great lunch buffet,great choices to sample all the dishes for like 12 bucks.  And the fresh garlic naan. Was great for me I went vegetarian style on this trip

pINiMMoMosRh_jkGxw4G-w.text: Coconut chicken curry is runny, has little chicken, and literally just comes with that, for $16.  Not worth it.  The curry 'soup' was really salty!  Chicken samosas don't include peas and potatoes, but they are tasty.

1VUFZb6TX7muDSy9fvCgbg.text: Delicious Indian food.  Attentive service and clean restaurant.  I also like that you aren't having to sit on top of other customers.  Plenty of room and able to have conversation at your own table.  I always look forward to returning.

ruaJ_FSvXCQVWtY0kEyiMA.text: I live in Silverado  Ranch and for 2yrs I've been driving all the way to Flamingo and Maryland to eat Indian food. I just was told by a friend that this place was just across the street from where I live. I went today, and I'm telling you it was amazing. Food was great and the service was top notch. You also don't feel cramp. Much more room then the other Indian restaurant. I will absolutely be back again...

ybWP8v7k8c5jSpJ_ycSv5g.text: Went here last week and have to say food is really good.poppadoms, Indian beer and good curries

KnqKbU6H4DzaBKErgU8bQg.text: Great food. Definitely recommend it. Nice rava onion dosa. Haven't had this test for long time. Remind me india's restaurant. Love it

kZqAqq8eSmwVdItvjmDD3w.text: The food is fantastic. 3 stars because of the way they nickle and dime you.  I ordered my meal and they said "Do you want some naan?" "Yes" "Ok, and rice with that?" "yes"  $3 naan. $4 rice.  An appetizer's price for things that should come with my meal. Figured it came with my $15 bowl of saucey chicken. Guess not.

DW2W33SIUiJy55ycRarBoA.text: Indian food at an affordable price and great taste!  Just don't expect much dessert otherwise worth it! Service is excellent and place is tidy and quiet

20LsPwSLNac7l3B6F-Larg.text: I liked it.  Very good.  Spices were excellent.   I really enjoyed the mint chicken and the mango curry.   The tandori was a bit salty and did not like it that much.   Otherwise, I would have given 5 stars.   However, I will return to this place soon.

BTUcxXddM6lHJagcs67paw.text: I come here often when I want a nice tasty Indian dish. They are conveniently located near the 215/Eastern, the staff are friendly, the food is out of this world. Not too spicy, very balanced with the salt and the dipping sauces are fresh. I recommend this place as much as I can.

dA4Fgi3bTE2fUiSvFZVYew.text: We decided to give this place another try and was truly impressed. Service is great as always, but the Chicken Korma was so creamy that I must come back for more. Sometimes it's just about finding the right dish!

yZo2V-7aJMEeRXYDElbJoQ.text: I have eaten at many an Indian cuisine Resteraunt from here to Ontario. So I'd like to say my palate is seasoned. Taj has good food. Alot better than the three other Resteraunt's that were here that served canned curry and canned veggies at the buffet. The naan is great and compared to their competitors it surpasses them easily. The butter chicken is flavorful and nothing on the menu tastes artificial. Ghandi's is still my favorite in town, then Orgin India and this place is third. But if you want a quick buffet that is yumy and satisfies the senses ...come here!  As for customer service they are always great. Very friendly and funny. And I love the open seating.   Over all 4 stars. Dang near perfect.

ZY0D9d9PCy8Ody6tIKb6cg.text: Update: Still no Butter Chicken in the lunch buffet :/  However, I did find a new item that I enjoyed quite a bit - Methi Chicken. The sign says the dish contains spinach. If that's True, then it's not Methi Chicken. Maybe they just figure it's easier to write "spinach" than to explain what "methi" is. In any case, it was good.  I've also discovered Kheer. It's an Indian rice pudding finished with nuts, raisins, and cardamom. For some reason, I've never had this dessert before, but it is absolutely delicious.  Despite Butter Chicken still being MIA, I think a star upgrade is in order.

MrZOPwFo6Fg0LrKgq0lRLw.text: Very nice restaurant! Excellent service, cleanliness and great food!! Tiki Masala  and vindalo were exceptional.. glad we found this place.

bKLJpAnfec8gEiHa3SELUw.text: Excellent buffet - except at times it's hard to find the chicken in the butter chicken. Eaten lots of Indian food in Vancouver and Calgary - both with substantial Sikh and Hindu populations.  The nans (bread) is very fresh, and the Mango lassi (yogurt shakes) are excellent. Can't speak for dinner as I've never been here for dinner.

66sXqwkpS-IBOh6KACsK-w.text: Great place for buffet lunch. Unfortunately the same exact food is offered at dinner for 3x the price.  Strangely we were at the buffet and at 315 were told they are ready to close and asked  us to leave.

FOZY1PHY1vpJpTFC6ot1mg.text: This is our favorite Indian place in town! They have the best service and the best curry! We have been coming about once a week for over a year and are finally writing a review. We love Indian and try as many places as we can when we travel and always compare to Taj! Ahmed the server is a hilarious and always happy. Server Kali also is so kind and always makes it a point to come greet us even if we are not in his section. The entire team remembers our order, greets us by our first names and serves the tables like it is 5 star dinning. We are business owners and have a habit of critiquing from that persoective. They have done a great job all around.  We highly recommend this place!

31-rjpe56afT06sTrg2FbQ.text: We've been dining here on and off for a few years now and it's always very good, but today it was totally excellent! The garlic naan bread was extra tasty, crisp, light and seasoned perfectly! It usually takes a few minutes for the bread to arrive, but they were spot on today and it was ready when we chose our items from the buffet. I am a big fan of the Samosas and they have them EVERY time, where as some other Indian buffets it's there if you are lucky. Every dish is prepared perfectly, the service is excellent! The lunch buffet is the way to go, you get to choose from a variety of curries, chicken and vegetarian items. They have all the classic sauces and chutney to satisfy everyone from beginner to life long Indian food diners. The very left side of the buffet will have a few Indian desserts to complete your meal as well as some cool smooth yogurt to cool down a spicy dish. Nice simple decor and they usually have some Bollywood music videos playing on the TV for added atmosphere. Lunch buffet is around $12 and you'll enjoy it much better than getting some greasy lunch somewhere else for about the same price. We love it here and glad it's close by, no more driving all the way into town for Indian food and it's better here anyways! 5 Stars.

a6tQEjoedP7bv216As80vg.text: The boyfriend and I went for lunch based off of Yelp reviews.  It was my first time trying Indian food and it was okay.  Found out I'm not a fan of Indian food, unfortunately; my taste buds didn't have an A-HA moment.  BOO!!  I was really excited about trying something new and hoping to find a new favorite restaurant.    However, the Naan was very fresh and tasty, much better than Trader Joe's (duh Cody!).  So the Yelpers did me right on that review.  The buffet lunch was very reasonably priced at around $10.95 and had a nice portion of vegetarian options as well as carnivore options.  The service was decent and atmosphere was ok.    Seemed clean until I saw the employee transferring food from his pan into the serving pan with his bare hand.  Not a good moment for me, being a germ-a-phobe and immediately stopped eating.  I didn't share this with my boyfriend in an effort not to completely ruin lunch and the fact that he thinks I'm a little OCD.  Had it not been for this incident, I would have probably said it was an Okay lunch.    Probably won't be re-visiting Taj

4ZYmPfIuBtFl3gC8B0pntA.text: I LOVE it here. Exceptional service, and AMAZING food! I crave it almost every day. I've been to India before and this is AUTHENTIC Indian cuisine. I love the afternoon buffets. Absolutely delicious and I stuff myself silly. I just wish there was dessert at the buffet!

TEWdO3cFrusnkSpp2tBWeg.text: I have never tried Indian Food before, so I was excited. When my friend and I walked in at first we thought it was dead but when we came inside there was actually a lot of people.   The service was GREAT!! They are very attentive and very helpful. I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala and my friend ordered the Lamb Mango Curry. Both dishes was delicious.  Have to order the Peas Pillau and the Garlic Naan. And their Mango Lasse was very refreshing.   My friend and I loves to eat and try new places, since this was my first time trying Indian food. I would definitely let my friends know about this place and I would come back to try more of their dishes.

VmyAgnkecfAkESM9KT4SZw.text: Awesome food.. stopped here returning from grand canyon to delight ourselves... Tried kadai paneer 10 spies n garlic naan  reminded me mumbai..friendly staff n elegant decor

G3jnymyTT34US7937vYK1g.text: Have been here a few times. One of the best Indian restaurant on the south side. I have done their buffet as well as their dinner, they are both up to my standard. Chicken TIkka and Malai koftas are my fav. Their mango lassi is always da bomb.

2tHtxwcLf_dig8kL3XatPQ.text: Before I begin, I would like to mention that the lunch buffet at Taj does include Naans AND Samosas which for me is a huge bonus because most Indian buffets will charge you an arm and leg for 2 measly samosas. I called around to different Indian Restaurants inquiring about the lunch buffet and this place has the most competitive price at around $10 or $11.95 out the door. It may be a bit of a drive coming from the Eastside but its well worth it for me. Being a brown myself, I grew up on this type of food and after going to Mint India the day before which had food trays mostly empty, this place is way better. The waiters are nice, the food is always well stocked, tastes good, and the enviorment has a nice setup. I think until I'm able to go back home to Cali in a few years and enjoy my mom's cookin, it's safe to say that I consider  this place my home away from home and like a hemrrhoid, I intend pop up frequently and unexpected.

M1flF9KgvlFaQXOFWsoIdg.text: This place continues to be a wonderful eating establishment. Wonderful staff, super cheap lunch buffet with great choices.  We finally got the time to check out the dinner menu. It was wonderful. The menu had so much to choose from. And we tried new breads that we never even heard of. Lots of fun, nice atmosphere too.  Be warned the dinner entrees are huge, most likely intended to share. We overbought the first time expecting a cat dish of curry, we should have known better. All portions were well made and generous. They offer a few meal deals at night. The soup was wonderful.  We have been coming here since 2011 and never got sick. Which is a big deal for us. :) We have never had lousy service, the new manager is always smiling. Wonderful place. Recommended.

UOODoMj3WK549jdVsMrhuA.text: Hands down the best Indian food in Vegas. Awesome staff,  awesome food equals awesome place. Everything was delicious and is consistently.

Yd2DY8jD73dba2dQ1ZeB-w.text: Great food, good selection of veg curries at buffet (choose from 6).  Fresh and tasty garlic naan.  Tastefully done interiors and decor.  Clean bathroom with diaper changing station.  Our little one was sleeping, she woke up 10 mins before 3 pm (close) and they accommodated us for 15 mins after close while she ate.

FkC1z3TrN1XTYsVRBpcakQ.text: After a 3 day hectic trip we were back to Vegas and decided to pick our dinner from this restaurant. Some parathas, a gravy and a biryani. We reach home drop dead tired and sit for dinner. Here is what I find, all d breads had such a foul smell and were burnt. It was like the dough had gone bad but the chef still decided to go ahead and made the breads from that. We could have ignored the burn on the breads but the smell. So at 10 in the night even after spending more than 60 bucks for two, we had nothing to eat. (Gravy n biryani were not too great) I was really upset,  the breads went into the dustbin but I preserved one of them in the fridge to show them the next day. Nobody has the time to do that but I decided to as I was reallly upset. So when I took the bread to the restaurant and they were like do u need anymore food. I asked them to refund and the waiter Raj brings $3 for the one bread I had brought to them. I was really taken aback by his audacity to say that. Sorry that I didnt pick them from the dustbin and brought all of it.  I guess mistakes happen but how you handle them shows your character.

98waxbUUUhTvee0J-XS2zw.text: This place can't accommodate large groups. So people with large groups think twice before going there. Waiters there are very arrogant. They think they are the only restaurant in Las Vegas..

AOiQ7GXnPjP-hqlnZ84MCQ.text: LOVE this place.. their menu is pretty pricey though! Very helpful staff! I always leave with more food than I should probably be getting! Definitely give their lunch buffet a shot!
